original: 'di la dogs pa mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la dogs pa mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not doubt this,

original: bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúOrdinary people are also inconceivable in the same way.‚Äù

original: blo bzang pos smra bar 'dod pa thugs su chud nas 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: blo bzang pos smra bar 'dod pa thugs su chud nas 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: Understanding that BhadrapƒÅla wanted to say this, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ assented, saying, ‚ÄúThat is so!‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
translated: Why is that? is a challenge.

original: rgol ba su yang med par gnyis kyis lan 'debs pa gnyis smras zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgol ba su yang med par gnyis kyis lan 'debs pa gnyis smras zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no one to challenge, so the two answers are spoken by two people.üîΩThat is what it means.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis blo bzang po'i brjod par 'dod pa ston pa ni 'di ltar bsam pa thams cad ni bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis blo bzang po'i brjod par 'dod pa ston pa ni 'di ltar bsam pa thams cad ni bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord‚Äôs teaching of what BhadrapƒÅla wanted to say is this: ‚ÄúAll thoughts are inconceivable.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this.

original: ji tsam ji tsam du rnam par shes pa sems pa'i ngo bo 'am /
analyzed: ji tsam ji tsam du rnam par shes pa sems pa'i ngo bo 'am /
translated: To the extent that consciousness has the nature of thought,

original: gzhan yang rung 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba de tsam de tsam du de don gzhan yin par mngon par zhen te 'byung ba yin yang rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la 'chel ba kho na yin gyi /üîΩdon gzhan gyi ngo bo la reg ste 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung 'ga' zhig la 'byung ba de tsam de tsam du de don gzhan yin par mngon par zhen te 'byung ba yin yang rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo tsam la 'chel ba kho na yin gyi / don gzhan gyi ngo bo la reg ste 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is only the form of the cognition that appears, not the form of something else.

original: 'di ltar don gzhan gyi ngo bo ni de'i ma yin na ji ltar des ma myong ba'i ngo bo la don rjes su myong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gzhan gyi ngo bo ni de'i ma yin na ji ltar des ma myong ba'i ngo bo la don rjes su myong ba zhes bya /
translated: For if the form of something else is not that of the cognition, how can the cognition be said to experience an object whose form it does not experience?

original: de bas na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad ni bsam pa las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa thams cad ni bsam pa las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all ordinary people and so on are beyond the scope of thought.

original: khyad par du bzhag pa ni de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du bzhag pa ni de kho na nyid khong du ma chud pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúnot penetrating reality‚Äù teaches the establishment of the distinction.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi mngon par zhen pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi mngon par zhen pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthought‚Äù is taught in accordance with the adherence of others.

original: dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of the abiding reality.

original: ma bkag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bkag par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For if it were, it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be refuted.

original: bdag gis brjod par 'dod pa ni 'di kho na yin no zhes rang gi brjod par 'dod pa chig zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni gal te dngos po'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / so so'i skye bo yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin na /üîΩ'o na dang po 'dri ba'i tshe ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam @134a * //
analyzed: bdag gis brjod par 'dod pa ni 'di kho na yin no zhes rang gi brjod par 'dod pa chig zur gyis bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ni gal te dngos po'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / so so'i skye bo yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin na / 'o na dang po 'dri ba'i tshe ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bsam @134a * //
translated: If the nature of the phenomena of entities and the nature of ordinary beings are inconceivable,

original: gyis mi lang ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gtan tshigs ci'i slad du de skad bka' stsal /
analyzed: gyis mi lang ba de bzhin du so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bsam gyis mi lang ba yin nam zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gtan tshigs ci'i slad du de skad bka' stsal /
translated: then why did the Transcendent Conqueror say, Just as the Thus-Gone One is inconceivable, so too are ordinary beings inconceivable, when asked about this at first?

original: ci'i phyir de skad dri bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad dri bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it asked like that?

original: lan du bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du bcom ldan 'das so so'i skye bo nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In reply, the BhagavƒÅn said, Ordinary beings... and so on.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba skal ba mnyam pa zhes bya bar brtags pa yang bsam gyis mi lang ba lags sam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ces bya ba skal ba mnyam pa zhes bya bar brtags pa yang bsam gyis mi lang ba lags sam /
translated: Is the so-called nature of ordinary beings, which is imputed as 'similarity,' also inconceivable?

original: kyang gi sgras so so'i skye bor ma bas kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras so so'i skye bor ma bas kyi zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúexcept for ordinary beings.‚Äù

original: yang na so so'i skye bo nyid kyang zhes bya ba so so'i skye bo kho na'i bye brag rnams dgag pa'i phyir ston pa yin na ni kyang gi sgras de bzhin gshegs pa yang bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo nyid kyang zhes bya ba so so'i skye bo kho na'i bye brag rnams dgag pa'i phyir ston pa yin na ni kyang gi sgras de bzhin gshegs pa yang bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, if it is taught that ‚Äúeven ordinary beinghood‚Äù is not included in the three vehicles, it is in order to refute the idea that there are distinctions among ordinary beings. The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù does not include the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas dri ba 'di byas kyi /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa'i dbang du byas nas dri ba 'di byas kyi /
translated: Why is that? This question is asked from the perspective of the doubts of others.

original: rang gi bsam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi bsam pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not asked from the perspective of his own thoughts. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir lan ni bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni bsam gyis mi lang ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni bsam gyis mi lang ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The answer here is, ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, it is because all phenomena are inconceivable.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shin tu gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shin tu gsal bar byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù indicates that it is taught that the nature of phenomena is extremely clear.

original: 'di ni don shin tu gsal ba yin pas gzhan gyi dogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩde bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa 'di rtogs par byas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir dmigs su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin goms pas
analyzed: 'di ni don shin tu gsal ba yin pas gzhan gyi dogs pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no // de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa 'di rtogs par byas nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bdag dang bdag gi la sogs par rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir dmigs su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin goms pas
translated: Since this is a very clear meaning, there is no other doubt.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la brtson par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di la brtson par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, having understood this inconceivability that pervades all things, in order to abandon all conceptual thoughts of subject and object, self and other, and so on, those who wish to attain nirvana should practice the non-apprehending samadhi.

original: 'di ni thar pa'i grong khyer du phyin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni thar pa'i grong khyer du phyin pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam yin la /
translated: This is the path that accords with reaching the city of liberation.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i rang bzhin kho na ni 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i rang bzhin kho na ni 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: The nature of the exhaustion of all conceptual thoughts is just like this: it is nirvana.

original: gang la la dag kha cig gis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa gud na yod pa kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin par brtags nas de 'thob par bya ba'i ched du brtson par byed pa de dag ni don med pa'i gnas su gyurüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: gang la la dag kha cig gis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa la sogs pa gud na yod pa kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin par brtags nas de 'thob par bya ba'i ched du brtson par byed pa de dag ni don med pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Some, having imagined that nirvana is only the cessation obtained by analysis, etc., strive to obtain it. They are in a useless situation.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar gang bsam gyis mi lang ba de nyid rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na / 'di ltar gang bsam gyis mi lang ba de nyid rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya @134b ngan las 'das pa lags te dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya @134b ngan las 'das pa lags te dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that which is inconceivable is nirvana, in order to abandon all conceptual thoughts. It is not a transformation into another thing.

original: de ltar byas na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na /
translated: If it were done that way,üîΩsamsara would never exist

original: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par //üîΩ'khor ba nam yang yod pa min //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma gtogs par // 'khor ba nam yang yod pa min //
translated: except for conceptual thought.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang shin tu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang shin tu mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is in complete agreement with the statement, ‚ÄúSamsara is not different from nirvana.‚Äù

original: de bas na thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni nyam thag par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de bas na thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni nyam thag par 'gyur te ;
translated: Therefore, those who engage in that which is not the method are distressed.

original: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni 'jigs par bcas pa dang nye ba'i lam du 'gro ba bzhin du dka' ba dang / yun ring por 'jigs pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni 'jigs par bcas pa dang nye ba'i lam du 'gro ba bzhin du dka' ba dang / yun ring por 'jigs pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have entered into what is not the method will have fear, like traveling on a dangerous path, and will not go to the city of nirvƒÅ·πáa after a long time without fear.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par bya ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar khyab par bya ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste ;
translated: Because of that, the pervasion is inconceivable.

original: de'i slad du bsam gyis mi lang ba stong pa nyid la tha dad pa so so'i skye bo dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs par dbye ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: de'i slad du bsam gyis mi lang ba stong pa nyid la tha dad pa so so'i skye bo dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs par dbye ba ma mchis so //
translated: Therefore, in the emptiness that is inconceivable, there is no differentiation into ordinary beings and perfect buddhas, and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa yin par brtag par bya ba yang yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs pa yin par brtag par bya ba yang yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: It should be considered that they have entered into nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: bde bar gshegs par khas len pa dag yin na gang dag 'di skad du 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa dang de dag la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams so zhes kha cig ji ltar yang dag pa nyid
analyzed: bde bar gshegs par khas len pa dag yin na gang dag 'di skad du 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa dang de dag la sogs pa 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams so zhes kha cig ji ltar yang dag pa nyid
translated: If they are accepted as Sugatas, then how could anyone understand that some things are real

original: yin par rtogs par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: yin par rtogs par byed par 'gyur /
translated: and some things are not real?

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'di skad du 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'di skad du 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, ‚ÄúThese are the things of ordinary people,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: de dag ni log par rnam par rtog pa kho na yin te dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni gsal bar rtogs pa dang / lung gis shes par bya ba yin du zin gyis kyang phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni log par rnam par rtog pa kho na yin te dngos po thams cad la khyab par byed pa ni gsal bar rtogs pa dang / lung gis shes par bya ba yin du zin gyis kyang phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are only false imaginations, because they are pervasions of all things, and because they are to be known through clear understanding and scripture, but they are also conceived in error.

original: de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag la 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be said to them:

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur gyis shig dang /üîΩde nas phyis 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur gyis shig dang / de nas phyis 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams so //
translated: All the perfect qualities, such as right knowledge, depend on spiritual friends. Therefore, you should serve and respect spiritual friends, such as the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams so zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa yul rnam par dbye ba shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas @135a * //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams so zhes kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang don dam pa'i bden pa yul rnam par dbye ba shes par 'gyur ro // gal te dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pas @135a * //
translated: Then, later, you will know how to distinguish the objects of the two truths: ‚ÄúThese are the phenomena of ordinary beings,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThese are the phenomena of the noble ones.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di dag spong ba yin na dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni dpag tu med pa grangs med pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di dag spong ba yin na dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni dpag tu med pa grangs med pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa khyod kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: If you abandon these conceptual thoughts by relying on spiritual friends, then you have served and respected immeasurable, countless spiritual friends.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos rnams rnam par 'dul bar mdzad pa dang / bsod nams kyi zhing dam pa yin par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di dag ci'i phyir snang snyam du kha cig dogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / nyan thos rnams rnam par 'dul bar mdzad pa dang / bsod nams kyi zhing dam pa yin par rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa 'di dag ci'i phyir snang snyam du kha cig dogs pa la /
translated: Some may wonder, Why do these conceptual thoughts appear, namely, that the TathƒÅgata is the best of all sentient beings, and likewise that he possesses inconceivable qualities, that he tames the hearers, and that he is the supreme field of merit?

original: de'i lan go rims bzhin du gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i lan go rims bzhin du gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to that, in order,

original: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'dod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'dod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you assert that the TathƒÅgata is the best of all sentient beings? and so on.

original: ji tsam du 'bras bu thob par ston pa la bdag gi rnam par rtog pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi lam gyi rjes su 'brangs pa yin gyi yang dag pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji tsam du 'bras bu thob par ston pa la bdag gi rnam par rtog pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi lam gyi rjes su 'brangs pa yin gyi yang dag pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this conceptual thought of mine regarding the teaching of attaining the fruit follows the conventional path, but is not itself clinging to reality,üîΩit is said,

original: gal te 'di la sems can du yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te 'di la sems can du yongs su grub pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If there were any sentient being established here, etc.

original: sems can nyid ni don dam par yongs su ma grub ste /
analyzed: sems can nyid ni don dam par yongs su ma grub ste /
translated: Sentient beings themselves are not ultimately established,

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: de la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa mchog yin par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa mchog yin par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could the TathƒÅgata be supreme in dependence on that?

original: gal te bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni zhes bya ba 'di la yang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa kho na'i chos dang chos can de dang ldan pa 'am /üîΩ'thob pa'i ngo bo 'am /
analyzed: gal te bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni zhes bya ba 'di la yang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa kho na'i chos dang chos can de dang ldan pa 'am / 'thob pa'i ngo bo 'am /
translated: If there were any who possessed the Dharma of thought, etc.üîΩHere also, because there is no essence of attainment or of connection, there is no one who possesses the Dharma of thought.

original: 'brel pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na de la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du lta ga la 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin na de la ltos nas de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan pa nyid du lta ga la 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: How could the TathƒÅgata be endowed with inconceivable qualities in dependence on that?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te la la zhig bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'dul bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dul ba ni skyon rnams dang bral ba dang / yon tan rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te la la zhig bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'dul bar 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dul ba ni skyon rnams dang bral ba dang / yon tan rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúIf someone were to tame the inconceivable realm, it would be like this: taming is the removal of faults and the arising of virtues.

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba de dag 'dul bar byed pa de las ma gtogs pa gzhan bsam gyis mi khyab pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba de dag 'dul bar byed pa de las ma gtogs pa gzhan bsam gyis mi khyab pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other inconceivable realm apart from the taming of the hearers.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag rang gi ngang gis rnam par @135b zhig pa ni btul ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag rang gi ngang gis rnam par @135b zhig pa ni btul ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the faults of attachment and so on, which are naturally destroyed, are not tamed.

original: yon tan gang dag yin pa gnyen po goms pa yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan gang dag yin pa gnyen po goms pa yang rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The virtues, which are cultivated as antidotes, also become naturally pure.

original: de dag kyang sngon ma dul ba ma yin na ji ltar btul ba zhes bya /
analyzed: de dag kyang sngon ma dul ba ma yin na ji ltar btul ba zhes bya /
translated: And since they were not previously untamed, how can they be called tamed?

original: de bas na sngon sma ma phab pa'i 'du byed rnams la gcig por mngon par zhen nas byis pa yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyi mi bden pa'i blos btul lo snyam pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin pas bdag la ni nyan thos rnams de
analyzed: de bas na sngon sma ma phab pa'i 'du byed rnams la gcig por mngon par zhen nas byis pa yang dag pa ma yin pa mthong ba rnams kyi mi bden pa'i blos btul lo snyam pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin pas bdag la ni nyan thos rnams de
translated: Therefore, the childish, who are attached to the idea of a single, unitary self, think that the TathƒÅgata tames them with an unreal mind.

original: bzhin gshegs pas btul lo snyam du rnam par rtog pa mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pas btul lo snyam du rnam par rtog pa mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: But, Blessed One, the TathƒÅgata does not think, ‚ÄòI tame the hearers.‚Äô

original: gzhan yang skyob pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang tsam kho nas btul ba grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyob pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang tsam kho nas btul ba grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it is established that the TathƒÅgata tames them merely through the power of his nonconceptual state.

original: de bas na btul lo snyam pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na btul lo snyam pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äòhe tames‚Äô is used.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni de dag 'dul bar lan 'ga' yang mdzad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni de dag 'dul bar lan 'ga' yang mdzad pa ma yin no //
translated: But the Blessed One never acts to tame them.

original: de bas kyang bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pas btul lo snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: de bas kyang bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pas btul lo snyam du mi sems so //
translated: Therefore, I do not think, ‚ÄòThe TathƒÅgata tames me.‚Äô

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni gang la yang phan pa 'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni gang la yang phan pa 'am /
translated: Blessed One, the appearance of a buddha is of no benefit to anyone.

original: gnod par yang nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la phan pa ni yon tan gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gnod par yang nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba la phan pa ni yon tan gyi tshogs so //
translated: Benefit is the collection of virtues;

original: gnod pa ni skyon gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gnod pa ni skyon gyi tshogs so //
translated: harm is the collection of faults.

original: nye bar gnas pa ni 'jug pa dang blo sngon du btang ste byed ces bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni 'jug pa dang blo sngon du btang ste byed ces bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: Approaching is acting after having sent out the mind and thought.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'ga' la yang phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis byed par nye bar gnas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'ga' la yang phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis byed par nye bar gnas pa ma yin na /
translated: If it does not approach to benefit or harm anyone,

original: de ji ltar so so'i skye bo la bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnams bsal nas nyan thos la sogs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan par sgrub par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ji ltar so so'i skye bo la bsam pa'i chos dang ldan pa rnams bsal nas nyan thos la sogs pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dang ldan par sgrub par mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then how is it that the inconceivable Dharma is established for the disciples, etc., after the Dharma endowed with thought has been removed from the ordinary man?üîΩThat is the meaning of the passage.

original: de nyid brdzun pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid brdzun pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that that is false,üîΩit is said:

original: 'di ltar dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyings 'di ni gnas pa nyid dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, this realm is just the same.

original: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na yang gnas pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na yang gnas pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is just the same even in the state of the ordinary man.

original: dbyings 'di ni ma 'dres pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsam par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang ma 'dres par gyur pa ste dus thams cad du dbyings de lta bu yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbyings 'di ni ma 'dres pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni bsam par bya ba'i chos dang ldan pa dang ma 'dres par gyur pa ste dus thams cad du dbyings de lta bu yin pa'o //
translated: This realm is unadulterated means that it is endowed with the Dharma to be contemplated and is unadulterated, being that realm at all times.

original: dbyings de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbyings de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that realm?

original: 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is the inconceivable realm.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same as emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩdbyings de la ni nyan thos tha dad pa @136a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / dbyings de la ni nyan thos tha dad pa @136a * //
translated: For that very reason,

original: nas so so'i skye bo tha dad pa'i bar du mi dmigs te kun kyang ngo bo nyid de tsam du mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas so so'i skye bo tha dad pa'i bar du mi dmigs te kun kyang ngo bo nyid de tsam du mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in that realm, the ≈õrƒÅvakas are not apprehended, up to the ordinary beings are not apprehended, because all are the same in that they are just that much of an intrinsic reality.

original: dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dri ma spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dri ma spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'o //
translated: The classification is in terms of the abandonment and non-abandonment of defilements.

original: bar du zhes smos pas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang rgyal ba dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes smos pas ni byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang rgyal ba dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúup to‚Äù includes the bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba 'di la gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dngos po ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba 'di la gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is not a thing, because of the non-existence of a thing. Here, the thing which is the conceptual differentiation of the apprehended object, etc. does not exist, therefore the Tathagata is not a thing.

original: de'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: His thing is non-existence.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang la yod pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing dang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ni rang la yod pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing dang gzhan yin te /
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of a thing, the Tathagata is a field of merit for oneself and others,

original: de ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is his nature.

original: gtan tshigs de'i slad du de ni thams cad pas lhag par bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i slad du de ni thams cad pas lhag par bsod nams kyi zhing bla na ma mchis pa'o //
translated: For this reason, he is the unsurpassed field of merit for all.

original: 'di'i phyir yang bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang bla na med pa yin te /
translated: He is also unsurpassed for this reason:

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu mi nyung ba rab tu sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por gnas pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu mi nyung ba rab tu sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of his extreme pliancy, because of his long duration and because of his bestowal of an abundant result.

original: de dag nyid go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhing gang ba ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag nyid go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir de ni zhing gang ba ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just those, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not filled with fields,‚Äù and so on.

original: skyon rnams kyis gang ba ma lags /
analyzed: skyon rnams kyis gang ba ma lags /
translated: It is not filled with faults.

original: yon tan rnams kyis ma gang ba yang ma lags pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyis ma gang ba yang ma lags pa'o //
translated: It is not filled with virtues.

original: bcom ldan 'das yang de la chos gang yang dag par 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang de la chos gang yang dag par 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, there is no dharma that is established there‚Äù refers to the latent afflictions.

original: bas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten sa'i yon tan dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten sa'i yon tan dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not exhausted‚Äù refers to the qualities of the worldly grounds and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de la sa bon btab pa ni rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de la sa bon btab pa ni rnam par mi 'phel zhing yongs su mi 'grib bo zhes bya ba la ;
translated: ‚ÄúSeeds planted there do not increase and do not decrease.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba ni yul de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni yul de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to that place.

original: sa bon ni de la dmigs pa'i dge ba ste /
analyzed: sa bon ni de la dmigs pa'i dge ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSeeds‚Äù are virtues that focus on that.

original: rang gi rgyud la dge ba'i sa bon bzhag cing yod pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la dge ba'i sa bon bzhag cing yod pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the seeds of virtue are planted in one‚Äôs continuum and exist.

original: gal te 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med na 'o na ni 'bras bu mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med na 'o na ni 'bras bu mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no decrease and no increase, then the fruit would be equal.

original: de lta na yang khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes dogs nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes dogs nas /
translated: Even so, because there would be no superiority, it would not be unsurpassed.

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis ci las bsams te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis ci las bsams te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, what did you have in mind

original: zhing de la sa bon btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhing de la sa bon btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //
translated: when you said that seed is planted in that field?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhing de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod par bzhed pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhing de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod par bzhed pa ston pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, in order to show what he was thinking, said,üîΩMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, that field is not a field.

original: bsam @136b gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam @136b gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable is without remainder.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sa bon btab pa ni 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sa bon btab pa ni 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The seed planted in the inconceivable field becomes an inconceivable fruit.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruit is in accord with the cause.

original: de la 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang sangs rgyas nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang sangs rgyas nyid yin la /
translated: And that inconceivable fruit is buddhahood.

original: de yang 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med de /
analyzed: de yang 'grib pa med cing 'phel ba med de /
translated: Moreover, it is neither diminished nor increased,

original: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unsurpassed.

original: de bas na sa bon yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'grib pa med pa dang 'phel ba med pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na sa bon yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'grib pa med pa dang 'phel ba med pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the seed is also explained as neither diminished nor increased from the perspective of the fruit.

original: des na de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa dang bral ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, at that time, through the power of the Buddha... and so on, shows the greatness of the Dharma discourse free from superimposition and denial.

original: sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: sa chen po rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to zhes bya ba ni las byed pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: The great earth shook in six ways. This is a specific action.

original: rnam pa drug ni rab tu g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / sgra 'byin pa dang / 'gul ba dang / 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa drug ni rab tu g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / sgra 'byin pa dang / 'gul ba dang / 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The six ways are: trembling, rising, sinking, making sounds, shaking, and agitating.

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas yod pa ma yin pas kun nas dkris pa las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas yod pa ma yin pas kun nas dkris pa las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mind is liberated from the defilements without taking anything as a basis. This means that the mind is liberated from the defilements without taking anything as a basis.

original: chos kyi mig skyes pa ni bden pa rtogs pa skyes pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi mig skyes pa ni bden pa rtogs pa skyes pa ste /
translated: The arising of the Dharma eye means the arising of the realization of the truths.

original: shes rab gang gis gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong ba ni chos kyi mig ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gang gis gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong ba ni chos kyi mig ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom by which one sees the dharmas such as the selflessness of the person is called the Dharma eye.

original: chos smos pa ni sha'i mig rnam par gcad pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos smos pa ni sha'i mig rnam par gcad pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúdharma‚Äù here means the eye of flesh, in order to distinguish it.

original: de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is neutral.

original: 'dir ni chos kyi bdag nyid dge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos kyi bdag nyid dge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, it means the virtuous nature of the Dharma.

original: mig dang gsal ba dang snang ba dang shes rab dang / ye shes bya ba rnams tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang gsal ba dang snang ba dang shes rab dang / ye shes bya ba rnams tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Eye, clarity, light, wisdom, and knowledge are not different.

original: chos la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chos la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúdharma‚Äù here refers to the noble truths such as suffering.

original: mig de yang rdul dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: mig de yang rdul dang bral ba yin te /
translated: That eye is also free from dust.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rdul med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rdul med pa'o //
translated: It is free from the dust of passion, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dri ma med pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is stainless,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the stain of passion, etc.

original: 'di yang tshig snga ma nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o //üîΩyang lta ba'i ngo bo'i rdul dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang tshig snga ma nyid rnam par 'byed pa'o // yang lta ba'i ngo bo'i rdul dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa ni tshig snga ma yin no //
translated: This is an analysis of the previous terms.üîΩThe previous terms are from the point of view of freedom from the dust of the nature of views.

original: lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i dri ma med pa la dgongs pa ni phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i dri ma med pa la dgongs pa ni phyi ma yin no //
translated: The latter terms are from the point of view of freedom from the stain of the nature of non-views.

original: chos gos phrag pa gcig la @137a * //
analyzed: chos gos phrag pa gcig la @137a * //
translated: He draped his upper robe over one shoulder

original: gzar nas zhes bya ba ni chos gos zlum por gyon pa btang nas phrag pa g-yon pa la gzar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzar nas zhes bya ba ni chos gos zlum por gyon pa btang nas phrag pa g-yon pa la gzar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that he removed his upper robe, which was worn wrapped around, and draped it over his left shoulder.

original: 'di phrag pa gcig tu zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di phrag pa gcig tu zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the term.üîΩWhat is its cause? What is its condition?

original: 'di'i rgyu gang lags rkyen gang lags zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu gang lags rkyen gang lags zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs yin te /
translated: This is an alternative expression.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag nas /
translated: As it is said in other scriptures:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'i rgyu gnyis /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed pa'i rgyu gnyis /
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause for generating right view is twofold:

original: rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: rkyen gnyis te /
translated: There are two conditions:

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the sound of another and the proper mental attention.

original: lha la sogs pa'i mthu yongs su spang ba'i phyir rgyu gang lags zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa'i mthu yongs su spang ba'i phyir rgyu gang lags zhes gsungs so //
translated: What is the cause for the complete abandonment of the power of the gods, etc.?

original: 'di sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'di sngon gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs la sogs pas so //
translated: This is the same as the former Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dis chos kyi rnam grangs sangs rgyas kyi lam ston par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin du thog ma med pa'i dus can no zhes 'chad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dis chos kyi rnam grangs sangs rgyas kyi lam ston par byed pa'i phyir de bzhin du thog ma med pa'i dus can no zhes 'chad pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Others explain that this is the same as the beginningless realm because it teaches the path of the Buddha.

original: yul de ni kun rdzob tu yang thog ma med pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul de ni kun rdzob tu yang thog ma med pa nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is not correct, because that realm does not exist even conventionally.

original: 'chags pa'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chags pa'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist prior to the creation of the world.

original: de bas na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus chos kyi rnam grangs kyi cho 'phrul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpe med pa'i 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'thob pa dmigs nas 'phags pa 'jam pa'i gsung la gus pa skyes te shin tu bstod pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal lo zhes de skad gsol
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus chos kyi rnam grangs kyi cho 'phrul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpe med pa'i 'bras bu tshe 'di la 'thob pa dmigs nas 'phags pa 'jam pa'i gsung la gus pa skyes te shin tu bstod pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal lo zhes de skad gsol
translated: Therefore, the noble Shariputra, having seen the magical display of the Dharma and the inconceivable and incomparable result that is attained in this life, gave rise to respect for the noble Manjushri‚Äôs speech and praised him greatly, saying, ‚ÄúBhagavat, this Manjushri is the inconceivable glory.‚Äù

original: te / bsam gyis mi khyab pa na lhag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: te / bsam gyis mi khyab pa na lhag pa med pa'o //
translated: Inconceivable means that it is beyond compare.

original: dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan shes rab la sogs pa'i 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan shes rab la sogs pa'i 'byor pa ste /
translated: Glory is the wealth of supramundane qualities such as wisdom.

original: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has that.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes rgol ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes rgol ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Why is that? The opponent‚Äôs thought is this:

original: rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa de ji ltar khyod kyis rtogs par nus /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa de ji ltar khyod kyis rtogs par nus /
translated: How can you know the perfect qualities that exist in other mind-streams?

original: 'di ltar re zhig khyod kyis sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni 'di la mngon sum du 'jug par nus pa ma yin bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pas shin tu shes rab kyi dbang po rno ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig khyod kyis sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni 'di la mngon sum du 'jug par nus pa ma yin bdag med pa gnyis khong du chud pas shin tu shes rab kyi dbang po rno ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Thus, for you, the superknowledge that knows the categories of mind cannot directly engage this object, because it is very sharp in its faculty of wisdom, having understood the two kinds of no-self.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang dang nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa dang dbang po gang zag gang 'das dang // zhig dang ma skyes de dag rtog pa med //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang dang nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro // sa dang dbang po gang zag gang 'das dang // zhig dang ma skyes de dag rtog pa med //
translated: And it is close to the state of the sugatas.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúThe person who has passed beyond the stages and faculties, the past and the unarisen, has no conceptualization.‚Äù

original: yul 'di lta @137b bu la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yang med de /
analyzed: yul 'di lta @137b bu la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yang med de /
translated: Inference does not engage this object either.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan rtogs pa nges par bya ba la rtags yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan rtogs pa nges par bya ba la rtags yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, in order to ascertain the realization of the faults and qualities of others, there is no evidence.

original: de ni sems kyi chos yin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi chos yin pa nyid kyis dbang po'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is a mental phenomenon, it is beyond the scope of the senses.

original: rang gi lus dang ngag gi tha snyad la rjes su dpog na yang tha snyad ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam la brten te 'jug pa yin pas de gzhan du bya bar yang nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lus dang ngag gi tha snyad la rjes su dpog na yang tha snyad ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam la brten te 'jug pa yin pas de gzhan du bya bar yang nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If you infer from the conventions of his body and speech, then conventions are engaged in merely based on the desire of the person, and therefore it is not possible to make them otherwise.

original: sems la shin tu rnam par ma nges pa 'dod pa dang bral ba khyod 'dra bas ni gzhan gyis brjod par shin tu nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems la shin tu rnam par ma nges pa 'dod pa dang bral ba khyod 'dra bas ni gzhan gyis brjod par shin tu nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: You who are free from desire, who are not at all certain about the mind, it is not possible for others to express it.‚Äù

original: 'di'i lan du /
analyzed: 'di'i lan du /
translated: In response to this,

original: 'di ltar 'di'i spobs pa gang dang gang lags pa'i spobs pa de dang de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid lags so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i spobs pa gang dang gang lags pa'i spobs pa de dang de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid lags so zhes bya bas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: it is taught, ‚ÄúIn this way, whatever his confidence is, that very confidence is inconceivable.‚Äù

original: tshig khyad par can gyi rgyu ni rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: tshig khyad par can gyi rgyu ni rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan gyi bye brag rtogs pa yin la /
translated: The cause of special words is the realization of the specific qualities that exist in other continua.

original: tshig khyad par can de yang tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid kyis smra ba pos yang dag par rtogs pa dang / phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i mchog dang / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bsam pa rtogs par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: tshig khyad par can de yang tshad ma dang ldan pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid kyis smra ba pos yang dag par rtogs pa dang / phyin ci ma log par mthong ba'i mchog dang / gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bsam pa rtogs par byed pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, since those special words reveal the meaning endowed with valid cognition, they cause the speaker to realize the supreme, unmistaken view and to understand the intention that follows the purpose of others.

original: tshig la 'dir shin tu mi 'thad pa ci yod /
analyzed: tshig la 'dir shin tu mi 'thad pa ci yod /
translated: What is utterly untenable about those words?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brjod par bya ba'i lhag ma lus par gzigs nas gdams ngag gi gtam gyi rgyud mi gcad pa'i phyir gleng slong ba mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang brjod par bya ba'i lhag ma lus par gzigs nas gdams ngag gi gtam gyi rgyud mi gcad pa'i phyir gleng slong ba mdzad pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One, seeing that the remainder of the subject matter was left, in order to not interrupt the discourse of instruction, introduced the topic,

original: dge slong shar dva ti'i bus tshig ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong shar dva ti'i bus tshig ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: saying The words spoken by the monk ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra are just so... and so forth.

original: 'phags pas kyang de kho na nyid brjod pa'i phyir btsun pas smras pa sel bar mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pas kyang de kho na nyid brjod pa'i phyir btsun pas smras pa sel bar mdzad pa ni /
translated: The noble one, in order to express thatness, dispelled the Venerable One's statement,üîΩsaying Venerable One, that is not so.

original: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab na spobs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab na spobs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Blessed One, if it is inconceivable, it will not be eloquent.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste spobs pa de dag thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste spobs pa de dag thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid do zhes bya bas ci bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here? It is that all those eloquences are inconceivable.

original: ci bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid gzung ba'i rnam par snang ngam /
analyzed: ci bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid gzung ba'i rnam par snang ngam /
translated: Does it appear as the inconceivable nature of what is to be apprehended?

original: 'on te ci gnyis su med pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid du skye 'am /
analyzed: 'on te ci gnyis su med pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bdag nyid du skye 'am /
translated: Or does non-duality arise as the inconceivable nature?

original: ci nang du brjod pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes gnyis su 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: ci nang du brjod pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes gnyis su 'byung ba yin /
translated: Is it that this is inconceivable because it possesses the nature of internal expression?

original: btsun bas bdag la smras par gyur pa de gzhan dag las bye brag ci yod ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: btsun bas bdag la smras par gyur pa de gzhan dag las bye brag ci yod ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: What difference is there between this and what others say?

original: 'di snyam du @138a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du @138a * //
translated: He thought this:

original: dgongs te / sgra dang de'i don mtha' dag ni bsam par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgongs te / sgra dang de'i don mtha' dag ni bsam par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: All sounds and their meanings will be conceivable.

original: de gnyis rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are objects of conceptual consciousness.

original: de dag ni mi rigs par smras pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag ni mi rigs par smras pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt those unreasonable statements?

original: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma lags pa ni ci yang ma mchis so ;
analyzed: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ma lags pa ni ci yang ma mchis so ;
translated: There is nothing that is not inconceivable.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das sgra thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgra thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúAll sounds are inconceivable.‚Äù

original: sgra smos pas de'i don yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra smos pas de'i don yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning sound, he also indicates its meaning.

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought as follows:

original: sgra dang don de gnyis ni phyi'i gzugs kyi ngo bo gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: sgra dang don de gnyis ni phyi'i gzugs kyi ngo bo gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: If sound and its meaning are the nature of external form, they are the nature of the manifest.

original: spyi'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo'am /
translated: Or, they are the nature of the general.

original: blo la snang ba'i mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i mtshan nyid cig yin grang na /
translated: Or, they are the characteristic of appearing to the mind.

original: de dag ni don dam par rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni don dam par rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those are not objects of conceptual consciousness in the ultimate.

original: thams cad las kyang /
analyzed: thams cad las kyang /
translated: The *Sarvadar≈õana-samgraha says:

original: gsal ba gnyis su mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: gsal ba gnyis su mi 'gyur te //
translated: The manifest does not become two.

original: gzhan du 'gro bar snang ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro bar snang ba yin //
translated: It appears to go elsewhere.

original: shes pa dag lam gtogs par //
analyzed: shes pa dag lam gtogs par //
translated: Apart from consciousness,

original: ji ltar don gzhan 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩde bas log par rnam rtog pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan 'grub par 'gyur // de bas log par rnam rtog pa'i //
translated: How could it establish another object?üîΩTherefore, all these words and meanings

original: sgra don 'di kun rnam par nges //
analyzed: sgra don 'di kun rnam par nges //
translated: are ascertained as false imaginations.

original: bag chags las byung thog ma med //
analyzed: bag chags las byung thog ma med //
translated: They arise from habitual tendencies, are beginningless,

original: rang gi bsam las rnam par log / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bsam las rnam par log / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: and are completely different from one‚Äôs own thoughts.

original: phyogs gsum pa sel ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi sgra ni bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa sel ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi sgra ni bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The third position is that the word ‚Äúinconceivable‚Äù cannot be taught.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚Äú Inconceivable‚Äù means the nature of the inconceivable.

original: sgra zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don la bya ste /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don la bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú Word‚Äù refers to the meaning of the word.

original: sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir sgra'i don la sgra zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir sgra'i don la sgra zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it follows the form of the word, the meaning of the word is called ‚Äúword.‚Äù

original: sgra'i don med du zin kyang rang bzhin la go 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sgra'i don med du zin kyang rang bzhin la go 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: Even if the meaning of the word does not exist, what contradiction is there in its nature?

original: sgra ma lags pa yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra ma lags pa yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äú Not a word‚Äù is stated.

original: sgra'i don ma lags pa yang bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: sgra'i don ma lags pa yang bstan par mi nus so //
translated: Even if it is not the meaning of the word, it cannot be taught.

original: brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it cannot be expressed.

original: don ni 'di yin te nang du brjod pa yang ji ltar de'i spyi'i rnam pa'i sgra'i don nyid du rang gi rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te nang du brjod pa yang ji ltar de'i spyi'i rnam pa'i sgra'i don nyid du rang gi rnam pa la mngon par zhen pa de bzhin du 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning is this: Just as the internal expression is not the meaning of the word in the form of its universal, because it is conceived in its own form, so too this is not the case.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par zhen pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is endowed with conception just as it is, and because reality is not realized just as it is.

original: de nas yang btsun pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas yang btsun pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Then again, the Venerable One‚Äôs intention is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge @138b 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge @138b 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Because this is the meditative absorption of the inconceivable,

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not for ordinary beings and so forth.üîΩTherefore, this is the inconceivable just by that much, and it is eloquence.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'di nyid re zhig de tsam gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa spobs pa lags so zhes bshad do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid re zhig de tsam gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa spobs pa lags so zhes bshad do zhe na /
translated: Thus, it was explained.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then, the Blessed One said this:

original: 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug gam zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug gam zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you enter the concentration of the inconceivable?

original: de nyid kyang spong bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang spong bar byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And that very thing is being refuted: Blessed One, that is not so.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bdag snyoms par mi 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bdag snyoms par mi 'jug go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is being analyzed: I do not enter the concentration of the inconceivable.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni des rab tu phye ba yin na ji ltar de la snyoms par mi 'jug ces bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni des rab tu phye ba yin na ji ltar de la snyoms par mi 'jug ces bsams pa'o //
translated: Why is that? means If it is distinguished by that, how is it that one does not enter it?

original: lan du bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lan du bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar bdag nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer is, Blessed One, it is because I myself am the concentration of the inconceivable.

original: gong du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra smos pa der yang 'di'i don gyis khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gong du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgra smos pa der yang 'di'i don gyis khong nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: The word concentration mentioned above should be understood to be implied here.

original: 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: It would be like this:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag bsam du rung ba lags na ni bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag bsam du rung ba lags na ni bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Blessed One, if I were suitable for thought, I would enter the inconceivable absorption.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin las logs shig na yod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin las logs shig na yod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it existed separately from the inconceivable absorption, that is what it would mean.

original: don 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this meaning also does not exist.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das bsam du ma mchis pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bgyi ba de ni bsam du ma mchis pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das bsam du ma mchis pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bgyi ba de ni bsam du ma mchis pa /
translated: Thus, Blessed One, what is called the inconceivable absorption is inconceivable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam gyis mi lang ba lags te gang gi phyir bsam du ma mchis te bsam pa las 'das pa de bas na don bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam gyis mi lang ba lags te gang gi phyir bsam du ma mchis te bsam pa las 'das pa de bas na don bsam gyis mi lang ba lags so //
translated: inconceivable, beyond thought. Because it is inconceivable, beyond thought, therefore the meaning is inconceivable.

original: brjod pa tsam du ting nge 'dzin smos so //
analyzed: brjod pa tsam du ting nge 'dzin smos so //
translated: It is merely mentioned as absorption.

original: de bas na ji ltar bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi ste /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bgyi ste /
translated: Therefore, how should I enter the inconceivable absorption?

original: logs shig na mi srid pa'i phyir mi bgyid do //
analyzed: logs shig na mi srid pa'i phyir mi bgyid do //
translated: Because it is impossible separately, I do not do it.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig la gnyis su med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo dang ldan pa skye ba de la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig la gnyis su med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo dang ldan pa skye ba de la yang dag par snyoms par 'jug pa po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: When a single moment of consciousness arises endowed with the nature of the meditative stabilization of the inconceivable that is free from duality, then there is no one who enters meditative equipoise,

original: snyoms par 'jug par bya ba dag med pa yin na /üîΩde'i tshe ji ltar bdag bsam @139a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par bya ba dag med pa yin na / de'i tshe ji ltar bdag bsam @139a * //
translated: no meditative equipoise, and no object of meditative equipoise.

original: gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'am /üîΩsnyoms par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'am / snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
translated: At that time, how could one say, ‚ÄúI enter meditative stabilization that is inconceivable,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI have entered meditative stabilization,‚Äù

original: snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: or ‚ÄúI will enter meditative stabilization‚Äù?

original: kha cig las bsam pa las 'das pa /üîΩbsam bya med pa /
analyzed: kha cig las bsam pa las 'das pa / bsam bya med pa /
translated: Some s≈´tras say, ‚ÄúIt is beyond thought,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIt is not an object of thought,‚Äù

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and ‚ÄúIt is inconceivable.‚Äù

original: de'i don yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don yang 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of those statements is as follows.

original: bsam par bya ba'i ngo bo 'di las 'das pas bsam pa las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i ngo bo 'di las 'das pas bsam pa las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Since it transcends the nature that is an object of thought, it is beyond thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bsam bya med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bsam bya med pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, it is not an object of thought.

original: bsam byar 'os pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam byar 'os pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable to be an object of thought.

original: gsum pa ni mjug sdud pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mjug sdud pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The third is a concluding statement.

original: gal te de ltar na bdag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go snyam pa 'di ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na bdag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go snyam pa 'di ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how does the thought occur to him, ‚ÄúI am entering the concentration of the inconceivable‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To explain this, he says:

original: de lta lags kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das bdag bsgom pa khyad zhugs pa thob pa'i sngon rol las dang po pa thog ma brtson pa'i tshe na 'di snyam du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de lta lags kyis kyang bcom ldan 'das bdag bsgom pa khyad zhugs pa thob pa'i sngon rol las dang po pa thog ma brtson pa'i tshe na 'di snyam du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so, Blessed One, before I attained the distinctive meditation, when I was a beginner, at the outset of my efforts, I thought thus.‚Äù The rest is self-evident.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What was that?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du de ltar bsams par gyur to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du de ltar bsams par gyur to //
translated: ‚ÄúI will enter the concentration of the inconceivable.‚Äù

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'dod pas mngon du bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang 'dod pas mngon du bya'o snyam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúI will realize the state of the Well-Gone One.‚Äù

original: de bsam pa de ci med dam zhe na /
analyzed: de bsam pa de ci med dam zhe na /
translated: But was that thought of his non-existent?

original: gsungs pa / bcom ldan 'das da ltar ni bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du yang phyir yang de la sems pa kun tu 'byung ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: gsungs pa / bcom ldan 'das da ltar ni bdag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par 'jug go snyam du yang phyir yang de la sems pa kun tu 'byung ba ma mchis so //
translated: The Lord has said: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, I do not think that thought occurs to you: ‚ÄòNow I am entering into this inconceivable concentration.‚Äô

original: 'dir sngar dpe bstan pas lan gdab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir sngar dpe bstan pas lan gdab pa'i phyir ro // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, the answer is given by teaching an example.

original: 'phong gi slob dpon ni 'phen mkhas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'phong gi slob dpon ni 'phen mkhas par gyur pa'o //
translated: The Lord said: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is just as follows. For example, a master archer, well-trained in archery,

original: de sngon las dang po pa'i sa ni slob pa'i tshe bsam pa 'di snyam du bdag gis 'ben sbom por gyur pa ba lang gi phur pa dag la phog par bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de sngon las dang po pa'i sa ni slob pa'i tshe bsam pa 'di snyam du bdag gis 'ben sbom por gyur pa ba lang gi phur pa dag la phog par bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: when he is on the beginner‚Äôs stage, at the time of training, thinks like this: ‚ÄòI will shoot at large targets, at cow-hides.‚Äô

original: ba lang gi phur pa zhes bya ba ni phur pa gang la ba lang dag 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang gi phur pa zhes bya ba ni phur pa gang la ba lang dag 'dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄòCow-hides‚Äô are targets to which cows are tied.

original: 'phong gi slob dpon de gang gi tshe skra'i nyag ma phra mo la phog par gyur pa de'i tshe 'phong gi slob dpon de yang bsam pa 'di snyam du bdag gis ba lang gi phur pa dag la phog par bya'o snyam du sems pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phong gi slob dpon de gang gi tshe skra'i nyag ma phra mo la phog par gyur pa de'i tshe 'phong gi slob dpon de yang bsam pa 'di snyam du bdag gis ba lang gi phur pa dag la phog par bya'o snyam du sems pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When the archery master hits the fine tip of the hair, he does not think, ‚ÄúI will hit the tip of the hair.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why does he not think that?

original: @139b 'di ltar de skra la phog par legs par lobs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: @139b 'di ltar de skra la phog par legs par lobs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Because he is well trained in hitting the tip of the hair.

original: skra nyag ma phra mo la phog par mkhas na ba lang gi phur pa la phog pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skra nyag ma phra mo la phog par mkhas na ba lang gi phur pa la phog pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he is skilled in hitting the fine tip of the hair, what need is there to mention his hitting the tip of the cow‚Äôs horn.

original: ci ste goms pa mchog tu gyur ma thag tu gang gi tshe 'phong gi slob dpon de skra la phog par 'tshal zhing 'dod pa de'i tshe bsgrim mi 'tshal bar 'bad pa med par skra la phog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste goms pa mchog tu gyur ma thag tu gang gi tshe 'phong gi slob dpon de skra la phog par 'tshal zhing 'dod pa de'i tshe bsgrim mi 'tshal bar 'bad pa med par skra la phog par 'gyur te /
translated: But if he has just attained supreme mastery in training, then when the archery master wishes to hit the tip of the hair, he does so without exerting himself, effortlessly.

original: skra la phog par goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra la phog par goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is well trained in hitting the tip of the hair.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bdag sngon ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don la dpe'i don sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du bdag sngon ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don la dpe'i don sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, in the same way, I formerly... and so on, he applies the meaning of the example to the meaning.

original: gang gi tshe bdag gis rim gyis rnam par rtog pa 'phros pa mtha' dag bsal te ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms pa zhugs par gyur nas ting nge 'dzin 'dis ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ngo bos gnas pa de'i tshe bdag slar yang ting nge 'dzin 'di la bsam
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gis rim gyis rnam par rtog pa 'phros pa mtha' dag bsal te ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms pa zhugs par gyur nas ting nge 'dzin 'dis ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ngo bos gnas pa de'i tshe bdag slar yang ting nge 'dzin 'di la bsam
translated: When I gradually removed all the proliferations of discursive thought and entered into meditative concentration, and when I remained in that meditative concentration by the nature of that meditative concentration, at that time I again thought this meditative concentration.

original: pa 'di snyam du ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas par bgyi'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: pa 'di snyam du ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas par bgyi'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: I do not think, I will remain in this meditative concentration.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba yang ci ste shin tu bsgoms par ma gyur ba'i tshe sngon ni byung la /
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba yang ci ste shin tu bsgoms par ma gyur ba'i tshe sngon ni byung la /
translated: Again also, if it has not been well cultivated, it arose before,

original: da ni mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: da ni mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: but now it does not arise due to attachment. Why is that?

original: 'di la de'i bsam pa zhugs nas de 'phel na go de'i bsam pa yang 'phel ba'i rigs so zhes bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di la de'i bsam pa zhugs nas de 'phel na go de'i bsam pa yang 'phel ba'i rigs so zhes bsams pa'o ;
translated: Thinking that if his intention enters there and increases, then his intention should also increase,

original: /'di'i lan ni gang dang gang gi tshe ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: /'di'i lan ni gang dang gang gi tshe ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The answer to this is ‚ÄúWhenever he abides in this meditative absorption, etc.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin 'dis gdags su ma mchis zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'dis gdags su ma mchis zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis meditative absorption is not something that can be imputed‚Äù means that it is nonconceptual.

original: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas na gdags su ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas na gdags su ma mchis pa'o //
translated: Since there is no conceptualization of ‚ÄúI will abide‚Äù and so forth, it is not something that can be imputed.

original: rnam par rtog pa de med pa yang ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de med pa yang ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This absence of conceptualization is also the essence of meditative absorption.

original: btsun pas zin pa ni shin tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa'i phyir 'di la yid rton pa med pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go snyam pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: btsun pas zin pa ni shin tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod pa'i phyir 'di la yid rton pa med pas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go snyam pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since there is another meditative absorption of complete pacification that is embraced by the venerable one, conceptualization does not occur here because there is no reliance on the mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa'i tshe 'di la yid mi rton na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'dis gnas pa'i tshe 'di la yid mi rton na zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúWhen youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ abides in this inconceivable meditative absorption, he does not rely on the mind here.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gdags su ma mchis pa zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdags su ma mchis pa zhes gsungs na /
translated: If it is said, It is not to be imputed,

original: 'di nyid shin tu zhi ba yin par ma rtogs pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di bas ches zhi ba'i dngos po @140a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid shin tu zhi ba yin par ma rtogs pa'i phyir / 'di bas ches zhi ba'i dngos po @140a * //
translated: because it is not understood that this is itself peace,üîΩit is evident that there is some other thing more peaceful than this.

original: gzhan zhig yod par mngon no zhes sems can gzhan zhig sems pa'i ngor byas te /
