analyzed: gzhan zhig yod par mngon no zhes sems can gzhan zhig sems pa'i ngor byas te /
translated: Thinking of the minds of other sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan lta ma mchis sam zhes dris so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan lta ma mchis sam zhes dris so //
translated: he asks, Blessed One, is there no other meditative stabilization more peaceful than this meditative stabilization of the inconceivable?

original: re zhig tshig gi skyon bzungs ba ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di zhi ba yin par ji ltar shes zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig tshig gi skyon bzungs ba ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod kyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di zhi ba yin par ji ltar shes zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The fault in the words is this: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, how do you know that this meditative stabilization of the inconceivable is peace?

original: btsun pa ni shin tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan dris pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: btsun pa ni shin tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan dris pa ma yin nam /
translated: Venerable One, is it not that you asked about another meditative stabilization that is very peaceful?

original: 'di zhi ba nyid du khas blangs pa ni ma yin na ci'i phyir de skad du brgal zhe na /
analyzed: 'di zhi ba nyid du khas blangs pa ni ma yin na ci'i phyir de skad du brgal zhe na /
translated: Since it is not accepted that this is itself peace, why is it argued in this way?

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is thought as follows:

original: 'di zhi ba nyid yin par rtogs na ni gzhan shin tu zhi ba nyid yin par dri ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: 'di zhi ba nyid yin par rtogs na ni gzhan shin tu zhi ba nyid yin par dri ba'i rigs te /
translated: If it is understood that this is peace, then it is proper to ask about the other, which is complete peace.

original: 'di ltar 'di yang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di yang zhi ba'o //
translated: For this is peace,

original: 'di yang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhi ba'o //
translated: and this is peace,üîΩand of these two kinds of peace, the other is completely peaceful.

original: zhi ba 'di gnyis kyi nang na shin tu zhi bar 'dug pa yin no zhes bya bas ni 'di zhi ba nyid du nges pa dang / gzhan shin tu zhi ba yin par 'dri bar rigs so //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di gnyis kyi nang na shin tu zhi bar 'dug pa yin no zhes bya bas ni 'di zhi ba nyid du nges pa dang / gzhan shin tu zhi ba yin par 'dri bar rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is proper to ask about the other, which is completely peaceful, having ascertained that this is peace.

original: 'di ni zhi ba nyid yin par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba nyid yin par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not proper to ascertain that this is peace,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin ni nyan thos dag gis mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin ni nyan thos dag gis mngon du byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas is not realized by the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de ltar tshig gi skyon brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshig gi skyon brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the words,üîΩhe now states the faults of the meaning.

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin gdags su med pa 'di'i don gsal bar byed pa ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di skad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan lta mchis sam zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin gdags su med pa 'di'i don gsal bar byed pa ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di skad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan lta mchis sam zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba
translated: Now, the one who clarifies the meaning of this unnamable samƒÅdhi is the Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, who asks, ‚ÄúIs there any other samƒÅdhi that is more peaceful than this inconceivable samƒÅdhi?‚Äù

original: yin no // de la gsungs pa /
analyzed: yin no // de la gsungs pa /
translated: To that, it is said:

original: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing de bzhin du dmigs na ni de'i tshe bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas gzhan ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod par gyur na ji tsam
analyzed: btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu gal te bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yod cing de bzhin du dmigs na ni de'i tshe bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di bas gzhan ches zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan yod par gyur na ji tsam
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, if this inconceivable samƒÅdhi existed and were likewise observed, then at that time there would be another samƒÅdhi that is more peaceful than this inconceivable samƒÅdhi. But how

original: du 'di nyid re zhig thog mar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: du 'di nyid re zhig thog mar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: could it be that this very [inconceivable samƒÅdhi] does not exist from the very beginning?

original: med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa ni 'di ji ltar zhi ba nyid du yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs pa ni 'di ji ltar zhi ba nyid du yod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is not observed, how could it exist as peacefulness?

original: gang gis na 'di bas gzhan ches zhi ba btsal bar bya /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di bas gzhan ches zhi ba btsal bar bya /
translated: By what [means] should another that is more peaceful than this be sought?

original: 'di yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di yod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not just that it exists?

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: med pa yin na chos la bdag med pa mngon par rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams @140b gzhan las shin tu khyad par du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yin na chos la bdag med pa mngon par rtogs pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams @140b gzhan las shin tu khyad par du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: If it were nonexistent, it would follow that the selflessness of phenomena would not be realized, and it would follow that there would be no reason to posit the bodhisattvas as being superior to others.

original: de bas na dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is just an object of observation.

original: de lta ma yin na yod pa yang med pa dang bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yod pa yang med pa dang bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that existence and nonexistence would be indistinguishable.

original: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di med cing mi dmigs pa yin par brjod dam ci zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di med cing mi dmigs pa yin par brjod dam ci zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The thought is that Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ is saying, ‚ÄúIs this inconceivable meditative stabilization inexpressible and non-apprehensible?‚Äù

original: lan ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di ltar de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan ni btsun pa sha radva ti'i bu 'di ltar de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is like this: it is an inconceivable meditative stabilization.‚Äù

original: 'di la bsam par bya ba gzung ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la bsam par bya ba gzung ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, the object of thought does not exist.

original: sems gzhan gyis bsam par yang nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems gzhan gyis bsam par yang nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it possible to think it with another mind.

original: rang la sems shing 'dzin par yang 'os ma yin te /
analyzed: rang la sems shing 'dzin par yang 'os ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it proper to think and grasp it in oneself.

original: de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is inconceivable.

original: gtan tshigs gang gis de ltar yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di ni med de mi dmigs pa'o zhes kyang ston to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis de ltar yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di ni med de mi dmigs pa'o zhes kyang ston to //
translated: The reason why it is so is that this inconceivable concentration is non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning here is this:

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa la bya na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa la bya na /
translated: If concentration is taken to be the one-pointedness of mind,

original: don dam par sems kyi rtse mo dmigs par gdags pa gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: don dam par sems kyi rtse mo dmigs par gdags pa gzhan cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: ultimately, since the tip of the mind does not exist as any other object to be designated,

original: gang gis 'di rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'di rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: by what would this be accomplished as the one-pointedness of concentration?

original: de bas na brjod pa tsam kho nar zad de /
analyzed: de bas na brjod pa tsam kho nar zad de /
translated: Therefore, it is merely an expression.

original: spros pa'i tshogs dang bral ba glo bur du g-yeng ba'i dri mas ma gos pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: spros pa'i tshogs dang bral ba glo bur du g-yeng ba'i dri mas ma gos pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: Free from the collection of conceptual elaborations, unstained by the incidental defilements of distraction, non-conceptual,

original: 'gyur ba med pa dri ma'i rnam pas dben pa gang la ting nge 'dzin gyi ming du gzhag pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dri ma'i rnam pas dben pa gang la ting nge 'dzin gyi ming du gzhag pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa yin no //
translated: The unconditioned, which is free from the defilements of change, is conventionally said to exist as the name of a concentration.

original: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams la yang tshul de lta bur brjod pa'i dngos po gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na so so'i skye bo rnams la yang tshul de lta bur brjod pa'i dngos po gnas pa yin te /
translated: But for ordinary people, the things that are said to exist in this way are not permanent,

original: dus thams cad du chos kyi dbyings ni 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du chos kyi dbyings ni 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dharma-dhƒÅtu is not established as unchanging at all times.

original: de bas na de dag kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na de dag kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it follows that they also possess the inconceivable concentration.

original: de la 'dir re zhig de tsam du brjod par 'dod nas byis pa rnams la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yod par 'gyur na de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin par dgongs nas /
analyzed: de la 'dir re zhig de tsam du brjod par 'dod nas byis pa rnams la yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin yod par 'gyur na de'i phyir cung zad kyang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin par dgongs nas /
translated: Here, it is intended that even for ordinary people, the inconceivable concentration would exist if it were merely said to be so, and therefore nothing at all is denied.

original: de lta mod kyi btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting ne 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa @141a * //üîΩgsungs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnyis las dben pa yin zhing skabs kyi dngos po yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting ne 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa @141a * // gsungs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnyis las dben pa yin zhing skabs kyi dngos po yod du zin kyang /
translated: Still, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the so-called inconceivable samƒÅdhi and so on.

original: sems can 'ga' yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par thal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sems can 'ga' yang ting nge 'dzin dang ldan par thal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Why is that? means Although there is a context of being isolated from the two knowledges, is it not the case that it follows that no sentient being at all possesses samƒÅdhi?

original: 'di ltar thal ma thag pa'i don gyi yon tan yod pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di sems la bzhag nas yang de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thal ma thag pa'i don gyi yon tan yod pa ma yin no snyam pa 'di sems la bzhag nas yang de'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, the meaning of the immediately preceding [passage] does not exist. Thinking this, [Subh≈´ti] again says, For that reason...

original: bsam pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement all thoughts... and so on.

original: bsam bar 'os pa bsam bar bya ba thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste gzung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam bar 'os pa bsam bar bya ba thams cad ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste gzung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: All thoughts that are worthy of thought are inconceivable, not apprehended.

original: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bsam bar bya ba'i don dang bral ba'i phyir gzung bas dben pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bsam bar bya ba'i don dang bral ba'i phyir gzung bas dben pa nyid yin la /
translated: The phrase inconceivable means that it is devoid of apprehended objects, because it is free from objects that are to be conceived.

original: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te dngos po gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin te dngos po gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the meditative absorption of the inconceivable, and it is called the abiding state of entities.

original: de bas na de dag gi cha las sems can thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par rnam par gzhag pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi cha las sems can thams cad kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par rnam par gzhag pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in positing that all sentient beings have attained the meditative absorption of the inconceivable, because they are all included within that.

original: yang 'jam pa'i gsung la dad pa lhag par skyes pa rnams kyi dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang 'jam pa'i gsung la dad pa lhag par skyes pa rnams kyi dang ba bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to generate faith in those who have a special devotion to the Buddha's gentle speech, the Buddha said, Excellent, excellent, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´!

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu 'di dag thams cad bstan pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu 'di dag thams cad bstan pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: You have taught all of these profound and very profound subjects.

original: zab mo zab pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni don zab pa yin te /
analyzed: zab mo zab pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni don zab pa yin te /
translated: The phrase profound and very profound subjects refers to profound objects.

original: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are free from deprecation and fabrication.

original: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa 'di'i rgyu 'di yang go rims bzhin du ston par byed pa ni 'di ltar 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dang / sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa 'di'i rgyu 'di yang go rims bzhin du ston par byed pa ni 'di ltar 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the reason why he does not deprecate or reify, and it is taught in order, as follows: ‚ÄúO Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you have served the victors of the past‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de dag gi don ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi don ni bstan zin to //
translated: The meaning of these has already been explained.

original: de la kha cig gi blo la 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab can yin pa'i phyir de la gnas te smra ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la kha cig gi blo la 'di snyam du 'di ni shes rab can yin pa'i phyir de la gnas te smra ba yin gyi /
translated: Some may think this way: ‚ÄúHe speaks while abiding in that because he is wise.

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: It is not due to the power of things.‚Äù

original: de bas na brnyas pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ci 'jam dpal khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na brnyas pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ci 'jam dpal khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to completely abandon contempt, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúO Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, do you abide in the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù and so on.

original: gang kha cig 'chad pa ni de ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te 'di skad smra'o snyam du sems shing blo de snyam @141b byed dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang kha cig 'chad pa ni de ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te 'di skad smra'o snyam du sems shing blo de snyam @141b byed dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he thinks, What is the thought of that one who says this?

original: ma lags so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma lags so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, No, Blessed One.üîΩIf my thought were to be like this, 'I stand in the perfection of wisdom and say this,' then I would stand in a perception.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag gi blo 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas 'di skad mchi'o snyam bgyid na ni de lta na yang de dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag gi blo 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas 'di skad mchi'o snyam bgyid na ni de lta na yang de dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: a perception is a perception of a self, etc.

original: de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then I would say this,

original: dmigs pa ni bdag la sogs par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni bdag la sogs par dmigs pa'o //
translated: a perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.

original: de lta na yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la gnas pa nas de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag tu 'du shes pa la gnas pa nas de skad mchi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this,

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam la dmigs pa sngon du btang ba can gyi mngon par zhen pa can gyi 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam la dmigs pa sngon du btang ba can gyi mngon par zhen pa can gyi 'du shes pa'o //
translated: a perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this, üîΩa perception is a perception of a self, etc.üîΩThen I would say this,

original: dngos po'i 'du shes ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i 'du shes ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yod par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: a perception is a perception of a self, etc.

original: bar gyi sgras srog dang / skye ba po dang / skyes bu dang / gso ba dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i 'du shes yongs su gzung ngo snyam du mi bgyid do //
analyzed: bar gyi sgras srog dang / skye ba po dang / skyes bu dang / gso ba dang / gang zag la sogs pa'i 'du shes yongs su gzung ngo snyam du mi bgyid do //
translated: The intermediate sound is the notion of life, the living being, the person, the nourished, the individual, and so on.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te de skad mi mchi'o snyam bdag mi bgyid do zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te de skad mi mchi'o snyam bdag mi bgyid do zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Therefore, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, I do not think 'I will not speak in that way.'

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te mchi'o snyam bgyid kyang de tsam gyis bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes pa la yang gnas te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te mchi'o snyam bgyid kyang de tsam gyis bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes pa la yang gnas te /
translated: Why is that? means 'Although abiding in the perfection of wisdom, I think I will speak in that way, to what extent do I abide in the notion of self and so on,

original: de skad mchi'o snyam du bgyid ces bya bar 'brel pa ci yod /
analyzed: de skad mchi'o snyam du bgyid ces bya bar 'brel pa ci yod /
translated: and think I will speak in that way?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: The opponent's thought is that the perfection of wisdom itself is not the notion of self and so on.

original: 'di'i lan du /
analyzed: 'di'i lan du /
translated: In response to this,

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas su gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas su gyur tam zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom were a location, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la byed pa po 'ga' zhig gnas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la byed pa po 'ga' zhig gnas so //
translated: The Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom were a location, and someone were to think, Here the agent abides,

original: 'dug go zhes bdag rnam par rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dug go zhes bdag rnam par rtog par gyur na /
translated: or Here the agent is seated,

original: de'i tshe sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes kyi sgra ni 'dir khong nas dbyung bar bstan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgro 'dogs pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes kyi sgra ni 'dir khong nas dbyung bar bstan te /
translated: then at that time one would fall into the extreme of superimposition. The word or is taught here to be drawn out from within.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means if it were a location.

original: ci ste gnas pa ma lags te /
analyzed: ci ste gnas pa ma lags te /
translated: If it were not a location,

original: gnas pa med pa zhig tu gyur na zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid du gyur na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa zhig tu gyur na zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyang de'i bdag nyid du gyur na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: and if it were non-abiding, then even the faultless non-dual wisdom would become its nature.

original: @142a * // 'dir yang zhes kyi sgra khong nas dbyung bar bstan te /
analyzed: @142a * // 'dir yang zhes kyi sgra khong nas dbyung bar bstan te /
translated: Here the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be supplied from the preceding section.

original: de'i tshe yang skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one would fall into the extreme of nihilism.

original: de ltar gyur na mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma lags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be the perfection of wisdom free from the two extremes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa med na yang bdag la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams spong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa med na yang bdag la sogs pa'i lta ba rnams spong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not abide in the perfection of wisdom, one would not abandon the views of self and so on.

original: de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams de dag spong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams de dag spong bar byed do //
translated: Because of that, the bodhisattvas would not abandon them.

original: de ltar na bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes la gnas nas de de skad mchi'o zhes bya ba rung ba yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag la sogs pa'i 'du shes la gnas nas de de skad mchi'o zhes bya ba rung ba yin no /
translated: Thus, it is appropriate to say that ‚Äúabiding in the perception of self and so on, they say this.‚Äù

original: gnas ma lags pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos /
analyzed: gnas ma lags pa zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos /
translated: Why is it said that ‚Äúit is not a basis‚Äù?

original: 'di dris pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dris pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is this asked?‚Äù

original: nyes pa med de /
analyzed: nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par de ltar bzhed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par de ltar bzhed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is accepted as being free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught in that way.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa'i don du /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i de kho na nyid kyi don gsal bar byed pa'i don du /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of thatness, which was just taught,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi gnas ma lags pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi gnas ma lags pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas te zhes gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúThe abode of the perfection of wisdom is not my abode.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gnas yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gnas yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the abode, so it is the abode of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dri ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i yon tan gyi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the support of stainless nondual qualities.

original: de ni bdag gi gnas ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni bdag gi gnas ma lags te /
translated: It is not my abode,

original: bdag gi rten ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi rten ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is not my support, is what is meant.

original: bdag smos pas gang zag la sogs pa yang mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag smos pas gang zag la sogs pa yang mtshon pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the person and so on are also indicated.

original: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa bstan to ;
analyzed: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa bstan to ;
translated: This teaches the selflessness of persons.

original: /'o na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi gnas yod mod ce na /
analyzed: /'o na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi gnas yod mod ce na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut is there not a basis for the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject?‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas ni gnas ma mchis pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas ni gnas ma mchis pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: The basis of the perfection of wisdom is a non-basis.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is the remainder.

original: des ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos la bdag med pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de gnyis yang dam bcas pa tsam gyi snying por bstan to zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de gnyis yang dam bcas pa tsam gyi snying por bstan to zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Fearing that those two are taught to be the essence of mere assertion,

original: gtan tshigs go rims bzhin du bstan pa ni kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba yin te bdag la sogs pa ni 'di las shin tu yang kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pas kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di
analyzed: gtan tshigs go rims bzhin du bstan pa ni kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba yin te bdag la sogs pa ni 'di las shin tu yang kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pas kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di
translated: the reason is taught in order, ‚ÄúIt is without origination.‚Äù Since self and so on are utterly without origination, the intention is that they are without origination.

original: @142b yin te gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po ni nye bar skyed par byed pa dang nye bar bskyed par bya ba med par mi 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @142b yin te gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i dngos po ni nye bar skyed par byed pa dang nye bar bskyed par bya ba med par mi 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The state of being a basis and not being a basis is not established without the producer and the produced.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas yod du zin kyang bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang shin tu skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas yod du zin kyang bdag la sogs pa 'ga' yang shin tu skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if the perfection of wisdom existed, I and so on would not be produced at all.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the perfection of wisdom existed, it would not arise at all, because of permanence.

original: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dag bstan zin pa'i tshul gyis med pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dag bstan zin pa'i tshul gyis med pa yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: Non-arising is the non-existence of the characteristics of grasped and grasper, as has been taught.

original: kha cig las go skabs ma mchis pa /
analyzed: kha cig las go skabs ma mchis pa /
translated: Some texts have ‚Äúno opportunity,‚Äù

original: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes 'byung ba de la 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes 'byung ba de la 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i skabs yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: and that should be explained as ‚Äúthere is no opportunity for the characteristics of grasped and grasper here.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba ma mchis pa lags so zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Non-arising is the analysis of this,

original: 'di'i don yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and its meaning is the same as before.

original: yang na dgag pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dgag pa med par bya ste /
translated: Or it should be done without negation.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas te zhes bya ba des ni chos la bdag med pa bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gi gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas te zhes bya ba des ni chos la bdag med pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the selflessness of phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag ni bdag gi gnas yin no zhes 'di ni dper bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas gang yin pa de dag ni bdag gi gnas yin no zhes 'di ni dper bshad pa yin te /
translated: Those who dwell in the perfection of wisdom, their dwelling is my dwelling. This is an analogy.

original: gnas bdag lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas bdag lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the dwelling is like the self.

original: dper na nam mkha' la me tog dang 'dra bar bdag la bde ba la sogs pa gnas par pha rol pos brtags pa ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la me tog dang 'dra bar bdag la bde ba la sogs pa gnas par pha rol pos brtags pa ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is not correct to imagine that happiness, etc. dwell in the self, like flowers in the sky,

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang gang yang gnas pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang gang yang gnas pa med de /
translated: in the same way, nothing at all dwells in the perfection of wisdom.

original: bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no dwelling of the self, the grasped, etc.

original: don de nyid rnam grangs kyis gsal bar byed pa ni gnas ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: don de nyid rnam grangs kyis gsal bar byed pa ni gnas ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The same point is clarified by way of synonyms in the passage beginning with ‚Äúnon-dwelling‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnas pa 'di'i gnas dang / gzhi yod pa ma yin pas gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnas pa 'di'i gnas dang / gzhi yod pa ma yin pas gnas med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the abode of this abode, and since it does not exist as a basis or ground, it is without abode.

original: de bzhin du gnas la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //üîΩmjug sdud pa ni de ltar na ji skad du bstan pa'i tshul gyis gnas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa de ni bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa chos gang gi gnas dang gzhi yang
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro // mjug sdud pa ni de ltar na ji skad du bstan pa'i tshul gyis gnas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bdag nyid yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa'i gzhir gyur pa de ni bdag dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa chos gang gi gnas dang gzhi yang
translated: Thus, the abode should be applied as appropriate.

original: ma lags so //üîΩgtan tshigs de'i slad du gnas de ni bsam @143a * //
analyzed: ma lags so // gtan tshigs de'i slad du gnas de ni bsam @143a * //
translated: The summary: Thus, in the manner taught, the abode is the basis and ground of the entire collection of qualities that are the nature of the perfection of wisdom, but it is not the abode or ground of any dharma such as self and grasping.

original: gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes bstan to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes bstan to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: For that reason, that abode is taught as the inconceivable abode.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable is beyond all thought.

original: gnas de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that abode?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the abode of the perfection of wisdom.

original: sngar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so zhes bshad du zin kyang 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gnas yin no zhes bye brag gi tshig bsdu ba yin
analyzed: sngar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas so zhes bshad du zin kyang 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gnas yin no zhes bye brag gi tshig bsdu ba yin
translated: Although it was previously explained that the perfection of wisdom is the station of the perfection of wisdom, this is a summary of the specific term, ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom itself is the station.‚Äù

original: te / sngar bstan pa dang mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir sgra tsam ni 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: te / sngar bstan pa dang mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir sgra tsam ni 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Because it is connected with what was previously taught, the mere sound is similar.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang mtshan ma med pa dang / stong pa zhes bya ba rgyun du bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang mtshan ma med pa dang / stong pa zhes bya ba rgyun du bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the inconceivable, the signless, and the empty taught continuously?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes bshad ce na /
translated: How is it that the perfection of wisdom itself is explained as the station of the inconceivable?

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, that which is called the perfection of wisdom,

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: the explanation is the remainder.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the non-production of all phenomena.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: skye ba med pa ni de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa zhes lan du mar bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa zhes lan du mar bstan to //
translated: Non-production has been taught many times as thusness and emptiness.

original: skye ba med pa de yang thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i phyir byis pa la sogs pa'i sems la yang yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: skye ba med pa de yang thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i phyir byis pa la sogs pa'i sems la yang yod du zin kyang /
translated: And that non-production is not found in all minds, such as those of the childish, even though it does exist there.

original: 'on kyang de dag gis mi rtogs te gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa stobs can du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gis mi rtogs te gnyis su sgro 'dogs pa stobs can du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nevertheless, they do not realize it, because the powerful reification of duality persists.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgro 'dogs par 'phros pa mtha' dag dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sgro 'dogs par 'phros pa mtha' dag dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is incompatible with all the proliferations of reification.

original: rang rig pas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: It is realized by self-awareness.

original: de bas na skye ba med pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba med pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is distinguished by non-production,

original: chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: the non-production of all phenomena is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su song ba'i don nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su song ba'i don nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'di gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the meaning of ‚Äúgone beyond,‚Äù he also said ‚Äúperfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog mthar phyin cing gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog mthar phyin cing gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ‚Äúgone beyond‚Äù and ‚Äúarrived at‚Äù the supreme perfection of wisdom.

original: skabs la rgol ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skabs la rgol ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to completely eliminate objections to this section,

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bshad pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bshad pa de bas na /
translated: he said, ‚ÄúBecause the non-arising of all phenomena is explained as the perfection of wisdom,

original: @143b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba de ni 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @143b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba de ni 'di lta ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is a synonym for the inconceivable realm.‚Äù

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid dbyings yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid dbyings yin pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te stong pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That inconceivable realm is the realm, so it is the inconceivable realm. It means ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa'i blo thams cad kyi yul du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam pa'i blo thams cad kyi yul du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inconceivable means that it cannot be made an object of the mind of imagination.

original: dbyings ni dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi rigs sam rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyings ni dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi rigs sam rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dhatu means the family or cause of all pure dharmas.

original: de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inconceivable, the unarisen, and the perfection of wisdom, etc., are not different in meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs kyi tshul de lta bu yin pa la the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs kyi tshul de lta bu yin pa la the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not doubt that such is the manner of synonyms.

original: rnam grangs de nyid rgyas par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam grangs de nyid rgyas par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain just that synonym extensively,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings so zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that the inconceivable dhatu is the unarisen dhatu.

original: don de ni bstan ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: don de ni bstan ma thag pa yin no //
translated: That meaning is just what was explained immediately before.

original: skye ba med pa nyid dbyings yin pas skye ba med pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid dbyings yin pas skye ba med pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Since the unarisen itself is the dhatu, it is the unarisen dhatu.

original: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams la yang phal cher sngar bzhin du rigs kyi don yin no //
analyzed: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshig rnams la yang phal cher sngar bzhin du rigs kyi don yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúrealm‚Äù in the above passage should be understood in the same way as it was explained earlier.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba'i chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The realm of non-arising is the Dharma realm, which is like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe lhun gyis grub pa nyid du skye bo gdul bya mtha' dag la yod pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe lhun gyis grub pa nyid du skye bo gdul bya mtha' dag la yod pa /
translated: At that time, it is spontaneously present to all beings who are to be guided.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa ni gang las cig car du skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi stobs bcu la sogs pa ni gang las cig car du skye ba yin no //
translated: The ten powers of the Buddha and so forth arise simultaneously from it.

original: chos kyi dbyings gang lags pa de ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i mtha' dag gi chos kun du 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gang lags pa de ni sgrib par 'gyur ba'i mtha' dag gi chos kun du 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The Dharma realm is the realm of non-arising because it is free from the arising of all phenomena that are obscurations.

original: 'di las sgrib pa kun du 'byung ba dang bral bas kun du 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las sgrib pa kun du 'byung ba dang bral bas kun du 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is free from the arising of obscurations.

original: de nyid khams kyang de yin te /
analyzed: de nyid khams kyang de yin te /
translated: It is also a realm.

original: de skad du bstan zin to //
analyzed: de skad du bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te rgyud gzhan gyi yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te rgyud gzhan gyi yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi dbyings te /
translated: That element which is the non-occurrence of all is the inconceivable element, the element of the inconceivable qualities of other continuums.

original: rigs yin pa'i phyir rang yongs su dag pas gzhan yongs su dag pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de @144a * //
analyzed: rigs yin pa'i phyir rang yongs su dag pas gzhan yongs su dag pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro // bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings gang lags pa de @144a * //
translated: Because of the lineage, the thoroughly pure self produces the thoroughly pure other, and because the effect is in accordance with the cause.

original: bdag gi dbyings te /
analyzed: bdag gi dbyings te /
translated: That element which is the inconceivable element is the element of self.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ston pa'i bdag gi dbyings dang rang bzhin yin pas bdag gi dbyings so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ston pa'i bdag gi dbyings dang rang bzhin yin pas bdag gi dbyings so //
translated: It is the element of self because it is the nature of the wisdom of complete purity, and it is the nature of the self which is taught.

original: des ni ma 'dres pa nyid ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ma 'dres pa nyid ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: By that, its unsharedness is taught to be its own nature.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings so zhes bya ba ni skabs la sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings so zhes bya ba ni skabs la sbyor ba yin no //
translated: That which has such a nature, which is superior, is the expanse of the perfection of wisdom. This is the application to the context.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dbyings so zhes snga ma bzhin du bsdu'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dbyings so zhes snga ma bzhin du bsdu'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is the expanse, as before.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, means therefore.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings te dang gi sbras skye ba med pa'i dbyings dang / kun du 'byung ba med pa'i dbyings kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings te dang gi sbras skye ba med pa'i dbyings dang / kun du 'byung ba med pa'i dbyings kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: The expanse of the perfection of wisdom and the expanse of the self should be known as the expanse of non-arising and the expanse of non-occurrence, indicated by the conjunction and.

original: de dag thams cad gnyis su ma mchis te /üîΩ'di la gnyis kyi dngos por dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gnyis su ma mchis te / 'di la gnyis kyi dngos por dbye ba yod pa ma yin pas gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: All of these are non-dual.üîΩHere, there is no division into two things, so it is non-dual.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is the analysis of just that, which is said to be indivisible.

original: 'di la gnyis su bya ba la sogs pas gnyis su byar yod pa ma yin pas gnyis su dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis su bya ba la sogs pas gnyis su byar yod pa ma yin pas gnyis su dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Here, since it cannot be made twofold by the two, etc., it is not twofold.

original: yang don 'di nyid gtan tshigs dang / gtan tshigs can gyi dngos pos gsal bar byed pa ni gtan tshigs gang gi slad du 'di gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa'i gtan tshigs de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: yang don 'di nyid gtan tshigs dang / gtan tshigs can gyi dngos pos gsal bar byed pa ni gtan tshigs gang gi slad du 'di gnyis su ma mchis te gnyis su dbyer ma mchis pa'i gtan tshigs de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
translated: Moreover, this very meaning is clarified by the example and the exemplified thing. The example is: for what reason is this not twofold, not divided into two? The exemplified thing is: for that reason, this is the inconceivable realm.

original: gnyis mchis na ni gnyis su dbyer med pa nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis mchis na ni gnyis su dbyer med pa nyid mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were twofold, it would not be established as not divided into two.

original: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
translated: For what reason is this the inconceivable realm? For that reason, this is the realm of non-arising.

original: brtags pa'i chos rnams skye ba dang ldan pa yod na ni bsam pa'i yul nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i chos rnams skye ba dang ldan pa yod na ni bsam pa'i yul nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If imputed phenomena were to arise, it would be an object of thought.

original: gang gi slad du 'di skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di skye ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Because it is the realm of non-production, it is the realm of phenomena.

original: de lta ma yin na shin tu dkar ba'i chos rnams kyi rigs yin par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shin tu dkar ba'i chos rnams kyi rigs yin par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be the family of the extremely pure dharmas.

original: de'i sgro 'dogs par 'phros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i skye ba med pa'i dbyings su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgro 'dogs par 'phros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i skye ba med pa'i dbyings su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would not be the realm of non-production, free from all superimpositions of that.

original: gang gi slad du 'di chos kyi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di chos kyi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Because it is the realm of phenomena, it is the realm of non-arising.

original: nyon mongs @144b pa can gyi chos kun du 'byung na ni shin tu rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rigs yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs @144b pa can gyi chos kun du 'byung na ni shin tu rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rigs yin par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If defiled dharmas arose, it would not be the family of the extremely purified dharmas,

original: rang nyid rnam par ma dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid rnam par ma dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would itself be impure.

original: gang gi slad du 'di kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te ;
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di kun du 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te ;
translated: Because it is the realm of non-arising, it is the inconceivable realm.

original: gal te 'di rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi rigs ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di kun du 'byung ba med pa'i rigs su yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di rgyud gzhan la yod pa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi rigs ma yin par gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di kun du 'byung ba med pa'i rigs su yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this were not the type of inconceivable qualities that exist in other continuums, then at that time this would not be the type that is completely arisen.

original: 'di ltar kun du 'byung ba med pa nyid ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i don nyid yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o//
analyzed: 'di ltar kun du 'byung ba med pa nyid ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i don nyid yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'o//
translated: Thus, the very absence of complete arising is the very meaning of complete purity, like a wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bdag gi dbyings te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bdag gi dbyings te /
translated: Because this is the inconceivable realm, therefore this is the realm of self.

original: gal te shin tu rnam par dag pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de'i tshe byis pa'i rgyud bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyang rgyud gzhan gyi yon tan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shin tu rnam par dag pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni de'i tshe byis pa'i rgyud bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyang rgyud gzhan gyi yon tan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: If this were not the nature of complete purity, then at that time the continuum of the TathƒÅgata would not be the cause of the qualities of other continuums, like the continuum of a child.

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no difference.

original: gang gi slad du 'di bdag gi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bdag gi dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings te /
translated: Because this is the realm of self, therefore this is the realm of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na ni shes rab kyi mchog mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na ni shes rab kyi mchog mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the highest wisdom would not be perfected.

original: de'i tshe ma 'dres pa yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ma 'dres pa yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: At that time, it is not reasonable to say that it is unmixed,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is not common.

original: / gang gi slad du 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: / gang gi slad du 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
translated: For the reason that this is the realm of the perfection of wisdom, this is the inconceivable realm.

original: gal te bsam par nus pa yin na ni blo shin tu mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bsam par nus pa yin na ni blo shin tu mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it could be conceived, then the mind would be completely fulfilled.

original: 'di ci'i phyir yang smra bar byed /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir yang smra bar byed /
translated: Why is this said again?

original: 'di sngar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings yin no zhes ma smras sam zhe na /üîΩnyes pa med de skabs la rgol ba sel ba'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di sngar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbyings gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings yin no zhes ma smras sam zhe na / nyes pa med de skabs la rgol ba sel ba'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Wasn't it said earlier that the realm of the perfection of wisdom is the inconceivable realm?

original: 'di smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di smras pa yin no //
translated: There is no fault, because this was said in order to conclude the refutation of objections in this context.

original: de bas na 'di nyid gnas pa des na de gnas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa gnas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid gnas pa des na de gnas pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa gnas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the inconceivable abiding, the abiding of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings lags pa de'i slad du 'di ni yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings te /
translated: Because it is the realm of the inconceivable, it is the realm of non-establishment.

original: srid par gnas pa bzhin du 'khor bar skye ba med do //
analyzed: srid par gnas pa bzhin du 'khor bar skye ba med do //
translated: It is not born in sa·πÉsƒÅra, like abiding in existence.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa @145a * //
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa @145a * //
translated: That which is non-establishment

original: de ni mchis pa ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni mchis pa ma lags te /
translated: is not existent.

original: ma skyes pa ni yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable for the unborn to exist.

original: gang mchis pas lags pa de ni 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyis mi gos te /üîΩshin tu thugs rjes yongs su bzung ba'i phyir bzhugs pa'am /
analyzed: gang mchis pas lags pa de ni 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyis mi gos te / shin tu thugs rjes yongs su bzung ba'i phyir bzhugs pa'am /
translated: That which is existent is not defiled by the dharmas of sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩIt abides due to being completely taken hold of by great compassion.

original: 'ba' zhig kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: Or it is only so, up to this point.

original: de ni 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not perish.

original: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub par mkhas pa ni 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub par mkhas pa ni 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Skill in accomplishing the benefit of others is the abode of the perfection of wisdom for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: That which does not perish is inconceivable.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ya mtshan du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ya mtshan du byed pa yin no //
translated: It is a wonder because it is the supreme of all things.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas de la rgol ba'i lan gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas de la rgol ba'i lan gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: This also is a summary of the reply to the objection from another point of view.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar brtags pa'i dra ba thams cad las dben pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar brtags pa'i dra ba thams cad las dben pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: When thus isolated from the net of all conceptual thought, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
translated: And the Lord himself is of that nature.

original: de bas na de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, the realm of the Tathagata and the realm of the self are not two,

original: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes gsungs te /
translated: nor are they divided.

original: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu bdag pha rol po dag gis brtags par de'i dbyings ni don dam pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa mtha' dag las 'das pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: nang gi byed pa'i skyes bu bdag pha rol po dag gis brtags par de'i dbyings ni don dam pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid du brtags pa mtha' dag las 'das pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The inner creator, the self, is imagined by others to be the ultimate, intrinsic reality, but it is an entity that transcends all such imagined natures,

original: thams cad du yang med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du yang med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at all.

original: skyon med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yang brtags pa'i ngo bo thams cad las dben par gnas pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa yang brtags pa'i ngo bo thams cad las dben par gnas pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du shes pa dang brjod pa'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata, whose nature is the faultless, nondual intuition, is also isolated from all imagined natures and is beyond all knowledge and expression.

original: de lta bu'i tshul du mnyam pas na de ni gnyis su med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du mnyam pas na de ni gnyis su med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Because of such equality, it is said that he is nondual.

original: zla la mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i don kyang ston pa ni mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: zla la mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa'i don kyang ston pa ni mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: The meaning of the s≈´tras is also taught in this way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
translated: In other s≈´tras, the Lord has said, ‚ÄúThe cultivation of the self is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byang med do zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang gnyis su med cing gnyis su byang med do zhes sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, it is not dual and cannot be made dual.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i tshul gyis na bdag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i tshul gyis na bdag dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self and the perfection of wisdom are of the same nature, according to the method just explained.

original: de yang ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma @145b rtogs nas dris pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ma @145b rtogs nas dris pa ste /
translated: And why is that? is a question asked by one who has not understood the intention.

original: bdag bsgom pa ni phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: bdag bsgom pa ni phyin ci log yin la /
translated: The cultivation of the self is erroneous,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: but the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is non-erroneous.

original: phyin ci log dang cig shos gnyis ni gcig yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang cig shos gnyis ni gcig yin par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the erroneous and the opposite are the same,üîΩbecause they are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i bzhed pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa'i bzhed pa ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the intended meaning is:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni bdag gi dbyings kyi tshig bla dags lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di ni bdag gi dbyings kyi tshig bla dags lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Blessed One, this so-called perfection of wisdom is a synonym for the realm of the self.

original: rnam pa de dag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ni bshad zin to //
translated: Those aspects have already been explained.

original: 'on kyang gsung gi bzhed pa pha rol pos ma rtogs nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris te ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtan pa rang dbang can la sogs pa ni de dang bral te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsung gi bzhed pa pha rol pos ma rtogs nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris te ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtan pa rang dbang can la sogs pa ni de dang bral te /
translated: He thinks that the perfection of wisdom is stable, independent, and so forth, and that it is free from that,

original: de las bzlog pa bdag gi ngo bo yin par rtogs par byed par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa bdag gi ngo bo yin par rtogs par byed par bsams pa'o //
translated: and that it is the opposite of that, the nature of the self.

original: de nas bzhed pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bzhed pa gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: Then, to clarify his meaning, he says,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag gi dbyings bdag gi don dam pa'i rang gi ngo bo de kho na nyid sgom pa la brtson bas 'tshal ba des chags pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis bdag gi dbyings bdag gi don dam pa'i rang gi ngo bo de kho na nyid sgom pa la brtson bas 'tshal ba des chags pa ma mchis pa'i dbyings 'tshal te /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, whoever seeks the realm of the self, the ultimate nature of the self, by striving in the meditation on suchness, seeks the realm of nonattachment.

original: de ni bdag gi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi rang bzhin gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of the self.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang pha rol po dag dgongs pa ma rtogs pa la gang gi chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol po dag dgongs pa ma rtogs pa la gang gi chags pa ma mchis pa nyid 'tshal ba des chos gang yang 'tshal ba ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
translated: However, those who do not understand the intention of the opponent, who seek nonattachment, do not seek any phenomena at all.

original: de la ni mtshan mar bya ba'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni mtshan mar bya ba'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no entity that can be taken as a sign.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought behind ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù is this:

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chags pa med pa mkhyen pa ni des skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis shes bya thams cad snang ba yin na ji ltar de ci yang mi mkhyen pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chags pa med pa mkhyen pa ni des skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis shes bya thams cad snang ba yin na ji ltar de ci yang mi mkhyen pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the TathƒÅgata, which is free from attachment, is the illumination of all objects of knowledge with the wisdom that is possessed of a single moment. So how is it that he does not know anything at all?

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam par mi nus pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam par mi nus pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThus, the inconceivable, the knowledge that cannot be imagined, is the knowledge of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: des ni 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan de la yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa gzhan de la yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the other, the apprehending consciousness, does not exist for him.

original: 'di'i gzung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i gzung ba med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there is no object for him,

original: chos gang la yang shes pa ma mchis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos gang la yang shes pa ma mchis pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúBecause the knowledge of the Buddha is the non-knowledge of any dharma.‚Äù

original: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshig pa ni bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes ni 'di skad du de ni gzung ba ma yin la des kyang 'dzin @146a * //
analyzed: gzung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par bshig pa ni bstan zin pa'i phyir ro // des ni 'di skad du de ni gzung ba ma yin la des kyang 'dzin @146a * //
translated: The characteristic of the object has already been refuted.

original: pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: pa ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: This shows that it is not an object, and that it does not apprehend.

original: shes pa gzhan dang gzung ba yang stong pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan dang gzung ba yang stong pa yin no //
translated: The emptiness of consciousness and the object is also like that.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i phrin las mdzad pa la khong bzo ba 'gro ba'i bla ma rnams kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i phrin las mdzad pa la khong bzo ba 'gro ba'i bla ma rnams kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin ni snang ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, the nature of the wisdom of the gurus of the world, who are skilled in the activity of omniscience, is appearance.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bsam pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that? The thought is as follows.

original: shes pa po'i ye shes 'di ni dngos po yin la /üîΩdngos po yang byed pa po dang las la ltos pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa po'i ye shes 'di ni dngos po yin la / dngos po yang byed pa po dang las la ltos pa yin na /
translated: The wisdom of the knower is a thing.üîΩAnd a thing depends on an agent and an object.

original: las byed ni gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: las byed ni gnyi ga dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The object of action is related to both.

original: de'i phyir / ye shes de ni don dam par na mchis pa ma lags te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / ye shes de ni don dam par na mchis pa ma lags te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat wisdom does not exist ultimately.‚Äù

original: de'i ye shes nyid ni brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i ye shes nyid ni brtags pa yin te /
translated: The wisdom itself is imputed.

original: yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not real.

original: gal te ye shes de don dam par med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ye shes de don dam par med pa yin na /
translated: If that wisdom does not exist ultimately,

original: 'o na des ji ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na des ji ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur /
translated: then how could it turn the wheel of Dharma?

original: 'di ltar gsung dbyangs 'byung ba ni ye shes sngon du song ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsung dbyangs 'byung ba ni ye shes sngon du song ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The arising of the melody of speech is not preceded by wisdom.

original: gang don dam par ma mchis pa de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang don dam par ma mchis pa de chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which does not exist ultimately turn the wheel of Dharma?

original: bden te bskor ba nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te bskor ba nyid med pa yin no //
translated: It is true that it does not turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble TathƒÅgataguhya S≈´tra says,

original: zhi ba'i blo gros gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas /
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas /
translated: ‚Äú≈öƒÅntimati, on the night when the TathƒÅgata fully awakened to complete buddhahood,üîΩand on the night when he will pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: gang gi tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar der de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes gcig kyang brjod pa ma gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar der de bzhin gshegs pas ye shes gcig kyang brjod pa ma gsungs so //
translated: the TathƒÅgata has not uttered a single word.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i blo gros de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ≈öƒÅntimati, the TathƒÅgata is always in equipoise.

original: yang bla ma de'i tshogs kyi shugs kyis yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du ji ltar 'dod par rtsig pa la sogs pa las kyang chos 'chad pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang bla ma de'i tshogs kyi shugs kyis yid bzhin gyi nor bu bzhin du ji ltar 'dod par rtsig pa la sogs pa las kyang chos 'chad pa 'byung ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, through the power of the assembly of that guru, like a wish-fulfilling jewel, the Dharma is taught even from walls and so on, just as one wishes.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las kyang chags pa med pa dang dngos po med pa dang / yul med pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i don legs par drangs pa yin no zhes dgongs nas zhar la go rims bzhin du ston pa ni gang gi tshe ye shes de don dam par ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'o zhes
