analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las kyang chags pa med pa dang dngos po med pa dang / yul med pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i don legs par drangs pa yin no zhes dgongs nas zhar la go rims bzhin du ston pa ni gang gi tshe ye shes de don dam par ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni chags pa ma mchis pa'o zhes
translated: Thinking that if one does it this way, the meaning of the statements in other s≈´tras of the absence of attachment, the absence of things, the absence of objects, and so on are well drawn out, he presents the order of these in passing: When that wisdom does not exist ultimately, at that time that wisdom is without attachment.

original: gsungs te / chags pa med pa ni mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: gsungs te / chags pa med pa ni mtshon pa yin te /
translated: He says this because the absence of attachment is an illustration.

original: gnod sems med pa dang rmongs pa med pa la sogs pa @146b yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod sems med pa dang rmongs pa med pa la sogs pa @146b yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of malice, the absence of confusion, and so on should also be understood.

original: 'di'i chags pa yul la zhen pa'i 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pas chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i chags pa yul la zhen pa'i 'dod chags yod pa ma yin pas chags pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no attachment here, i.e., no passion for objects, there is no attachment.

original: dngos po yang las dang 'brel pa'i phyir de la chags pa yin par srid pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yang las dang 'brel pa'i phyir de la chags pa yin par srid pa yin no //
translated: And since the object is related to action, it is possible that there is attachment to it.

original: 'di'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dngos po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But there is no object here,

original: gcad par bya ba'i las mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i las mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because it has been shown that the action of cutting is not tenable.

original: 'o na yul med pa yin na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i shes pa ji ltar chags par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yul med pa yin na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i shes pa ji ltar chags par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no object, how can the consciousness of ordinary people, etc., be attached?

original: yul yod par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yul yod par mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is because of the adherence to the existence of an object.

original: 'khrul pa'i sa bon yang spangs pa de la ni mngon par zhen pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i sa bon yang spangs pa de la ni mngon par zhen pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And for one who has abandoned the seed of error, there is no adherence.

original: gang gis gang la chags pa de la ni gdon mi za bar de yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis gang la chags pa de la ni gdon mi za bar de yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur te /
translated: For one who is attached to something, if that exists, then the object exists, without a doubt,

original: chags pa ni de gnyis la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa ni de gnyis la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because attachment is based on those two.

original: chags pa med pa la ni dngos po gang la yang dngos por gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chags pa med pa la ni dngos po gang la yang dngos por gyur pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no entity whatsoever for the nonattached,

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de chags pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhen that wisdom is nonattached, at that time that wisdom is not an entity.‚Äù

original: gzhan la ma yin te dngos po gang yang yod pa ma yin pas dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin te dngos po gang yang yod pa ma yin pas dngos po ma mchis pa'o //
translated: It is not something else, because it is not an entity that exists, so it is not an entity.

original: gang zhig yod na de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni dngos po yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni dngos po yin la /
translated: That which exists and conforms to its aspect is an entity.

original: de ni de'i yul yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: de ni de'i yul yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to say that that is its object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i bye brag rgyu nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i bye brag rgyu nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference between conformity and reversal is the cause of the object.

original: dngos po med na ni yul yang gang gi yin snyam nas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med na ni yul yang gang gi yin snyam nas de'i phyir /
translated: If there is no entity, whose object is it? Therefore,

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de dngos po ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de dngos po ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni yul ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so ;
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhen that wisdom is not an entity, at that time that wisdom is not an object.‚Äù

original: / gang zhig la yul gzugs la sogs pa yod pa de la ni rten mig la sogs pa yin par rigs kyi /
analyzed: / gang zhig la yul gzugs la sogs pa yod pa de la ni rten mig la sogs pa yin par rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable that that which has objects such as form has a basis such as the eye.üîΩBut if there are no objects, a basis is unreasonable.

original: yul med na ni rten yang rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas gang gi tshe ye shes de la yul ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni mi gnas pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yul med na ni rten yang rigs pa ma yin no snyam nas gang gi tshe ye shes de la yul ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni mi gnas pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, when that wisdom has no object, then that wisdom is non-abiding.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i yul shes par bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po skyes pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o /üîΩ// /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa bam po lnga pa /üîΩji skad du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi @147a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i yul shes par bya ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i dbang po skyes pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o / // /'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa rgya cher bshad pa bam po lnga pa / ji skad du mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi @147a * //
translated: Thus, it is intended that the faculties such as the eye are produced in order to cognize objects such as form.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness is produced in dependence on the eye and form.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe yong ye dus thams cad du yul med na de'i tshe gang la gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po byung /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yong ye dus thams cad du yul med na de'i tshe gang la gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po byung /
translated: When at all times there are no objects, then what is the basis for the production of the faculties?

original: yul med par yang rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten par pha rol bo dag 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul med par yang rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten par pha rol bo dag 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt the opponents believe that consciousness, which is not an object, is based on the sense faculties?

original: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis skra la sogs pa shes pa bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rab rib kyis nyams pa'i mig gis skra la sogs pa shes pa bzhin du 'di yang de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like the consciousness of hair-nets, etc., produced by diseased vision.

original: lan de ni snang ba tsam yin gyi de rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan de ni snang ba tsam yin gyi de rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The answer is that this is merely an appearance, not a consciousness.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'di yang rten la sogs pas bskyed pa yin par mi 'dod na de ci rgyu med pa can yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'di yang rten la sogs pas bskyed pa yin par mi 'dod na de ci rgyu med pa can yin nam /
translated: If you do not accept that the nature of things is produced by a basis, etc., then are they causeless?

original: skal ldan rnams kyi snang ba tsam yin du zin kyang rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: skal ldan rnams kyi snang ba tsam yin du zin kyang rgyu med pa can ma yin te /
translated: Even though they are merely appearances for the fortunate, they are not causeless.

original: dbang po dang yul med par yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtshungs pa med pa thugs kyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mthu tsam rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul med par yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mtshungs pa med pa thugs kyi rgyud la gnas pa'i mthu tsam rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is merely the power that resides in the mind-stream of the accumulation of merit and knowledge without equal, even without sense faculties and objects.

original: gang zhig gnas pa yin pa de ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gnas pa yin pa de ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams la brten pa yin no //
translated: That which is the basis is based on the desire realm, etc.

original: gnas mig la sogs pa yang der gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas mig la sogs pa yang der gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eyes, etc. are also included in that.

original: gnas pa yod pa ma yin na ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rten kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa ma yin na ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rten kyang yod pa ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: If there is no abiding, then there is no support, like space, etc.

original: gang gi tshe ye shes de mi gnas pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni rten ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so //üîΩgang zhig 'dod pa la sogs pa la brten pa de ni gdon mi za bar der las dge ba dang mi dge ba gzhan dag gis bskyed pa 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ye shes de mi gnas pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni rten ma mchis pa'o zhes gsungs so // gang zhig 'dod pa la sogs pa la brten pa de ni gdon mi za bar der las dge ba dang mi dge ba gzhan dag gis bskyed pa 'thob pa'am /
translated: When that wisdom does not abide, then that wisdom is without support.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were to depend on desire, etc., then it would certainly obtain or arise from other virtuous and nonvirtuous actions generated there.

original: de gang la yang brten pa med na ci'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag mi 'thad snyam nas gang gi tshe ye shes de brten pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o //üîΩma thob pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yang brten pa med na ci'i phyir rnam pa 'di dag mi 'thad snyam nas gang gi tshe ye shes de brten pa ma mchis pa de'i tshe ye shes de ni ma bskyed pa'o // ma thob pa'o //
translated: If it does not depend on anything, then why are these aspects not tenable? When that wisdom is without support, then that wisdom is not generated.üîΩIt is not obtained.

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It does not arise.

original: 'di yang bstan pa tsam yin gyi thob par mi 'gyur ba yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang bstan pa tsam yin gyi thob par mi 'gyur ba yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is also just an indication, but it should be understood that one does not obtain it.

original: brjod par bzhed pa ma rtogs nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris pa ni /
analyzed: brjod par bzhed pa ma rtogs nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris pa ni /
translated: Not understanding what is intended, he asks, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: gal te kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shugs kyi lam gyis 'khor ba ji srid du ye shes de 'jug pa yin na de ci'i phyir ma bskyed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbrjod par bzhed pa ston pa na ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis @147b pa'am /
analyzed: gal te kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi shugs kyi lam gyis 'khor ba ji srid du ye shes de 'jug pa yin na de ci'i phyir ma bskyed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // brjod par bzhed pa ston pa na ye shes de ni yon tan gyis 'dus bgyis @147b pa'am /
translated: If that wisdom engages in sa·πÉsƒÅra for as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra exists by the power of the accumulation of merit and wisdom that is free of wrongdoing, why is it not generated? That is the meaning.üîΩWhen showing what is intended, he says, ‚ÄúThat wisdom is not conditioned by virtue

original: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yon tan ma lags pas 'dus bgyis pa ma lags pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: or by nonvirtue.‚Äù

original: yon tan ni 'dir dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams yin par bzhed ro //
analyzed: yon tan ni 'dir dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams yin par bzhed ro //
translated: Here, virtue is asserted to be contaminated virtuous phenomena.

original: yon tan ma yin pa ni mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa ni mi dge ba ste /
translated: Nonvirtue is nonvirtue.

original: de dag gis 'dus ma byas pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'dus ma byas pa ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the natural outcome of uncontaminated states.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the uncontaminated states that exist in the bodhisattva stage are its cause.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de yang yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pas 'dus byas ma yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de yang yon tan dang yon tan ma yin pas 'dus byas ma yin te /
translated: The thought is that it is not conditioned by virtue or nonvirtue,

original: ston pa po yin pa'i phyir bdag cag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa po yin pa'i phyir bdag cag la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: because it is the teacher, like the conceptual consciousnesses of ourselves and others.

original: 'di ltar des na rnam par dag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis ni yon tan dang yon tan ma yin par bstan pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar des na rnam par dag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis ni yon tan dang yon tan ma yin par bstan pa yin pas gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you think that this reason is unestablished because it has been shown that both purification and affliction are virtue and nonvirtue,

original: 'di ltar ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said that this wisdom is inconceivable, etc.

original: bsam pa dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / rtog pa rnams las gang gi phyir 'das pa yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / mngon par brjod pa dang / rtog pa rnams las gang gi phyir 'das pa yin pa de bas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable because it transcends thought, expression, and imagination.

original: mngon par brjod pa ni ngag kun nas slong par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa ni ngag kun nas slong par byed pa ste /
translated: Expression is the instigation of speech.

original: mngon par brjod pa thams cad ni rang gi snang ba la phyi rol bzhin du sgra'i don nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na 'di ni shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i ston pa po la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //üîΩde rtog pa dang brjod pa dang bral pa de'i slad du yon tan nam /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa thams cad ni rang gi snang ba la phyi rol bzhin du sgra'i don nyid du mngon par zhen pa yin na 'di ni shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag spangs pa'i ston pa po la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin to // de rtog pa dang brjod pa dang bral pa de'i slad du yon tan nam /
translated: All expressions are the adherence to the meaning of words as external objects in one‚Äôs own appearances. But this is not the case for the Teacher who has abandoned all the obscurations to omniscience.üîΩSince it is free from imagination and expression, how can it be taught as a virtue

original: yon tan ma lags par yang ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: yon tan ma lags par yang ji skad du bstan par bgyi /
translated: or as a non-virtue?

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs 'di 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs 'di 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: For what reason is this argument established?

original: gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi slad du ye shes de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin te /
translated: Because that wisdom is inconceivable.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba stong pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearances of imagination are empty.

original: de ci'i phyir ye shes de bsam du ma mchis pa ste rtog par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ye shes de bsam du ma mchis pa ste rtog par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is that? Because that wisdom is inconceivable, which means that it is not conceptual.

original: bstan zin ba mjug sdud par byed pa ni gang de ltar shes pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du rnam par gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags so zhes tha snyad du bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bstan zin ba mjug sdud par byed pa ni gang de ltar shes pa de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul du rnam par gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes lags so zhes tha snyad du bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The conclusion of what has been presented is that one who knows in that way is to be conventionally designated as ‚Äúthe one who abides in the manner of non-observation, the wisdom of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: de ltar shes pa po'i shes pa la dngos por rnam par rtog pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa po'i shes pa la dngos por rnam par rtog pa bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the conceptualization of the knower‚Äôs consciousness as a thing,

original: byed pa po dang byed pa la @148a * //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa la @148a * //
translated: the conceptualization of the agent, action, and so on

original: sogs par rnam par rtog pa de sel bar byed pa ni ye shes byed pa po 'am byed pa des ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i chos gang yang kun mthong ba'i tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
analyzed: sogs par rnam par rtog pa de sel bar byed pa ni ye shes byed pa po 'am byed pa des ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i chos gang yang kun mthong ba'i tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa 'am /
translated: is eliminated. The wisdom that is the agent or action does not fully and completely realize any phenomena, such as suffering, origin, and so on, in the manner of seeing.

original: rang gi ngo bo med pa'i tshul du mkhyen pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med pa'i tshul du mkhyen pa ma mchis so //
translated: It does not know them in the manner of their lack of intrinsic reality.

original: yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par rtog pa 'di sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni sngon gyi mtha' nas mchis pa 'am /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur bar rnam par rtog pa 'di sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni sngon gyi mtha' nas mchis pa 'am /
translated: This wisdom does not come from the past

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mchis pa ma lags te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas mchis pa ma lags te /
translated: nor does it go to the future.

original: skad cig ma tsam gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma tsam gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not even abide for a moment.

original: sngon gyi mthar 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: It does not come from the past.

original: phyi ma'i mthar 'dug pa ma yin na sngon gyi mtha' nas ma yin zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar 'dug pa ma yin na sngon gyi mtha' nas ma yin zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it does not come from the past, then it is not reasonable to say that it does not come from the past.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' nas ma yin zhes bya ba de yang ji skad du bstan /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' nas ma yin zhes bya ba de yang ji skad du bstan /
translated: How can it be said that it does not go to the future?

original: 'das pa yang de ltar du 'gyur ba ni med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa yang de ltar du 'gyur ba ni med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that it does not exist in the past in that way, then it does not exist in the future in that way either.

original: grangs can rnams so sor brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs can rnams so sor brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas state that it is individual.

original: de dag gis ni 'das pa'i bum pa yang bum par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'das pa'i bum pa yang bum par 'gyur te /
translated: For them, a past pot is also a pot,

original: gang gi tshe de nyid kyi chag grugs las kyang bum par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid kyi chag grugs las kyang bum par byed pa yin no //
translated: because when it is broken, it is made into another pot.

original: yang na 'di ni 'pho bar smra ba sel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni 'pho bar smra ba sel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Or this verse refutes the theory of transmigration.

original: 'das pa'i dus bor nas 'phos te 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus bor nas 'phos te 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it come having passed over from a previous time.üîΩThe elimination of the discriminations of permanence and impermanence is stated in the passage:

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag par rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni sngon skyes pa yang ma lags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag par rnam par rtog pa sel bar byed pa ni ye shes de ni sngon skyes pa yang ma lags zhes bya ste /
translated: That pristine wisdom is not born previously,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi dri ma dang bral ba de lta bu'i shes pa'i rjes su ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi dri ma dang bral ba de lta bu'i shes pa'i rjes su ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not born subsequent to a pristine wisdom that is free from the stain of all discriminations in the state of a bodhisattva.

original: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags te /
analyzed: ye shes de ni sngon ma skyes pa yang ma lags te /
translated: That pristine wisdom is not born previously,

original: rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid sngon yang skyes pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis de kho na nyid mthong ba'i bdag nyid sngon yang skyes pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is born previously as the nature of the vision of reality.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i tshul du sngon yang skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa'i tshul du sngon yang skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is born previously in the manner of an imputation.üîΩThe elimination of the discrimination of transformation is stated in the passage:

original: rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba sel bar byed pa ni sngon ma skyes pa'i slad du gang ma skyes pa de ni nub par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba sel bar byed pa ni sngon ma skyes pa'i slad du gang ma skyes pa de ni nub par yang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That which is not born does not set.

original: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir de ltar de rnam par dben pa'i ngo bos nub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i bdag nyid du ma skyes pa'i phyir de ltar de rnam par dben pa'i ngo bos nub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: As such, it is not that it disappears by way of the nature of its isolation, because it is not produced in the nature of the absence of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not that its nature transforms into something else.

original: chad par rtog pa sel bar byed pa ni chad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chad par rtog pa sel bar byed pa ni chad par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The elimination of the conception of annihilation is ‚Äúit does not become annihilated.‚Äù

original: thams cad du log par gyur pa ma yin @148b te ;
analyzed: thams cad du log par gyur pa ma yin @148b te ;
translated: It is not that it completely ceases to exist,

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it remains for as long as cyclic existence lasts by the power of its previous aspiration.

original: 'dra ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dra ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the conception of similarity,

original: ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ye shes de dang 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThat wisdom is not similar to any other.‚Äù

original: ye shes de dang gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa shes pa 'dra ba gang yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: ye shes de dang gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa dang 'brel pa shes pa 'dra ba gang yang ma mchis te /
translated: That wisdom is not similar to any other wisdom that is related to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing ye shes de ni 'dra ba ma mchis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni bsam gyis mi khyab cing ye shes de ni 'dra ba ma mchis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is said to be inconceivable and that wisdom is said to be incomparable.

original: ye shes de ni thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes de ni thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: That wisdom is not observed to have a beginning, middle, or end.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni thog ma med pa'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis srid pa'i chu bo ji srid par gnas pa mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni thog ma med pa'i phyir dang / thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis srid pa'i chu bo ji srid par gnas pa mtha' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is naturally luminous, it has no beginning, and because it abides for as long as the river of existence lasts through the force of great compassion, it has no end.

original: thog ma'i mtha' la ltos nas brtag pa'i dbus kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma'i mtha' la ltos nas brtag pa'i dbus kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is unreasonable to posit a middle in dependence on an initial end.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is like space.

original: ye shes de la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'i 'am gyi sgra ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ye shes de la mnyam pa 'am mi mnyam pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'i 'am gyi sgra ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In that wisdom, equality or inequality is not observed. The word or in the root verse means equality and inequality.

original: de la mnyam pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de la mnyam pa ni tshad ma dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: There, equality is the nature that possesses valid cognition.

original: rtogs par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par sla ba yin no //
translated: It is easy to understand.

original: mi mnyam pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni tshad mas gnod pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Unevenness is the nature of being harmed by valid cognition.

original: rtogs par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par dga' ba yin no //
translated: It is what is to be delighted in.

original: gnyis po de ni de la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis po de ni de la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Those two do not exist in that,

original: mnyam pa kho na'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnyam pa kho na'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that it has the nature of being even.

original: yang na 'am gyi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na 'am gyi sgra ni rnam par rtog pa'i don te /
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúalternative.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par rtog pa yod pa ni mnyam pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa yod pa ni mnyam pa kho na yin te /
translated: In that, the alternative that exists is evenness alone.

original: rnam pa thams cad du shin tu bzang ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du shin tu bzang ba'i phyir de'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no//
translated: It is taught that it is not the nature of any aspect at all, because it is extremely good.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is uneven and even.

original: chos thams cad kyi mchog mnyam pa med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzhan dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mchog mnyam pa med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gzhan dang mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The unequaled, supreme of all phenomena, the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata, is equal to and the same as other [wisdoms].

original: ye shes de la ni de dang 'dra ba cung zad tsam 'dra ba yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ye shes de la ni de dang 'dra ba cung zad tsam 'dra ba yang mi dmigs te /
translated: In that wisdom, not even the slightest bit of similarity is observed.

original: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du ye shes de ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that wisdom is unequaled.

original: 'di dang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing similar to it.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chags pa dang 'dra ba med pa'i bar du bstan pa thos nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / chags pa dang 'dra ba med pa'i bar du bstan pa thos nas /
translated: Having heard this teaching on the inconceivable wisdom of the BhagavƒÅn up to the absence of attachment,

original: kha cig 'di snyam du ye shes 'di ni mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam ci /
analyzed: kha cig 'di snyam du ye shes 'di ni mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam ci /
translated: some may think, ‚ÄúIs this wisdom not changeable?‚Äù

original: gzhan du @149a * //
analyzed: gzhan du @149a * //
translated: Others may think,

original: de skad du bstan du zin kyang 'dir de ltar ma bstan /
analyzed: de skad du bstan du zin kyang 'dir de ltar ma bstan /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is taught like that, it is not taught like that here.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar mi 'jigs pa'i skabs su nga yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi 'jigs pa'i skabs su nga yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pas mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the context of fearlessness, it is said, ‚ÄúIn my perfect complete enlightenment, I am unshakable by ascetics, brahmins, gods, demons, BrahmƒÅ, or anyone else.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: de'i phyir klan ka de spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir klan ka de spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon that fault, the BhagavƒÅn said,

original: 'jam dpal ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ye shes 'di mi bsgyur ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, is this wisdom not changeable?‚Äù

original: ci zhes bya ba khong nas phyung ste tshig zur du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba khong nas phyung ste tshig zur du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúwhat‚Äù should be extracted from within and expressed as a separate word.

original: de ci bsgyur ba yin nam gang gis na khyod kyis de ltar ma brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci bsgyur ba yin nam gang gis na khyod kyis de ltar ma brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is it that you have changed, that you say, ‚ÄúDo not say that‚Äù?

original: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das ye shes 'di ni ma bgyis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das ye shes 'di ni ma bgyis pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the answer is stated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, this wisdom is not fabricated,‚Äù and so on.

original: yon tan dang / yon tan ma yin pas 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir 'di mi bsgyur ba yin par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan dang / yon tan ma yin pas 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir 'di mi bsgyur ba yin par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not conditioned by good qualities or bad qualities, it is tenable that it is not changed.

original: de bas na logs shig tu ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bas na logs shig tu ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not taught separately.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa dang mi mthun pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyu mthun pa dang mi mthun pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning. It is intended that there is no cause or effect of the uncontaminated.

original: gzhan yang 'di la bsgyur ba dang mi bsgyur ba yin par dogs pa'i gnas med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la bsgyur ba dang mi bsgyur ba yin par dogs pa'i gnas med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, there is no basis for doubt that this is changed or not changed.

original: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po kho na zhig yin na ni bsgyur ba dang mi bsgyur ba'i grangs su gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po kho na zhig yin na ni bsgyur ba dang mi bsgyur ba'i grangs su gzhug par bya ste /
translated: If it were only the nature of the perfected, it would be included in the enumeration of changed or not changed.

original: k'ara sh'a pa na zong du bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: k'ara sh'a pa na zong du bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: like a kƒÅr·π£ƒÅpa·πáa coin that is not made into an ornament.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes de ni chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ngo bos don dam par ma grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes de ni chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ngo bos don dam par ma grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: The Blessed One‚Äôs gnosis is not ultimately established at all, by the nature of the complete enlightenment of all phenomena.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phrin las mdzad pa dag ni kun rdzob tu de ltar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phrin las mdzad pa dag ni kun rdzob tu de ltar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The activities of its complete enlightenment are taught in that way conventionally.

original: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpes nye bar bstan pa sngar byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pa'i dpes nye bar bstan pa sngar byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that very [gnosis] was previously taught by worldly examples,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na k'ar sh'a pa na rtags ma btab pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na k'ar sh'a pa na rtags ma btab pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúFor example, Blessed One, an unmarked kƒÅr·π£ƒÅpa·πáa coin‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: rtags ma btab pa ni gang legs par ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: rtags ma btab pa ni gang legs par ma byas pa ste /
translated: Unmarked means not well-made.

original: rgyas ma btab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyas ma btab pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not stamped.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe'i chos don la nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dpe'i chos don la nye bar sbyor ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, likewise this gnosis‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on connects the qualities of the example to the meaning.

original: ma bgyis pa nas ma 'gags pa'i bar ni mnyam pa nyid du 'dug pa yin te /
analyzed: ma bgyis pa nas ma 'gags pa'i bar ni mnyam pa nyid du 'dug pa yin te /
translated: The state from non-production up to non-cessation is the same.

original: rtags kyis rnam par bsgyur ba'i rjes su @149b 'brangs te bsgyur ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtags kyis rnam par bsgyur ba'i rjes su @149b 'brangs te bsgyur ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not that it is transformed by a sign, nor is it that it is not transformed.

original: mi bsgyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: mi bsgyur ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: This is the way to understand the enumeration.

original: ma bsgrubs pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni snga ma snga ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni snga ma snga ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúnot produced,‚Äù etc., are taught in order to show the previous ones.

original: ma 'gags pa'i tshig ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid thams cad med par bstan pas shin tu yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa'i tshig ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid thams cad med par bstan pas shin tu yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid yin par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-cessation‚Äù is said to be unconditioned because it shows the absence of all the characteristics of conditioned states.

original: gnas pa ma bkag pa ni 'di skye ba las logs shig na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa ma bkag pa ni 'di skye ba las logs shig na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-negation of duration is because it does not exist separately from arising.

original: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpar ma gyur pa gang gis kyang lhag par mos par nus pa ma yin no zhes thabs gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i skye bo dag 'di la nyan par gzhug pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bstan pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpar ma gyur pa gang gis kyang lhag par mos par nus pa ma yin no zhes thabs gzhan gyis byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i skye bo dag 'di la nyan par gzhug pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir
translated: In order to show that those who have become bodhisattvas by other means should listen to this,

analyzed: / 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa de ltar bstan pa 'di la su dag mos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, those who believe in this teaching of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'khor ba'i chos can yang ma lags la /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, those who are not characterized by the dharmas of sa·πÉsƒÅra,

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yang ma lags pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / bye brag tu mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga la mi gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: and are not characterized by the dharmas of parinirvƒÅ·πáa‚Ä¶‚Äù means that the bodhisattvas do not abide in either sa·πÉsƒÅra or nirvƒÅ·πáa, whether with remainder or without remainder, or in the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is distinguished as two.

original: 'khor bar ma gtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor bar ma gtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not excluded from sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: skyon du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see it as a fault.

original: thugs rje can yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par bzhugs kyang /
analyzed: thugs rje can yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das par bzhugs kyang /
translated: Even though they dwell in nirvana,

analyzed: de lta bu de dag kyang gang zhe na gang dag 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What are they like? They are those who are not shaken from the perishing aggregates, etc.

original: 'jig tshogs kyi sgras 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs kyi sgras 'jig tshogs la lta ba la bya ste /
translated: The perishing aggregates are the view of the perishing aggregates,

original: tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig tha ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the last word is drawn out.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de gang zag la bdag med par sgom pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin na ji ltar nyon mongs pa zad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de gang zag la bdag med par sgom pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin na ji ltar nyon mongs pa zad par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is that? If that is the nature of the meditation on the selflessness of persons, how can the afflictions not be exhausted?

original: 'di'i lan ni mi bas pa ni chen po la sogs pa spong ba'i rim gyis bas par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni mi bas pa ni chen po la sogs pa spong ba'i rim gyis bas par mi 'gyur /
translated: The answer is: The inexhaustible is not exhausted by the process of abandoning the great, etc.

original: rnam par chung ba'i chung ba thams cad nas thams cad spangs pas @150a * //
analyzed: rnam par chung ba'i chung ba thams cad nas thams cad spangs pas @150a * //
translated: All the smallest of the small is abandoned.

original: yongs su pas par yang mi mchi'o //
analyzed: yongs su pas par yang mi mchi'o //
translated: It is not exhausted.üîΩSince there is no exhaustion here, it is inexhaustible.

original: 'di la yongs su zad pa yod pa ma yin pas mi bas pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su zad pa yod pa ma yin pas mi bas pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since the perishable collection and desire, etc., are non-existent, they are exhausted.

original: 'jig tshogs la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas rab tu phye ba rnams ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la sogs pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas rab tu phye ba rnams ni med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the perishable collection, etc., are distinguished by the aspects of grasped and grasper, they are non-existent.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gi ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perishable collection view operates in the aspect of self and entities connected to the self.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa ni yul yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba la sogs pa la chags pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yin no zhes dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la sogs pa ni yul yid du 'ong ba dang mi 'ong ba la sogs pa la chags pa'i rnam par 'jug pa yin no zhes dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: Desire, hatred, delusion, etc., operate in the aspect of attachment to pleasant, unpleasant, etc., objects.

original: 'o na rnam pa 'di dag gis na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa yang 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod la /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa 'di dag gis na so so'i skye bo la sogs pa yang 'jig tshogs las kyang ma bskyod la /
translated: If this is the intention, then even ordinary beings, etc., are not shaken from the perishable collection.

original: de dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi zad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi zad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, those attachments and so on are not exhausted at all.

original: zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su zad par mi 'gro ba yin pas de dag las lhag pa ci yod na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de skad du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur ba dang / yongs su zad par mi 'gro ba yin pas de dag las lhag pa ci yod na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de skad du bstan zhe na /
translated: Since they are not exhausted, and do not go to complete exhaustion, what is superior to them that the bodhisattvas would be taught?

original: ma yin te de dag ni chos la bdag med pa goms pa dang bral bas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de dag ni chos la bdag med pa goms pa dang bral bas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, they are not, because they are devoid of the cultivation of the selflessness of dharmas and therefore do not realize suchness.

original: skyes bu brtan po de dag la ni lan mang du thabs mang pos yun ring por chos la bdag med pa bsgoms pas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu brtan po de dag la ni lan mang du thabs mang pos yun ring por chos la bdag med pa bsgoms pas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But those steadfast ones do, because they have cultivated the selflessness of dharmas for a long time in many ways.

original: de bas na de nyid kyi dbang du byas te de skad bstan pa rigs pa yin no //üîΩbdag nyid chen po de dag ni chos thams cad rang gi dngos po med pa yin no /
analyzed: de bas na de nyid kyi dbang du byas te de skad bstan pa rigs pa yin no // bdag nyid chen po de dag ni chos thams cad rang gi dngos po med pa yin no /
translated: Therefore it is appropriate to teach that to them.üîΩThose great beings think with great compassion, ‚ÄúAll dharmas are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: sems can rnams ni dngos por mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes thugs rje chen pos dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni dngos por mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes thugs rje chen pos dgongs so //
translated: but sentient beings are attached to intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: de bas na de dag ni thugs rje'i dbang du gyur pa'i thugs kyis srid pa na yun ring du 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par bya ba'i ched du bzhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni thugs rje'i dbang du gyur pa'i thugs kyis srid pa na yun ring du 'gro ba mtha' dag la phan par bya ba'i ched du bzhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, they abide in existence for a long time with a mind that is governed by compassion, for the sake of benefiting all transmigrating beings.

original: gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag 'khor ba las kyang ma 'das la zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said that they do not transcend cyclic existence.

original: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ma bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su ma bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not abide in the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi ba ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor skyes kyang pad mo bzhin du de'i dri ma rnams kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i grangs su yang mi mchi ba ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor skyes kyang pad mo bzhin du de'i dri ma rnams kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not counted as being in cyclic existence, because even though they are born in the ocean of cyclic existence, they are not tainted by its faults, like a lotus.

original: de dag gis ni de dag nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas @150b pa nyid yin par sngar khas blangs pa bstan par byas so //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de dag nyid 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas @150b pa nyid yin par sngar khas blangs pa bstan par byas so //
translated: They demonstrate that they themselves do not abide in either cyclic existence or nirvana, as was previously asserted.

original: gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag lam dang bral ba yang ma lags shing zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa'i lam de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are not separated from the path means that they are the essence of the path of great compassion, which is the realization of the non-entityness of all phenomena.

original: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skyed pa ni de'i mtshan ma yin pa la mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi 'du shes kyang mi skyed pa ni de'i mtshan ma yin pa la mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not generate the notion of a path means that they do not engage in the signs of that.

original: de dag gis ni bstan ma thag pa'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i thabs gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bstan ma thag pa'i 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i thabs gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: By those, the method of not abiding in sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa, which was just taught, is clarified.

original: de dag gis bstan pa 'di'i don 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad dang mchog tu zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis bstan pa 'di'i don 'tshal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad dang mchog tu zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: They will understand the meaning of this teaching means up to in all aspects and as supreme.

original: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the intention of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: de skad du 'chad pa ni rang dga' yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: de skad du 'chad pa ni rang dga' yin no snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: The explanation like that is just one's own idea.

original: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: To that, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said, Excellent, excellent!

original: khyod kyi tshig de ni legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi tshig de ni legs par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Your words are well spoken.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig srid par 'khor yang srid pa'i skyon dang bral //
analyzed: gang zhig srid par 'khor yang srid pa'i skyon dang bral //
translated: Though revolving in existence, free from the faults of existence,

original: stong pa smra yang las dang 'bras bu gtong mi byed //
analyzed: stong pa smra yang las dang 'bras bu gtong mi byed //
translated: Though teaching emptiness, not abandoning action and effect,

original: shes pas 'dod pa bsregs kyang gang dag thugs rjes brlan //
analyzed: shes pas 'dod pa bsregs kyang gang dag thugs rjes brlan //
translated: Though burning up desire with knowledge, moistened by compassion,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsngags pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsngags pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: skyes bu dam pa mos pa'i snod du gyur pa ni de ltar yang dkon na ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod dam snyam bsams nas btsun pa 'ong srungs chen pos /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa mos pa'i snod du gyur pa ni de ltar yang dkon na ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yod dam snyam bsams nas btsun pa 'ong srungs chen pos /
translated: The venerable MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa, thinking that if even a holy being who is a suitable vessel for devotion is so rare, how much more so in the future, said:

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //
translated: Blessed One, in the future... and so on.

original: gang la la chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i skas 'og nas btsugs par gyur pa'i mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po chen po la bya'o //
analyzed: gang la la chos 'dul ba zab mo 'di dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i skas 'og nas btsugs par gyur pa'i mdo sde'i dbang po'i rgyal po chen po la bya'o //
translated: Whoever, in the future, will uphold this profound Dharma and Vinaya... refers to the great king of s≈´tras, the S≈´tra of the King of the Determined Mind, which is like a ladder from below to ascend to the profound Dharma and Vinaya.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo la bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo la bya'o //
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom refers to the nature of the object.

original: 'di la nyan pa ni tshig dang don bshad pa la gang gis gus pas rna ba gtod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la nyan pa ni tshig dang don bshad pa la gang gis gus pas rna ba gtod pa'o //
translated: Listening to it is the attentive ear of one who is devoted to the explanation of the words and their meaning.

original: mos pa ni gang zhig gis thos nas dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas kyang 'di ni de kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o //üîΩkun 'tshal ba ni gang zhig rigs pas de'i don gtan la phebs pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni gang zhig gis thos nas dad pa'i rjes su 'brang bas kyang 'di ni de kho na yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa'o // kun 'tshal ba ni gang zhig rigs pas de'i don gtan la phebs pa'o //
translated: Faith is the ascertainment by one who, having heard it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of faith.üîΩ Understanding is the ascertainment of its meaning by one who, having heard it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of wisdom.

original: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni gang zhig gis gtan la phab nas yang dag par sgrub pas bsgom @151a * //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni gang zhig gis gtan la phab nas yang dag par sgrub pas bsgom @151a * //
translated: Retention is the cultivation of it by one who, having ascertained it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of retention.

original: pa'o ; / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag gi go rims ni gsal lo //
analyzed: pa'o ; / nyan pa la sogs pa de dag gi go rims ni gsal lo //
translated: The order of listening and so on is clear.

original: yang na mos pa ni gang zhig gis thos nas dad pa dang shes rab gnyis kyi don de kho na yin no zhes rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mos pa ni gang zhig gis thos nas dad pa dang shes rab gnyis kyi don de kho na yin no zhes rtogs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, faith is the ascertainment by one who, having heard it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of faith and wisdom.üîΩ Understanding is the cultivation of it by one who, having heard it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of wisdom.

original: kun 'tshal ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin gang sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'tshal ba ni don ji lta ba bzhin gang sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Retention is the cultivation of it by one who, having ascertained it, thinks, This is the truth, through the practice of retention.

original: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni bla ma la gus shing chos 'dul ba 'di glegs bam du bzhugs pa yang klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / mchod cing shin tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba ni bla ma la gus shing chos 'dul ba 'di glegs bam du bzhugs pa yang klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / mchod cing shin tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase they will be well-established means that they will be respectful to the guru, and that they will read, hold, worship, and uphold this Dharma-Vinaya, even if it is only in the form of a book.

original: de dag ni 'khor 'di nyid na gnas so zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'khor 'di nyid na gnas so zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: The phrase they will be present in this very assembly is the remainder.

original: gang zhig chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di'i nang du thos pa de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyan par 'gyur ba dang / mos par 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bkas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zhig chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di'i nang du thos pa de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa'i dus na nyan par 'gyur ba dang / mos par 'gyur ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i bkas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase those who hear this Dharma discourse in this assembly will be the very ones who will listen to it and aspire to it in the future is because they will be blessed by the Buddha and the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas par ni 'di thos pa'i lam du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur ma byas par ni 'di thos pa'i lam du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase they will not go down the path of hearing this without serving the buddhas means that they will not go down the path of hearing this without serving the buddhas.

original: de dag gi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The phrase they will be the very ones is the remainder.üîΩThe phrase they will be the very ones is the remainder.

original: gang zhig 'di la thos te legs par shin tu yid la byed pa de dag ni gzhan gyi tshe na thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di la thos te legs par shin tu yid la byed pa de dag ni gzhan gyi tshe na thos par 'gyur /
translated: Those who hear this and properly and thoroughly attend to it will hear it in the future.

original: mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: mos par 'gyur /
translated: They will aspire to it.

original: kun shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun shes par 'gyur /
translated: They will understand it.

original: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will grasp it.

original: gang zhig thos nas legs par yid la byed pa de dag ni kun shes pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig thos nas legs par yid la byed pa de dag ni kun shes pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hear it and properly attend to it will understand it.

original: gang zhig thos pa nyi tsher zad pa de dag ni thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig thos pa nyi tsher zad pa de dag ni thos par 'gyur /
translated: Those who hear only a little will hear it.

original: mos par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also aspire to it.

original: gnyis pa'i bshad pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i bshad pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the second should be understood in the same way.

original: rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por 'gyur bas 'di ni ston pa po'i dgongs pa yin par mngon no //
analyzed: rgyu chung ngu las 'bras bu chen por 'gyur bas 'di ni ston pa po'i dgongs pa yin par mngon no //
translated: Since a great result arises from a small cause, this is clearly the intention of the teacher.

original: 'od srungs 'khor 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'khor 'di nyid ni zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: Ka≈õyapa, in this very assembly is a general statement.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma 'khod pa de dag ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma 'khod pa de dag ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who are seated here.

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos zab mo 'dul ba 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun shes pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba yod do zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos zab mo 'dul ba 'di dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la nyan pa dang / mos pa dang / kun shes pa dang / rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba yod do zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: There will be those in the future who will listen to this profound Dharma-Vinaya and this profound perfection of wisdom, who will believe in it, understand it, and take it up. This is the general teaching.

original: don de dag nyid dpe rnam pa bzhis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de dag nyid dpe rnam pa bzhis gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify those very topics with four examples,

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper @151b na khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste dper @151b na khyim bdag gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this: for example, a householder or a householder's son, and so on.

original: de la nor bu rin po che stor ba dang rnyed pa bstan pas ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yid bde ba dang mi bde ba rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nor bu rin po che stor ba dang rnyed pa bstan pas ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yid bde ba dang mi bde ba rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the teaching on losing and finding a precious jewel shows that this Dharma discourse is the basis for joy and sorrow to follow and cease.

original: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par 'gyur ba na dga' ba dang bde ba dang yid dga' bar 'gyur zhing kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te zhes gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de dag gis dus gzhan na thos par 'gyur ba na dga' ba dang bde ba dang yid dga' bar 'gyur zhing kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur te zhes gang gsungs pa la /
translated: When they hear them at another time, they will be happy, joyful, and delighted, and will not have the mental activity of the entanglements.

original: dga' ba ni yid dga' ba gang gis zin pa zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid dga' ba gang gis zin pa zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Joy is the mental joy that is associated with it.

original: sngar ni stor ba bzhin du sngar ma thos pa'i mya ngan gyis yid gdungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: sngar ni stor ba bzhin du sngar ma thos pa'i mya ngan gyis yid gdungs pa yin no ;
translated: Previously, they were tormented by the sorrow of not hearing what they had lost.

original: / bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba skyes pa ste /
analyzed: / bde ba dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba skyes pa ste /
translated: Happiness is the arising of happiness.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir re //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir re //
translated: Because they have physical pliancy.

original: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dga' bar 'gyur ba ni sems shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Joy is the delight of the mind because they have mental pliancy.

original: gang dag la kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ba de dag la de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: gang dag la kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa med par 'gyur ba de dag la de skad ces bstan to //
translated: Those who do not have the mental activity of the entanglements are taught in this way.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde bas gdungs pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde bas gdungs pa yin par bshad do //
translated: The mental activity of the entanglements is explained as being tormented by mental dissatisfaction.

original: der khyim bdag dang de'i bu smos pa ni rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa bdag dang de'i bu ni de stor tam slar rnyed pas yid mi bde ba yang med /
analyzed: der khyim bdag dang de'i bu smos pa ni rjes su mthun par bstan pa'i phyir ro // sa bdag dang de'i bu ni de stor tam slar rnyed pas yid mi bde ba yang med /
translated: The mention of the householder and his son is for the purpose of teaching in a way that is easy to understand.

original: yid bde ba yang med do //
analyzed: yid bde ba yang med do //
translated: The householder and his son are not unhappy when they lose it, nor are they happy when they find it again.

original: ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i ched du de bzhin nyid bshad de /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i don bstan pa'i ched du de bzhin nyid bshad de /
translated: The reality of non-arising, etc. is taught for the purpose of teaching the meaning of non-arising, etc.

original: don dam pa dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni rnam grangs te bar gyi sgras bsdu'o //
analyzed: don dam pa dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni rnam grangs te bar gyi sgras bsdu'o //
translated: The ultimate and reality are synonyms, as indicated by the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù.

original: shing yongs 'du sa brtol kha 'bus pa bstan pa ni de'i tshe dang dus gzhan na yid bde ba'i gnas yin par bstan te /
analyzed: shing yongs 'du sa brtol kha 'bus pa bstan pa ni de'i tshe dang dus gzhan na yid bde ba'i gnas yin par bstan te /
translated: The opening of the coral tree flowers is taught as a basis for mental happiness at that time and at other times.

original: de'i tshe dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / gang gi tshe me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / gang gi tshe me tog thams cad rgyas par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: At that time, there is joy, and when all the flowers bloom,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi me tog rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe flowers of all dharmas bloom.‚Äù

original: yid dga' ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid dga' ba zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Mental happiness is as explained before.

original: rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He becomes extremely joyful means that he becomes supremely joyful.

original: sa brtol ni sa las skyes pa'o //üîΩde nyid yongs 'du yin te /
analyzed: sa brtol ni sa las skyes pa'o // de nyid yongs 'du yin te /
translated: The PƒÅrijƒÅta tree is born from the earth.üîΩIt is also called the PƒÅrijƒÅta tree.

original: de'i ming gi rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: de'i ming gi rnam grangs yin te /
translated: It is a synonym for that tree.

original: kha 'bus pa zhes bya ba ni h'a khyim chags pa'o //
analyzed: kha 'bus pa zhes bya ba ni h'a khyim chags pa'o //
translated: The blooming means the opening of the flowers.

original: me tog thams cad rgyas pa ni thams cad du kha bye ba'o //üîΩnges @152a * //
analyzed: me tog thams cad rgyas pa ni thams cad du kha bye ba'o // nges @152a * //
translated: The full blooming means the full opening of all the flowers.

original: par zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: par zhes bya ba ni gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The definitely means the one-pointedly.

original: 'dir kha cig dogs pa 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu lus 'ga' med par mi rung ba ma yin nam snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig dogs pa 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu lus 'ga' med par mi rung ba ma yin nam snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Here, someone explains the doubt, thinking, Is it not unsuitable for a person to be without a body?

original: thos pa bzhin du skyes bu med par yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa bzhin du skyes bu med par yang yod pa yin te /
translated: Just as in the heard, a person exists without a body.

original: de'i dbang gis gzhan du de'i gzugs las sam gzugs brnyan las yin te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzhan du de'i gzugs las sam gzugs brnyan las yin te /
translated: By its power, elsewhere, from its form or from a reflection,

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang bde bar gshegs pa snang ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das par gyur kyang bde bar gshegs pa snang ba yin no //
translated: even though the Blessed One has passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa, the Sugata appears.

original: de'i tshe 'di thos par gyur pa gang gi dbang gis she na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di thos par gyur pa gang gi dbang gis she na /
translated: At that time, by whose power is this heard?

original: 'di ltar 'das pa na mngon sum du byas pa dag yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa na mngon sum du byas pa dag yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that they were directly perceived in the past.

original: de'i phyir 'od srungs 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od srungs 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: Therefore, KƒÅ≈õyapa, in this way, in the future time, this profound perfection of wisdom, which is unborn, unarisen, up to non-existent, will be the TathƒÅgata's passed on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa'i phyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus have I heard, etc.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa dang lhan cig brjod bar bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos por 'brel pas 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'brel pa dang lhan cig brjod bar bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i dngos por 'brel pas 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called connected because it is connected with the perfection of wisdom, and because it is connected with the things to be spoken and the speaker.

original: 'das pa'i phyin zhes bya ba ni mi bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan 'das pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i phyin zhes bya ba ni mi bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan 'das pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: The passed on means the non-abiding, the parinirvƒÅ·πáa, etc.

original: gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni glegs bam la yod pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni glegs bam la yod pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will endure‚Äù means that it will exist in books.

original: spyod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun du klog pa dang kha don byed pas so //
analyzed: spyod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun du klog pa dang kha don byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt will be practiced‚Äù means that it will be recited and chanted.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang zhes bya ba 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Buddha‚Äôs blessing‚Äù is the Buddha‚Äôs power, which is to be understood as the analysis of this very blessing.

original: yang na byin gyi rlabs ni slob ma dang yang slob la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu bar du chod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byin gyi rlabs ni slob ma dang yang slob la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu bar du chod pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Or else, blessing is the cause of the transmission from one to another, from disciple to disciple, etc.

original: mthu ni dngos su de'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: mthu ni dngos su de'i dbang gis so //
translated: Power is the direct influence of that.

original: nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong ba'i dpes ni rtag tu yid bde ba'i gnas nyid 'di yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nor bu mkhan zhig gis nor bu rin po che mthong ba'i dpes ni rtag tu yid bde ba'i gnas nyid 'di yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The example of the jeweler who sees a precious gem shows that this is the source of constant joy.

original: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'od srungs de bzhin du gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba nas dngos po med pa'i bar 'di thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus have I heard and so on is stated in order to show that the perfection of wisdom is the cause of the attainment of the knowledge of all modes.üîΩThe great vehicle is so called because it is the vehicle for the great, i.e. for Bodhisattvas.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa ni gang dag la dga' pa yod pa de rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o //üîΩmgu ba ni yid dga' ba la @152b bya'o ;üîΩ/ gang dag la rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pa ni gang dag la dga' pa yod pa de rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'o // mgu ba ni yid dga' ba la @152b bya'o ; / gang dag la rangs pa dang / yid bde ba skyes pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The great beings are the Bodhisattvas, because they are great by virtue of their thought of enlightenment.

original: yid dga' ba'i don ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩyang na snying dga' ba la bya ste /
analyzed: yid dga' ba'i don ni snga ma bzhin no // yang na snying dga' ba la bya ste /
translated: The great thought is the thought of enlightenment, because it is the cause of the great result.üîΩThe great result is the knowledge of all modes, because it is the result of the great cause.üîΩThe great cause is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the cause of the great result.

original: sngon gyi rjes su yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi rjes su yang nas yang du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The great perfection is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the perfection of the great result.üîΩThe great perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom of the great vehicle, because it is the perfection of the great vehicle.üîΩThe great vehicle is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the vehicle for the great beings.üîΩThe great beings are the perfection of wisdom, because they are the great beings.üîΩThe great perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom of the great beings, because it is the perfection of the great beings.

original: nor bu rin po che 'di ni rigs las brjod par bzhed de bstan to ;
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'di ni rigs las brjod par bzhed de bstan to ;
translated: The great perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom of the great beings, because it is the perfection of the great beings.

original: / sngon nyams su myong ba'i grong khyer thos pa'i dpes ni bde ba dang yid bde ba sna tshogs kyi gnas nyid yin par de dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste grong khyer de'i bsngags pa brjod cing kun dga' ra ba nyams
analyzed: / sngon nyams su myong ba'i grong khyer thos pa'i dpes ni bde ba dang yid bde ba sna tshogs kyi gnas nyid yin par de dus gzhan zhig na de'i drung du mi la la zhig song ste grong khyer de'i bsngags pa brjod cing kun dga' ra ba nyams
translated: At another time, someone came to him and praised that city, saying, ‚ÄúThe park is delightful, the ponds are delightful, the lotus flowers are delightful, the trees are delightful, the birds are delightful, the houses are delightful, the streets are delightful, the shops are delightful, the people are delightful, the king is delightful, the king‚Äôs ministers are delightful, the king‚Äôs subjects are delightful, the king‚Äôs retinue is delightful, the king‚Äôs capital city is delightful, the king‚Äôs country is delightful, the king‚Äôs palace is delightful, the king‚Äôs throne is delightful, and the king‚Äôs wealth is delightful.‚Äù

original: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dga' ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: He said, ‚ÄúDelightful!‚Äù and so on.

original: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la'i phyir sngon son par gyur la phyis brjod par gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: grong gang yang rung ba zhig tu dgos pa la la'i phyir sngon son par gyur la phyis brjod par gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that he had previously gone to some city for some purpose and later remembered it.

original: nyams dga' ba'i dngos po la nyams dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyams dga' ba'i dngos po la nyams dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: A delightful thing is called ‚Äúdelightful.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba rgol ba po'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba rgol ba po'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Why is that? The opponent‚Äôs thought is this:

original: yang nas yang du bsngags pa brjod par gsol ba 'debs pa tsam mthong ba las nyams su myong ba yod par rjes su dpog pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang nas yang du bsngags pa brjod par gsol ba 'debs pa tsam mthong ba las nyams su myong ba yod par rjes su dpog pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to infer that there is experience from merely seeing someone repeatedly request praise.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because that is mistaken.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag gnas gtsang ma'i gnas nyams dga' ba dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa thos pas snying ya ya po chen pos g-yengs par gyur nas yang dang yang du gsol ba 'debs par byed kyang des tshe snga ma la yang de
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dag gnas gtsang ma'i gnas nyams dga' ba dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa thos pas snying ya ya po chen pos g-yengs par gyur nas yang dang yang du gsol ba 'debs par byed kyang des tshe snga ma la yang de
