translated: Thus, those who are not free from attachment hear the praises of the delightful abodes of the pristine abodes and their minds are disturbed by great longing.

original: mthong bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though they repeatedly supplicate, they do not see those abodes in the present life,

original: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba kho na dag der skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba kho na dag der skyes pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because only nonreturners are born there.

original: 'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te /üîΩdga' ba'i bye brag de nyid kyis de lta bu dran pa'i 'du byed skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de thos nas yid cher dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bar gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan yin te / dga' ba'i bye brag de nyid kyis de lta bu dran pa'i 'du byed skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The response to this is, ‚ÄúThus, having heard this, they are extremely delighted and overjoyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe specific type of joy generates the formation of recollection.

original: dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang gang zhig rtags kyi bye brag brjod pa'i ngo bo la gsol ba 'debs pa 'byung bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang gang zhig rtags kyi bye brag brjod pa'i ngo bo la gsol ba 'debs pa 'byung bar byed do //
translated: Recollection associated with that joy generates supplication, which is the nature of the expression of a specific sign.

original: de las ni kun nas slong bar byed pa'i bye brag rjes su dpog pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de las ni kun nas slong bar byed pa'i bye brag rjes su dpog pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the specific instigation is inferred from that.

original: mtshan ma las rjes su dpog pa'i tshul bzhin du grong khyer la sogs pa mthong bar gyur pa rjes su dpog go zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan ma las rjes su dpog pa'i tshul bzhin du grong khyer la sogs pa mthong bar gyur pa rjes su dpog go zhes bya ba 'di ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that just as one infers from a sign, so one infers from seeing a city, etc.

original: yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni lan du mar ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang drung du 'gro zhing zhes bya ba ni lan du mar ro //
translated: Approaching again and again means many times.

original: rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur te zhes bya ba @153a * //
analyzed: rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur te zhes bya ba @153a * //
translated: Rejoicing and being gladdened means

original: ni rgya chen por ro //
analyzed: ni rgya chen por ro //
translated: being greatly delighted.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni dga' ba dang mgu ba cher skyed cing zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni dga' ba dang mgu ba cher skyed cing zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is analyzed as greatly increasing joy and gladness.

original: yang na rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur pa ni dang por ro //
analyzed: yang na rab tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur pa ni dang por ro //
translated: Alternatively, rejoicing and being gladdened is at the beginning,

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher skyed pa ni rgyun ma 'chad par ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba cher skyed pa ni rgyun ma 'chad par ro //
translated: and greatly increasing joy and gladness is uninterrupted.

original: dga' ba nyid mgu ba yin par 'grel to //
analyzed: dga' ba nyid mgu ba yin par 'grel to //
translated: It is explained that joy itself is gladness.

original: yang na dga' ba yang de yin la mgu ba yang de yin zhes gcig tu sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na dga' ba yang de yin la mgu ba yang de yin zhes gcig tu sbyar ro //
translated: Alternatively, it is applied as one: it is joy and it is gladness.

original: de la dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: Joy is mental satisfaction.

original: de sngon du song ba'i rab tu dga' ba dang khong mgu ba ni mgu ba'o //
analyzed: de sngon du song ba'i rab tu dga' ba dang khong mgu ba ni mgu ba'o //
translated: Delight is the joy and gladness that precede that.

original: gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to ascertain that,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma mchis pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúAt a time when the Bhagavatƒ´ was not present‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: de dag gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gyis dri ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa dang rtags dang mtshan ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag bka' stsal pa de dag nyid lags sam zhes bya ba ni tshig zur gyis dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAre the aspects, signs, and indications of those that the Bhagavat has taught the same?‚Äù is a question with an indirect meaning.

original: yang na ci lags zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: yang na ci lags zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Or, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù is drawn out from within.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: 'dir dpe bzhin du sngon myong ba'i rnam pa sgrogs pa ni cha tsam yang mi dmigs na de dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dpe bzhin du sngon myong ba'i rnam pa sgrogs pa ni cha tsam yang mi dmigs na de dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs pa de ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: Here, like an example, since even a part of the proclamation of previously experienced aspects is not observed, how can those know the service and so forth of youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said,üîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is so.

original: 'od srungs ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'od srungs ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha said to Kasyapa, It is just as you have said.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: dngos po'i chos de nyid rjes su myong ba gsal bar gyur pa gang yin pa des dran pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos de nyid rjes su myong ba gsal bar gyur pa gang yin pa des dran pa'i sa bon 'jog par byed kyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The seed of memory is planted by the experience of the reality of things, which is clear, and not by anything else.üîΩThat experience is clear because of the proximity of the great, greater, etc., habit of those things, and because of the absence of adverse conditions.

original: rjes su myong ba de yang de dag la goms pa che ba dang / ches che ba la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa dang bral ba'i phyir gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / bar skabs su mi mthun pa'i rkyen gyis nyams smad pa dang / de bas na 'phral du dran pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su myong ba de yang de dag la goms pa che ba dang / ches che ba la sogs pa nye bar gyur pa dang bral ba'i phyir gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / bar skabs su mi mthun pa'i rkyen gyis nyams smad pa dang / de bas na 'phral du dran pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: But memory does not arise immediately, because the adverse conditions are not eliminated, and because the habit is not yet great.

original: tsha ba dang kha ba'i ro rjes su myong ba mi dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tsha ba dang kha ba'i ro rjes su myong ba mi dran pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the memory of the experience of hot and sour tastes.

original: 'di tsam gyis de med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis de med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that memory does not exist because of this alone.

original: de'i stobs nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa rjes su 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa rjes su 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It is just by the power of that experience that the desired, etc., are remembered, as has been said.

original: gzhon nu'i gnas skabs na myong ba'i tsha ba dang kha ba la sogs pa srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i gnas skabs na myong ba'i tsha ba dang kha ba la sogs pa srid pa bzhin no //
translated: just as one experiences heat and cold, etc. in the youthful stage of existence.

original: rjes su myong ba dang mngon par 'dod pa tsam gnyis 'brel ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las dad pa mi g-yo ba'i stobs kyis de rig par @153b bya'o ;
analyzed: rjes su myong ba dang mngon par 'dod pa tsam gnyis 'brel ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' las dad pa mi g-yo ba'i stobs kyis de rig par @153b bya'o ;
translated: The connection between the two, mere experience and mere desire, is to be understood from the scriptures of the Lord, by the power of unshakable faith.

original: / de la rnam pa ni lus dga' ba'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: / de la rnam pa ni lus dga' ba'i bye brag ste /
translated: Therein, the aspect is a particular of bodily pleasure,

original: ba sbu ldang ba dang / mchi ma zag pa la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: ba sbu ldang ba dang / mchi ma zag pa la sogs pa'o /
translated: such as the rising of the hairs, the falling of tears, etc.

original: rtags ni tshig gi bye brag ste dga' ste gsol ba 'debs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni tshig gi bye brag ste dga' ste gsol ba 'debs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sign is a particular of speech, such as the request for instruction, etc.

original: mtshan ma ni sgrub pa'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni sgrub pa'i bye brag ste /
translated: The mark is a particular of practice,

original: nyan pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / mchod pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: such as listening, holding, reading, worshipping, etc., as previously explained.

original: de ltar rnam pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / kha cig dngos por mngon par zhen cing sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'i 'dam du bying ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa dang / kha cig dngos por mngon par zhen cing sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'i 'dam du bying ngo //
translated: Thus, some, who are attached to entities and who are sunk in the mire of the extreme of superimposition, with regard to the Lord's statements about the aspects, etc.,

original: de bas na mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove manifest clinging,

original: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos de ni rnam pa ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúThat dharma is without aspects, etc.‚Äù

original: chos ni chos kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: chos ni chos kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: Dharma is a synonym for dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the meaning essence.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par ma dag pa'i blas gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma 'di dag thams cad ni rnam par ma dag pa'i blas gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: All of these aspects, signs, and marks are the manifest nature of duality by an impure mind.

original: gnyis kyang bden pa ma yin par rtag tu lan grangs du mar gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis kyang bden pa ma yin par rtag tu lan grangs du mar gsungs so //
translated: Duality is not real, as has been stated many times.

original: de gnyis rnam pa la sogs pa dang / bral ba ma yin na rnam pa la sogs pa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes ji skad du bstan /
analyzed: de gnyis rnam pa la sogs pa dang / bral ba ma yin na rnam pa la sogs pa gnyis dang ldan pa zhes ji skad du bstan /
translated: If those two are not free from aspects, etc., how can it be taught that they are endowed with the two, aspects, etc.?

original: 'on kyang des thos pa dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams de la brtson par mthong ba las sngon thos pa yod par rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang des thos pa dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams de la brtson par mthong ba las sngon thos pa yod par rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: However, those disciples who are endowed with learning infer that the Buddha had learning from seeing that he was diligent in that.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.

original: tshul gang gis de gnyis la rnam pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa de ni de nyan pa po la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gang gis de gnyis la rnam pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa de ni de nyan pa po la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas rnam pa la sogs pa dang bral ba grub pa de gnyis kho na smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas rnam pa la sogs pa dang bral ba grub pa de gnyis kho na smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.

original: de ni nyan pa po rnams la yang de dag mtshungs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin na rigs kyi bu pho 'am /
analyzed: de ni nyan pa po rnams la yang de dag mtshungs pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin na rigs kyi bu pho 'am /
translated: Because the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag la rnam pa ma mchis pa dang / mtshan ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: Therefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes go rims bzhin du brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes go rims bzhin du brjod par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.üîΩBecause the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the listener.üîΩTherefore, the two are mentioned because they are established as free of aspects and so on in dependence on the specific features of disciples.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa gang lags pa de yang rnam pa ma mchis /
translated: Because the same method of reasoning that shows that those two are unreasonable also applies to the

original: rtags ma mchis /
analyzed: rtags ma mchis /
translated: There are no signs.

original: mtshan ma mchis pa'i slad du lags na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi snod yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma mchis pa'i slad du lags na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi snod yin no //
translated: Because there are no signs, it is a vessel for the teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa @154a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa @154a * //
translated: Blessed One,üîΩhow can a teaching that is taught without aspects

original: ma mchis pa bstan pa'i chos de ji ltar bstan par 'gyur /üîΩre zhig bstan pa yang yod pa ma yin na 'das pa'am /
analyzed: ma mchis pa bstan pa'i chos de ji ltar bstan par 'gyur / re zhig bstan pa yang yod pa ma yin na 'das pa'am /
translated: be taught?üîΩIf there is no teaching at all, how could there be any listeners

original: da lta'i tshe na nyan pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: da lta'i tshe na nyan pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the past or present?

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' bsal nas /
translated: Having thus cleared away the extreme of superimposition,üîΩin order to avoid the consequence of falling into the extreme of denial,

original: 'dir skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bya bar dgongs nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'dir skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung bar thal bar mi 'gyur bar bya bar dgongs nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: with reference to conventional truth, it is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, when the profound perfection of wisdom is taught,

original: 'jam dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo shin tu ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa'i bar du bstan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to the point of being utterly unborn and being a non-entity, and so on.‚Äù

original: de ni de dag nyid gus par nyan pa dang / legs par shin tu yid la skyed pa la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dag nyid gus par nyan pa dang / legs par shin tu yid la skyed pa la spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to generate enthusiasm for them to listen respectfully and to generate them well in their minds.

original: 'jam dpal phyogs gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs bcu dang // byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa thams cad bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal phyogs gang du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa der sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs bcu dang // byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa thams cad bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, wherever the perfection of wisdom is taught, there the ten powers of the Buddha and all the factors of awakening are taught.

original: dus de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa bdag nyid chen po'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par ma byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus de'i tshe byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa bdag nyid chen po'i rang gi ngo bo bstan par ma byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: At that time, were the nature of the great beings, such as the factors of awakening, not taught?

original: de ci'i phyir der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir der sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it said there that all the qualities of the Buddha are taught?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar der bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar der bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan par blta'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúthere the inconceivable is taught.‚Äù

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The inconceivable is emptiness.

original: don ni 'di ste rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid bsgoms pas de 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don ni 'di ste rnam pa thams cad stong pa nyid bsgoms pas de 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is this: one attains that by cultivating emptiness in all aspects.

original: de yang 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that is taught here by the removal of all conceptualization.

original: de bas na de thob pa'i thabs bstan pas de yang yongs su bstan pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de thob pa'i thabs bstan pas de yang yongs su bstan pa yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that that is also taught by the teaching of the means of attaining it.

original: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu gtso bo ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyu gtso bo ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar ba yin par bstan to //
translated: By these, it is taught that the principal cause of buddhahood is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag bsgrubs pa de'i rgyu can sangs rgyas 'di nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag bsgrubs pa de'i rgyu can sangs rgyas 'di nyid yin na /
translated: If one thinks: ‚ÄúThe Blessed One, when he was practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, accomplished roots of virtue, and because of that he is a buddha.

original: de ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i rgyu can du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i rgyu can du bstan zhe na /
translated: How is it taught that he is a cause of the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal ngas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, when I was previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba kho na yin no @154b zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba kho na yin no @154b zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the summarized meaning.

original: de la nyin re bzhin gzhan dag 'chad pa la yid dam du mnyan par bya /
analyzed: de la nyin re bzhin gzhan dag 'chad pa la yid dam du mnyan par bya /
translated: In that regard, one should listen with a one-pointed mind to the explanations of others every day.

original: mnyan nas de kho na yin no zhes mos par bya /
analyzed: mnyan nas de kho na yin no zhes mos par bya /
translated: Having listened, one should have conviction, thinking That is it!

original: dad pas glegs pa ma yi ger bri bar bya /
analyzed: dad pas glegs pa ma yi ger bri bar bya /
translated: With faith, one should write it in letters.

original: kha ton bton pas gzung bar bya /
analyzed: kha ton bton pas gzung bar bya /
translated: One should memorize it by reciting it.

original: glegs bam la gnas pa tshig tu brjod pas bklag par bya /
analyzed: glegs bam la gnas pa tshig tu brjod pas bklag par bya /
translated: One should read it by reciting the words that are in the book.

original: gzhan las man ngag mnos pas lung ma nod par bya /
analyzed: gzhan las man ngag mnos pas lung ma nod par bya /
translated: One should receive the oral transmission by receiving instructions from others.

original: kha ton lobs pa rnams yang nas yang du 'don pas kha ton tu bya /
analyzed: kha ton lobs pa rnams yang nas yang du 'don pas kha ton tu bya /
translated: One should recite it by repeatedly reciting what has been memorized.

original: tshig tu gdon par bya ba ni grags pas sgrogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig tu gdon par bya ba ni grags pas sgrogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Reciting the words means proclaiming it with fame.

original: kun chub par bya ba ni tshig dang don bye brag tu 'chad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: kun chub par bya ba ni tshig dang don bye brag tu 'chad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: One should fully understand it by explaining the words and meanings in detail.

original: / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba ni rigs pas bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis de'i don dpyod par byed pa'o //üîΩbsgom par bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal nas /
analyzed: / tshul bzhin du yid la bya ba ni rigs pas bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis de'i don dpyod par byed pa'o // bsgom par bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal nas /
translated: Appropriate mental attention is the investigation of the meaning of the Dharma by the wisdom that arises from rational consideration.

original: de'i don khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cultivation is the comprehension of the meaning of the Dharma by the wisdom that arises from meditative realization, after all conceptual differentiation has been eliminated.

original: nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rin po che'i gzhal med khang nor bu rin po che'i rgyu las byas pa'i khang bzangs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: nas zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rin po che'i gzhal med khang nor bu rin po che'i rgyu las byas pa'i khang bzangs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúthen‚Äù indicates that the precious palace is made of the precious gem.

original: ba dan dang rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan ni rgyal mtshan gyi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: ba dan dang rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan ni rgyal mtshan gyi bye brag yin no //
translated: The banners and victory banners are varieties of banners.

original: ci nus zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni ci phod du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci nus zhes bya ba 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni ci phod du'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTo the best of one‚Äôs ability‚Äù is the analysis of ‚Äúas much as one can.‚Äù

original: yang na ci nus zhes bya ba ni mthu ci yod pas mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ci nus zhes bya ba ni mthu ci yod pas mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúto the best of one‚Äôs ability‚Äù means to apply oneself to listening, etc. to the utmost of one‚Äôs power.

original: ci phod du byas pa ni me tog la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci phod du byas pa ni me tog la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs much as one can‚Äù means to worship with flowers, etc. to the utmost of one‚Äôs ability.

original: rim gror bya'o zhes tshig 'og mas rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: rim gror bya'o zhes tshig 'og mas rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: The second line should be honored distinguishes [the two].

original: yang na rim gro bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba dang / bskor ba dang / bya ba byed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yang na rim gro bya ba ni thal mo sbyar ba dang / bskor ba dang / bya ba byed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Or, honoring is by way of the palms joined, circumambulation, and doing what is to be done, etc.

original: de dag thams cad kyis ni chos spyod rnam pa bcu bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis ni chos spyod rnam pa bcu bstan to //
translated: All of these [above] indicate the ten Dharma activities.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das pas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thams cad las 'das pas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it that Buddhahood is attained by transcending all of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers?

original: de ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bas zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor bas zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it explained that [Buddhahood] is attained by applying oneself to the perfection of wisdom?

original: de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis las 'da' bar 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ...wishing to transcend all of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers...

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa yang 'di nyid la brten nas 'da' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa yang 'di nyid la brten nas 'da' ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the grounds of the Hearers and so forth are also transcended by relying on this [perfection of wisdom].

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa las 'das te sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir @155a * //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa las 'das te sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir @155a * //
translated: But isn't it the case that one passes beyond the stage of non-returning and attains buddhahood? For this reason,

original: 'jam dpal ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la 'jug par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, how does one enter the stage of non-returning?

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: The stage of non-returning is the immovable.

original: de la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni der 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni der 'gro ba'o //
translated: To enter that is to go there.

original: der ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: der ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: How does one go there? In that way indicates a desire to listen.

original: bsam par 'dod pa dang / bsgom par 'dod pa dag kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam par 'dod pa dang / bsgom par 'dod pa dag kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand a desire to contemplate and a desire to meditate in the same way.

original: 'di snyam du chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pas mos bas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos thams cad skye ba med par mnyam pas mos bas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i phyir /
translated: Thinking, I will attain buddhahood through conviction in the equality of the non-arising of all phenomena,

original: 'jam dpal chos gang yang rung ste de dag thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal chos gang yang rung ste de dag thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, whatever phenomena there are, they are all equal in being non-arisen.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa 'di la rnam par rtog pa thams cad sel bas mnyam pa de lta bu ni gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes par mnyam pa 'di la rnam par rtog pa thams cad sel bas mnyam pa de lta bu ni gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since all phenomena are the same in being unborn, this is the same in that it eliminates all conceptual thoughts. There is nothing else that is the same.

original: gzhan dag rnam par rtog pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa de nyid sangs rgyas nyid thob pa 'di'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag rnam par rtog pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod pa de nyid sangs rgyas nyid thob pa 'di'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhe na /
translated: Others think that the cause of attaining buddhahood is the conceptual thought that all the qualities of a buddha are fully enlightened.

original: de'i phyir 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, all the qualities of a buddha...

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs par 'dod pa yang 'di nyid la sbyor bas shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rtogs par 'dod pa yang 'di nyid la sbyor bas shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and so on is said. The thought is that even the desire to realize all the qualities of a buddha is applied to this and so becomes completely pure.

original: gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos cung zad ma mkhyen na zhes de lta bu'i zab mo bstan pa 'di la mos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi gtso bo yin no snyam pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos cung zad ma mkhyen na zhes de lta bu'i zab mo bstan pa 'di la mos pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi gtso bo yin no snyam pa de la /
translated: Others think that the main reason for having confidence in this teaching of the profound is that the BhagavƒÅn does not know even the slightest phenomenon.

original: 'jam dpal chos thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal chos thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the TathƒÅgata has not fully awakened to all dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rigs pa yin na ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas zhes bsams pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rigs pa yin na ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas zhes bsams pa la /
translated: Why is that? If everything is reasonable, how is it that he has not fully awakened?

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, Whatever is fully awakened to... and so on.

original: don bshad zin to ;
analyzed: don bshad zin to ;
translated: The meaning has been explained.

original: / de bas na de ltar don gyi tshul 'di la mos par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na de ltar don gyi tshul 'di la mos par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who wish to aspire to this way of the meaning... and so on concludes what was just taught.

original: don gyi tshul ni don gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshul ni don gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The way of the meaning is the aspect of the meaning.

original: 'di nyid la sbyor bas 'di 'dra ba'i mos pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di nyid la sbyor bas 'di 'dra ba'i mos pa 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By applying to this very [way of the meaning], this kind of aspiration will arise - this is the meaning.

original: gzhan ngag ni byang chub dang chos @155b thams cad gnyis su med cing mnyam par de ltar mos pa'i mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan yin no snyam pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan ngag ni byang chub dang chos @155b thams cad gnyis su med cing mnyam par de ltar mos pa'i mngon sum gyi rgyu mtshan yin no snyam pa de la /
translated: The other's speech is the reason for the direct perception of the conviction that enlightenment and all dharmas are nondual and equal.

original: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang byang chub ma yin pa'i chos de gang yang med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, There is not any dharma at all that is not enlightenment, and so forth.

original: gzhan dag na re chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa nyid byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhe na ;
translated: If someone says, The nonconceptuality of all dharmas is the principal cause of enlightenment,

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, The one who wishes for the nonconceptuality of all dharmas... and so forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa ston par byed pa gang yin ba mtha' dag pa yod bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mnyan par bya bar gsungs pa 'di
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa ston par byed pa gang yin ba mtha' dag pa yod bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mnyan par bya bar gsungs pa 'di
translated: Why is that? means, While there are other s≈´tras that teach the nonconceptuality of all dharmas, why is it said that this perfection of wisdom alone should be listened to?

original: las lhag pa cig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las lhag pa cig yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means, Is there something superior to this?

original: lan du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa 'am rnam par mi rtog pa go rims bzhin du chos gang yang yongs su grub par rnam par 'jog cing skyed ba'am /
analyzed: lan du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par rtog pa 'am rnam par mi rtog pa go rims bzhin du chos gang yang yongs su grub par rnam par 'jog cing skyed ba'am /
translated: The answer is: because the perfection of wisdom does not posit or produce any dharma as real, either as discursive thought or as nondiscursive thought,

original: ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: or as something to be shown.

original: rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: It is not a cause for the production of discursive thought,

original: de'i yul yin pa'i khungs med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i yul yin pa'i khungs med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is not a basis for its object. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad ston de mdo sde gzhan las gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas dmigs par ston pa yod pa yang yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ston de mdo sde gzhan las gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas dmigs par ston pa yod pa yang yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is thought that this is taught in other s≈´tras, in dependence on the distinctions of disciples, and that there is an object.

original: 'dir ni ji ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni ji ltar yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But here it is said that it is not in any way existent.

original: kha cig ni chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni chos thams cad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: Some say: All dharmas are not afflicted,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are naturally luminous.

original: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not purified,üîΩbecause they are naturally luminous.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar 'jug par 'dod pa dang myur du byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa de la chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes de ltar 'jug par 'dod pa dang myur du byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'dod pa de la chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, for one who wishes to engage in this way and who wishes to quickly realize enlightenment, it is said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not afflicted,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni dus gsum du sgro 'dogs pa ring du spangs pas myur du byang chub pa yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dus gsum du sgro 'dogs pa ring du spangs pas myur du byang chub pa yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Others think that one is quickly enlightened by completely abandoning superimposition regarding the three times.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad 'das pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are not past,‚Äù

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: ‚Äúnot future,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yang 'di la brten pa kho nas sgro 'dogs pa myur du zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di la brten pa kho nas sgro 'dogs pa myur du zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This also means that superimposition is quickly exhausted by relying on this alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs par bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs par bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the nature of hearing and so on taught to be past, future, and so on?

original: ci'i phyir chos dus gsum du 'jug pa ma yin zhes @156a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos dus gsum du 'jug pa ma yin zhes @156a * //
translated: Why are phenomena not engaged in the three times?

original: rgol ba pos bsam pa la /
analyzed: rgol ba pos bsam pa la /
translated: The opponent thinks:

original: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa ni 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal skye ba med pa ni 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, non-arising is not past, and so on.

original: skye ba med pa ni dngos po med pa yin la /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni dngos po med pa yin la /
translated: Non-arising is non-existent.

original: dngos bo med pa la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba yang dag par lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos bo med pa la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar byung ba yang dag par lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: How can there be a real past, future, or present of the non-existent? This is the summary.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir de skad du ston /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir de skad du ston /
translated: Why is that? means why is it taught like that?

original: skye ba med pa la 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba med /
analyzed: skye ba med pa la 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba med /
translated: Non-arising has no division into past and so on.

original: chos rnams la go 'di ci ste dbye ba med ces bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams la go 'di ci ste dbye ba med ces bya ba ni rgol ba po'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Why are phenomena undifferentiated? This is the opponent's thought.

original: de la 'jam dpal chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa la ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de la 'jam dpal chos thams cad ni skye ba med pa la ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To that, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, it is said: because all phenomena are taught as non-arisen.

original: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: Up to: because they have the nature of non-arising.

original: 'dir ni kun brtags pa'i chos la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni kun brtags pa'i chos la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here, however, it is the imagined dharma that is intended.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúwithout doubt with regard to all dharmas of that kind‚Äù and so on is the conclusion of the immediately preceding topic.

original: gzhan dag smra ba skye ba'i dngos po rnams rtag pa ma yin par 'dod du zin kyang don dam par ni mi rung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag smra ba skye ba'i dngos po rnams rtag pa ma yin par 'dod du zin kyang don dam par ni mi rung ba kho na yin te /
translated: Although others assert that the things that arise are not permanent, still, ultimately, it is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi cha shas can la sogs pa'i skye ba ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa kho na min pas yod par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi cha shas can la sogs pa'i skye ba ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyis ma skyes pa kho na min pas yod par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, first, the arising of external wholes and so on is not nonarisen, as has been demonstrated above, so it is not tenable that they exist.

original: nyams su myong ba tsam lhag ma lus pa de yang yod pa don dam pa yin par ni bsgrub par dka' ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tsam lhag ma lus pa de yang yod pa don dam pa yin par ni bsgrub par dka' ba kho na yin te /
translated: The remainder of the experience that remains is also difficult to establish as ultimately existent.

original: 'di ltar ri mo bkram pa la sogs pa la shes pa skye ba ni snang ba rnam pa du mar skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ri mo bkram pa la sogs pa la shes pa skye ba ni snang ba rnam pa du mar skyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when consciousness arises with regard to a displayed painting and so on, it arises as many aspects.

original: rnam pa de dag kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin na ni nyams su myong bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag kyang de'i bdag nyid kho na yin gyi gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin na ni nyams su myong bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if those aspects were not of the same nature as that consciousness, it would be illogical to experience them.

original: de bas na de rnam pa du ma las rnam par na log pa yin na gcig pa nyid yin par ji ltar rigs pa yin /
analyzed: de bas na de rnam pa du ma las rnam par na log pa yin na gcig pa nyid yin par ji ltar rigs pa yin /
translated: Therefore, if that consciousness is distinguished from many aspects, how could it be logical that it is one?

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun rnam par bcad de gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas lhan cig tu gnas bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid dag ni phan tshun rnam par bcad de gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas lhan cig tu gnas bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because being one and being many are characteristics that exclude each other, it is impossible for them to coexist.

original: 'on te yang 'di snyam du nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa de rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'di snyam du nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa de rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that those experienced aspects are not real,

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis de ltar sna tshogs su gnyis su med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis de ltar sna tshogs su gnyis su med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la snang ngo zhe na /
translated: that they appear in the nature of a nondual consciousness in that way due to delusion,

original: 'o na snang zhes bya ba 'di ci yin te /
analyzed: 'o na snang zhes bya ba 'di ci yin te /
translated: then what is this so-called appearance?

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma gtogs par gzhan snang ba'i sgra'i don rtogs par byar med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma gtogs par gzhan snang ba'i sgra'i don rtogs par byar med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the meaning of the word ‚Äúappearance‚Äù is not to be understood as anything other than the nature of experience?

original: 'di ltar snang ba zhes bya ba de ni @156b nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba zhes bya ba de ni @156b nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: In this way, what is called ‚Äúappearance‚Äù is the meaning of what is called ‚Äúexperience.‚Äù

original: mig ser la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams yod pa ma yin yang ser po la sogs par ji ltar snang zhe na /üîΩde la yang gal te phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mig ser la sogs pas mig nyams pa rnams yod pa ma yin yang ser po la sogs par ji ltar snang zhe na / de la yang gal te phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If the eyes are impaired by jaundice, etc., how can yellow, etc., appear when they do not exist?

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du yang yod pa ma yin na de dag ji ltar snang zhes de la yang mthun par rgal ba 'di ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du yang yod pa ma yin na de dag ji ltar snang zhes de la yang mthun par rgal ba 'di ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, if they do not exist as external realities and they do not exist as the nature of consciousness, how can they appear? Is this not a similar objection?

original: gal te ka ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig gi shes pa de gcig yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ka ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig gi shes pa de gcig yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If the consciousness of a single aspect such as a pillar, etc., is one, it is not so,

original: de la yang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha la sogs pa dbye bas sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang tshu rol dang pha rol dang dbus kyi cha la sogs pa dbye bas sna tshogs su snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as a variety by the division of parts such as near, far, middle, etc.

original: de bas na blo yang gcig tu 'thad pa ma yin pas dngos po thams cad ma brtags na dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi tshul la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na blo yang gcig tu 'thad pa ma yin pas dngos po thams cad ma brtags na dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi tshul la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since a single cognition is not tenable, all things are by nature delightful if not analyzed. They are engaged in the conventional way.

original: 'di ltar ji lta ji ltar yongs su brtags pa de lta de ltar brtag mi bzod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji lta ji ltar yongs su brtags pa de lta de ltar brtag mi bzod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the more they are analyzed, the less they can withstand analysis.

original: 'di kha cig smra ba sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di kha cig smra ba sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Blue, yellow, and so on are not utterly nonexistent.

original: nyams bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du gsal bar nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are clearly experienced, like pleasure and so on.

original: 'o na kyang shes pa gcig la 'dzin pa'i char 'dod pa dang / cha gnyis pa phyir rgol gyi ngo bor gyur pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na kyang shes pa gcig la 'dzin pa'i char 'dod pa dang / cha gnyis pa phyir rgol gyi ngo bor gyur pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: However, the object of a single cognition is not asserted to be a part that is the object of apprehension and a part that is the object of the opponent because that does not exist.

original: ji ltar nang du bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar nang du bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: Just as inner pleasure and so on are the object of reflexive awareness,

original: gzhan gzung bar char gyur par yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gzung bar char gyur par yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: they do not exist as parts that are the object of apprehension and the object of the opponent.

original: de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par brtags pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po la sogs pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par brtags pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, white, etc. are free from the discrimination of subject and object.

original: de skad du slob dpon dharma k'irtis kyang /
analyzed: de skad du slob dpon dharma k'irtis kyang /
translated: Thus, the master Dharmottara says:

original: sngo la sogs pa'i ngo bo de'i //üîΩngo bo nyid ni nyams myong yin//
analyzed: sngo la sogs pa'i ngo bo de'i // ngo bo nyid ni nyams myong yin//
translated: The nature of blue, etc.üîΩis the experience of its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams myong yang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams myong yang //
translated: The experience of its own nature

original: sngo la sogs pa myong zhes sgrogs //
analyzed: sngo la sogs pa myong zhes sgrogs //
translated: is proclaimed as the experience of blue, etc.

original: shes las tha dad ma yin na //
analyzed: shes las tha dad ma yin na //
translated: If it is not different from consciousness,

original: don gzhan yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: don gzhan yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can it be an object that is different?

original: spyi nyid yin na'ang don nyid na //
analyzed: spyi nyid yin na'ang don nyid na //
translated: If it is a universal, it follows that the nature of an object

original: shes pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur //
translated: is the nature of consciousness.

original: zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: If you say this,

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: we have no fault, because we accept that.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa kho nar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa kho nar gsungs so //
translated: Likewise, the noble Sa·πÉdhinirmocana S≈´tra also says that the image that is the object of concentration is not different from consciousness.

original: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rung nyams su myong ba nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no //üîΩ'o na @157a * //
analyzed: de bas na bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang rung nyams su myong ba nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin no // 'o na @157a * //
translated: Therefore, like pleasure, etc., blue, etc. are also the nature of the experience of cognition.

original: rnam par shes pa du ma cig car yod pa rnyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa du ma cig car yod pa rnyed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the simultaneous existence of many cognitions would be found.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because we accept that.

original: 'o na rnam pa gcig yin no zhes ji skad du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam pa gcig yin no zhes ji skad du bstan zhe na /
translated: But if there is only one aspect, how can it be taught?

original: 'di ltar gzhan du cha rnam par dbye ba byas na shes pa gzhan nyams su myong ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du cha rnam par dbye ba byas na shes pa gzhan nyams su myong ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because if it were divided into parts, there would be no experience of another cognition.

original: de la shes pa gzhan gcig tu de yod do zhes brjod par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la shes pa gzhan gcig tu de yod do zhes brjod par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it cannot be said that another cognition exists in one part of it,

original: shes pas nyams su ma myong na yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa ni nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas nyams su ma myong na yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa ni nyams su myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is not experienced by cognition, it is not reasonable for it to exist, and because cognition is the experience.

original: phyi rol pa la yang rim pa 'di nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol pa la yang rim pa 'di nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't this the same sequence for non-Buddhists?

original: de dag ni nyams su myong ba ma yin yang yongs su khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyams su myong ba ma yin yang yongs su khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although they are not experienced, they are accepted as real.

original: 'o na gal te bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i ngo bo yin na de ci'i phyir phyi rol du snang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te bde ba la sogs pa bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa yang shes pa'i ngo bo yin na de ci'i phyir phyi rol du snang zhe na /
translated: If blue, etc., are the nature of consciousness, like pleasure, etc., why do they appear as external?

original: 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can 'khrul pa'i sa bon gyi dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thog ma med pa'i dus can 'khrul pa'i sa bon gyi dbang gis yin no //
translated: This is due to the power of the beginningless seed of error.

original: de la 'dir gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang lus dang snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs par snang ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dir gzhan dag na re rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa yang lus dang snod kyi 'jig rten la sogs par snang ba'i phyir sna tshogs pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: In this regard, others say that the consciousness that is the result of maturation is indeed diverse because it appears as the body, the external world, etc.

original: de yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: But that is not established as being a single entity,

original: ri mo bkra ba la sogs pa dran pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa du ma snang ba nyams su myong ba nyid yin pas de yang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri mo bkra ba la sogs pa dran pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa du ma snang ba nyams su myong ba nyid yin pas de yang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because the consciousness that remembers a variegated picture, etc., is also experienced as appearing in many aspects, and so it is not a single entity.üîΩIf that is so,

original: de lta yin dang // de ni rigs dag mthun pa yi //
analyzed: de lta yin dang // de ni rigs dag mthun pa yi //
translated: it is not reasonable that it be a single entity,üîΩbecause it is similar to a collection.

original: rnam par shes pa nges pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nges pa yin //
translated: Consciousness is definite.

original: rnam par rtog pa rim gyis 'byung //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rim gyis 'byung //
translated: Conceptualization arises in sequence.

original: 'di ltar yang dag mngon pa yin //üîΩzhes rnam 'grel byed pa'i tshig dag 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag mngon pa yin // zhes rnam 'grel byed pa'i tshig dag 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the real manifest.üîΩThe words of the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya are contradictory.

original: gzhan dag na de rnam pa thams cad ni du ma sna tshogs yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag na de rnam pa thams cad ni du ma sna tshogs yin gyi /
translated: Others say that the meaning of the words is different: ‚ÄúThe aspects are many and various,

original: sems can thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ni gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud ni gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig de ni don gzhan yin te /
translated: but the continuum of consciousness of all sentient beings is one.‚Äù

original: gcig gi sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: gcig gi sgra ni 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i rnam grangs te /
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúonly.‚Äù

original: gtso bo gcig dang gzhan dag gcig //
analyzed: gtso bo gcig dang gzhan dag gcig //
translated: One is the principal one, the other is one.

original: gcig po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa yin //üîΩzhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig po 'ba' zhig 'dod pa yin // zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only one is asserted.

original: des na 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this is taught:

original: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni gcig po 'ba' zhig yin gyi /üîΩde la bdag dang / bdag gi 'am /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun ni gcig po 'ba' zhig yin gyi / de la bdag dang / bdag gi 'am /
translated: The continuum of their consciousness is one only.üîΩIn that, there is no self, mine,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: or subject-object.

original: kha cig las sems gnyis @157b cig car du skye ba de ni gnas med do zhes 'byung ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems dang byams pa la sogs pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig las sems gnyis @157b cig car du skye ba de ni gnas med do zhes 'byung ba de yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems dang byams pa la sogs pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of minds that are incompatible and minds concomitant with love, etc.

original: de gnyis lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not contradictory that those two are not characterized by simultaneous abiding.

original: rnam 'grel byed pas de ni rigs dag mthun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa khungs sngar bstan pa de'i dgongs pa yang 'di nyid yin par mngon no //
analyzed: rnam 'grel byed pas de ni rigs dag mthun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa khungs sngar bstan pa de'i dgongs pa yang 'di nyid yin par mngon no //
translated: The intention of the passage cited earlier in the commentary on the line ‚ÄúThe mind is the same in type‚Äù is also clearly this.

original: 'di yang slob dpon kha cig 'chad pa dag des smras pa yin no //üîΩphyi rol du gnas pa nyid la rnam pa'i dngos po 'di dag bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang slob dpon kha cig 'chad pa dag des smras pa yin no // phyi rol du gnas pa nyid la rnam pa'i dngos po 'di dag bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Some masters explain this as the position of the Vaibhasikas.üîΩThis teaches that external objects exist and that consciousness does not have aspects.

original: rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin pas rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa med par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin pas rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa med par ston to //
translated: Therefore consciousness is taught to be devoid of aspects.

original: phyi'i don gyis 'di la rnam pa skyed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don gyis 'di la rnam pa skyed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: External objects do not generate aspects in consciousness.

original: de lta bu yin pa la dgongs nas 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu yin pa la dgongs nas 'phags pa rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa las kyang /
translated: Thinking of such a matter, the Abhisamyaya says:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po sems ni sngon po ma yin /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po sems ni sngon po ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúGuhyapati, the mind is not blue,

original: ser po ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ser po ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is not yellow, and so on.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa sna tshogs kyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa yang yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is certainly empty of various aspects,

original: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs par snang ba ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i rdul phra rab la sogs par snang ba ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: because it appears as partless subtle atoms and so on, which arise from the meditation on the correct object.

original: 'di ltar yang dag yang dag min //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag yang dag min //
translated: Thus, correct and incorrect

original: gang gang de la shin tu bsgoms //
analyzed: gang gang de la shin tu bsgoms //
translated: are what is well meditated upon.

original: bsgoms pa yongs su grub pa na /üîΩ'bras bu mi rtog de blo gsal //
analyzed: bsgoms pa yongs su grub pa na / 'bras bu mi rtog de blo gsal //
translated: When meditation is perfected,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the result is nonconceptual, clear mind.

original: rgyas par dpyad pa yod pas re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: rgyas par dpyad pa yod pas re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Since there is an extensive analysis, I will leave it for the time being.

original: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par rtogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang nges par bral ba thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos thams cad la the tshom med par rtogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa thams cad dang nges par bral ba thob par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase wishing to realize all those dharmas without doubt means wishing to attain freedom from all superimpositions.

original: gzhan dag sems pa chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba'i thabs la gnas pas rgyal ba'i go 'phang shin tu myur bar thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems pa chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba'i thabs la gnas pas rgyal ba'i go 'phang shin tu myur bar thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Others think, By abiding in the method of turning the wheel of Dharma twelve times in three stages, one will attain the state of a victor very quickly.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pas ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir 'jam dpal lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pas ni ma yin no zhe na / de'i phyir 'jam dpal lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: It is not by striving in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩTherefore, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, in response to that, it is said, Those who wish to listen to the turning of the wheel of Dharma in twelve aspects three times...

original: ji ltar rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de nyan par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩji ltar zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis so //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de nyan par 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ji ltar zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis so //
translated: Here, the phrase in twelve aspects is to be connected with turning the wheel of Dharma three times.üîΩIn response to that, it is said, Those who wish to listen to the turning of the wheel of Dharma in twelve aspects three times...

original: gang du rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba zhes sbyar ro //üîΩde la @158a * //
analyzed: gang du rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba zhes sbyar ro //üîΩde la @158a * //
translated: Here, the phrase in twelve aspects is to be connected with turning the wheel of Dharma three times.üîΩIn response to that, it is said, Those who wish to listen to the turning of the wheel of Dharma in twelve aspects three times...üîΩHere, the phrase in twelve aspects is to be connected with turning the wheel of Dharma three times.

original: 'di ni lan gsum du bskor ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni lan gsum du bskor ba yin te /
translated: This is the third turning of the wheel of the doctrine.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering.

original: de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon par shes pas yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: It is to be fully understood by direct knowledge.

original: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of the path leading to the cessation of suffering.

original: de ni mngon par shes pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon par shes pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It is to be developed by direct knowledge.

original: bdag gis bsgoms so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis bsgoms so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I have developed it.

original: dge slong dag sngon ma thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin yid la byed ba ni mig skyes pa dang shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon ma thos pa'i chos la tshul bzhin yid la byed ba ni mig skyes pa dang shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skyes te /
translated: Monks, the arising of the eye of the Dharma, the knowledge, the understanding, the realization, and the light, in regard to things that were previously unheard, with respect to the four noble truths.

original: bya ba byed pa'i tshig ni bden pa re re'i gsum po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i tshig ni bden pa re re'i gsum po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe performance of function‚Äù should be applied to each of the three statements about each of the four noble truths.

original: de bas na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi re re la yang lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi re re la yang lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, each of the four noble truths is stated three times, and so the wheel of the doctrine has three revolutions.

original: de ltar bzlas pa de thams cad bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur bas de'i phyir rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa de thams cad bsdoms na rnam pa bcu gnyis su 'gyur bas de'i phyir rnam pa bcu gnyis kyi chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, all of these recitations are combined into twelve aspects, and therefore it is called the wheel of the Dharma with twelve aspects.

original: de'i mdo de yang dang por yul b'a r'a na s'ira bshad do //
analyzed: de'i mdo de yang dang por yul b'a r'a na s'ira bshad do //
translated: That s≈´tra was first explained in the land of VƒÅrƒÅ·πáasƒ´.

original: chos rnams kyi 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'khor lo ni chos kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the wheel of the Dharma.

original: 'khor lo dang 'dra bas 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang 'dra bas 'khor lo yin no //
translated: It is a wheel because it is like a wheel.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni 'khor lo rin po che'i rjes su 'brang ba dpung gi tshogs thams cad kyang rjes su 'brang zhing tha ma nas 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po ni 'khor lo rin po che'i rjes su 'brang ba dpung gi tshogs thams cad kyang rjes su 'brang zhing tha ma nas 'gro'o //
translated: For example, when the precious wheel of a wheel-turning king moves, the entire army follows it and goes after it.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum gyi bdag po chos kyi dbang phyug dam pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas kyang mdo sde de dang por gsungs pa'i rjes su bshad pa'i chos kyi sku thams cad 'chad par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum gyi bdag po chos kyi dbang phyug dam pa bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas kyang mdo sde de dang por gsungs pa'i rjes su bshad pa'i chos kyi sku thams cad 'chad par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One, the TathƒÅgata, the supreme lord of the Dharma of the three realms, also causes the entire body of the Dharma to be explained, following the explanation of that s≈´tra first.

original: de nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa thabs su gyur pa can gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la'o //
analyzed: de nyan par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor pa thabs su gyur pa can gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la'o //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to listen to it refers to the nondual intuition that is the means for setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

original: de rtogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: de rtogs par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to understand it refers to the understanding that is born of reflection.

original: de nas yul de la mos par 'dod pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su byung ba 'di ni de kho na yin no zhes mos pa'o //
analyzed: de nas yul de la mos par 'dod pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su byung ba 'di ni de kho na yin no zhes mos pa'o //
translated: Then, the phrase one who wishes to have conviction about it refers to the conviction that arises after the understanding born of reflection, and it is the conviction that this is the way things really are.

original: de la 'jug par 'dod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: de la 'jug par 'dod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The phrase one who wishes to engage in it refers to the understanding that is born of meditative realization.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid mnyan par bya ste /
translated: One should listen to this perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i thabs ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa goms par byas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan @158b yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i thabs ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa goms par byas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan @158b yod pa ma yin la /
translated: because, apart from the cultivation of the selflessness of persons and things, there is no other means for setting the wheel of the Dharma in motion.

original: de yang 'dir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dir bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that is taught here in this very perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan dag sems pa gang zhig sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed cing sems can gyi 'du shes la yang mi gnas pa dang / nga rgyal dang bral ba'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad dang rtsod pa med pa'i mchog yin pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag sems pa gang zhig sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed cing sems can gyi 'du shes la yang mi gnas pa dang / nga rgyal dang bral ba'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad dang rtsod pa med pa'i mchog yin pa dang /
translated: Others think, That thought which pervades all sentient beings with love, and does not even abide in the perception of sentient beings, and is the supreme non-conflict with the whole world because it is free from pride,

original: 'jig rten gyi bsam pa la mngon par ma zhen pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi spros pa mi dmigs pa de 'dra ba des myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsam pa la mngon par ma zhen pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi spros pa mi dmigs pa de 'dra ba des myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: that thought which does not observe the proliferation of the world because it is not attached to worldly thoughts, quickly attains buddhahood in just such a way,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not by striving in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya bar yang 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par bya bar yang 'dod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, One should also wish to pervade all sentient beings with love, and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa med par de 'dra ba'i spyod pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa med par de 'dra ba'i spyod pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that without striving in the perfection of wisdom, such conduct is not accomplished.

original: kha cig sems pa chos thams cad thog ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa rtogs par 'dod pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
analyzed: kha cig sems pa chos thams cad thog ma nas zhi ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa rtogs par 'dod pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking that they will quickly attain unsurpassable, perfect, complete enlightenment,

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bar du rtogs par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i bar du rtogs par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: they are told, ‚ÄúTherefore, those who aspire to realize that all phenomena are unborn‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i tshig gis thog ma nas zhi ba nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
