analyzed: bka' mchid der ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi gong ma rtogs pa ma bstan to zhes bya ba des kyang skye ba med pa 'di bstan pa yin no zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: In that discourse, the higher realization of the arhats was not taught. By this, he means that this non-arising was taught.

original: rtogs par skye ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs par skye ba ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising of realization was not taught.

original: gong ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du rtogs pa dang / thar pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: gong ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni khyad par du rtogs pa dang / thar pa zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúliberation‚Äù refers to the realization of the distinctive attributes of the Buddha ground up to the attainment of liberation.

original: ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bstan to zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúnot taught‚Äù means that it is not reasonable to take the Buddha ground as the object of realization.

original: de dag kyang byang chub yongs su sgyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang byang chub yongs su sgyur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the Buddha ground is the transformation of enlightenment.

original: theg pa gcig tu bstan pa 'di yang thar pas yid skrag pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //üîΩdgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos @171b rnams rnam par gzhag par byas pa med pas skye bar bstan to zhes ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gcig tu bstan pa 'di yang thar pas yid skrag pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no // dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos @171b rnams rnam par gzhag par byas pa med pas skye bar bstan to zhes ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This teaching of the One Vehicle is also given in consideration of those who are frightened by liberation.üîΩThe S≈´tra does not say that the dharmas of the Arhats are established as the dharmas of ordinary beings.üîΩThe intention is that the dharmas of the Arhats are not established as the dharmas of ordinary beings.

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos de dag rnam par bshig pa ma lags pa de ltar bstan to zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //üîΩde dag gis de rnam par bshig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa'i chos rnams kyis so so'i skye bo'i chos de dag rnam par bshig pa ma lags pa de ltar bstan to zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //üîΩde dag gis de rnam par bshig pa ma yin te /
translated: The dharmas of the Arhats do not destroy those dharmas of ordinary beings.

original: thog ma nyid nas de rnam par bshig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma nyid nas de rnam par bshig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is destroyed from the very beginning.

original: mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de bstan par gyur to zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de bstan par gyur to zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Why is it said that the teaching of the non-arising of all things has been taught?

original: ji tsam du skrag pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin na ni de skad du smras pa des kyang shin tu skrag pa kho nar brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na nyes pa med de /
analyzed: ji tsam du skrag pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin na ni de skad du smras pa des kyang shin tu skrag pa kho nar brjod pa ma yin nam zhe na nyes pa med de /
translated: If this treatise was composed in order to eliminate fear, then is it not the case that by this statement one would be expressing fear?

original: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas de ltar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya'i bye brag la ltos nas de ltar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no fault, because it is taught in this way in consideration of the diversity of those to be trained.

original: 'di la mi dge ba la sogs pa skye ba ma yin no zhes gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi ched du de skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mi dge ba la sogs pa skye ba ma yin no zhes gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi ched du de skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught in this way for the sake of those who grasp that non-virtue and so on do not arise in this.

original: gzhan dag las ni mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i sa 'dir yang dag par 'di'i mtha' zhes 'byung ba ni 'di ltar bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag las ni mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i sa 'dir yang dag par 'di'i mtha' zhes 'byung ba ni 'di ltar bshad de /
translated: In other s≈´tras, the stage called non-arising is called the limit of reality. This is explained as follows:

original: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Reality is suchness and so on.

original: mtha' ni tshogs dang mchog dang mthar phyin pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni tshogs dang mchog dang mthar phyin pa la bya'o //
translated: The limit is the collection, the supreme, and the ultimate.

original: yang na bhu ta zhes bya ba sems can la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bhu ta zhes bya ba sems can la bya ste /
translated: Or else, bh≈´ta refers to sentient beings.

original: de'i mchog gam dngos po rnams yod pa'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs par bshad pa ni mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: de'i mchog gam dngos po rnams yod pa'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs par bshad pa ni mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: The explanation of the ultimate existence of their supreme or real nature, etc. is for the purpose of not frightening them.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang de la bdag gis 'di skad du chos bstan pa 'di la sems can gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang de la bdag gis 'di skad du chos bstan pa 'di la sems can gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig lhag ma'o ;
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, I have taught this Dharma teaching as follows: ‚ÄúThere are no sentient beings whatsoever in this Dharma teaching who have attained, are attaining, or will attain nirvana.‚Äù

original: / de ltar na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med pa zhes bya ba'i chos bstan pa 'di yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the Dharma teaching called ‚ÄúThe Absence of Quiescence.‚Äù

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa dag ste de dngos po med par bshad pas 'di la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa dag ste de dngos po med par bshad pas 'di la 'dun par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught for the purpose of encouraging those who are frightened of nirvana, since it explains that it does not exist.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Why is that?

original: mnyan pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar bshad ces sems pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar bshad ces sems pa'o //
translated: This is thinking, ‚ÄúHow is this explained?‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yod pa shin tu mi dmigs pa'i slad du ste zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yod pa shin tu mi dmigs pa'i slad du ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: The intention is, ‚ÄúBlessed One, it is like this: because existence is not at all apprehended.‚Äù

original: 'di dmigs su yod pa ma yin @172a * //
analyzed: 'di dmigs su yod pa ma yin @172a * //
translated: This is not apprehended.

original: pas yod pa dmigs su med pa'o //
analyzed: pas yod pa dmigs su med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, existence is not apprehended.

original: de'i dngos po ni dmigs su med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dmigs su med pa nyid do //
translated: That entity is not apprehended.

original: yod pa ni mi dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni mi dmigs pa dang / dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Existence is not apprehended because it is not an object of apprehension.

original: yod pa ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa ni bdag nyid do //
translated: Existence is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das de skad 'drin zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de skad 'drin zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Blessed One, it is like that.‚Äù

original: na zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúSo it is said‚Äù means ‚Äúso it is done.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩbdag gis de skad ces bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // bdag gis de skad ces bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rest is clear.üîΩ‚ÄúI have said this‚Äù

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i tshig zur gyis so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i tshig zur gyis so //
translated: means ‚ÄúI have said this in the manner explained.‚Äù

original: 'o na gang zhig skal ba can chos yod par mngon par ma zhen pa dag 'di na de la yang tshig zur gyis brjod dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig skal ba can chos yod par mngon par ma zhen pa dag 'di na de la yang tshig zur gyis brjod dam zhe na /
translated: Well then, for those who are fortunate, who do not cling to the existence of dharmas, is this expressed indirectly?

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To respond, ‚ÄúNo,‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bdag las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang bdag las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, ‚ÄúMoreover, I wish to hear this profound perfection of wisdom from you.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi tshe don gyi de kho na nyid gzung ba'i ched du //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe don gyi de kho na nyid gzung ba'i ched du //
translated: At that time, in order to grasp the reality of the meaning,

original: de la bdag gis 'di skad du zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: de la bdag gis 'di skad du zhes gsungs so//
translated: he said, ‚ÄúI would say this to him.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skad du zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúthis‚Äù?

original: gal te khyod nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid ma gtod cig ces gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te khyod nyan par 'dod na de mnyan to snyam du yid ma gtod cig ces gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf you wish to listen, do not focus your mind on ‚ÄòI will listen.‚Äô

original: mnyan to snyam du yul gzhan la ma 'jug cig / sems ma skyed cig sems gang zhe na mnyan to snyam du zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyan to snyam du yul gzhan la ma 'jug cig / sems ma skyed cig sems gang zhe na mnyan to snyam du zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Do not engage in another object, do not generate the mind. What is the mind? It is ‚ÄòI will listen.‚Äô‚Äù

original: yang na yid ma gtod cig ces bya ba ni mnyan to snyam du de ltar ma 'dug cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na yid ma gtod cig ces bya ba ni mnyan to snyam du de ltar ma 'dug cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Or else, do not pay attention means do not sit there thinking, I will listen.

original: don 'di nyid ni mnyan to snyam du sems ma skyed cig ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni mnyan to snyam du sems ma skyed cig ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This very point is stated in the passage, Do not generate the thought, I will listen.

original: mnyan par mngon par zhen par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mnyan par mngon par zhen par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is, do not be attached to listening.

original: gal te de ltar sems mi skyed na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems mi skyed na /
translated: If you do not generate the thought in that way,

original: 'o na ji ltar chos de dag bshad pa nyan par nus she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos de dag bshad pa nyan par nus she na /
translated: how can you listen to the explanation of those dharmas?

original: de'i phyir / kye skyes bu sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i shes rab skyed cig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di shes par nus so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kye skyes bu sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab ci 'dra ba de lta bu'i shes rab skyed cig dang / de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di shes par nus so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, O being, generate the wisdom of an illusory person, and with that you will be able to understand this teaching of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i skyes bu ni rang gis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa la mi dmigs shing mngon par ma zhen pa de bzhin du khyod kyang chos bshad pa 'di dag la mnyan par mngon par zhen par ma byed cig //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i skyes bu ni rang gis sprul pa'i glang po che la sogs pa la mi dmigs shing mngon par ma zhen pa de bzhin du khyod kyang chos bshad pa 'di dag la mnyan par mngon par zhen par ma byed cig //
translated: Just as a magician does not perceive and does not conceive of the elephants and so on that he has conjured up, so you should not conceive of these things that are taught.

original: sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu ste /
translated: A magician is a conjurer of illusions.

original: tshig bar ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig bar ma khong nas dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The middle word is elided.

original: de ni shes rab la mngon @172b par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: de ni shes rab la mngon @172b par zhen pa med do //
translated: He does not conceive of wisdom.

original: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de lta bus zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: By such means is as follows: by the method that will be explained.

original: bdag ni rten med pa gnas par ji ltar spro /
analyzed: bdag ni rten med pa gnas par ji ltar spro /
translated: How can I, who have no support, be enthusiastic?

original: 'di la sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab kyi dpe yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i shes rab kyi dpe yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the example of the wisdom of the illusory man is not correct,

original: de la yang rgal ba mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'dri bar byed pa yang rna bal sogs pa'i don la brten pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang rgal ba mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'dri bar byed pa yang rna bal sogs pa'i don la brten pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the questioner is also based on the sense faculties such as the ear.

original: de la kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di nga las nyan par 'dod na 'di lta bur 'dug cig ces bya ba'i tshig dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di nga las nyan par 'dod na 'di lta bur 'dug cig ces bya ba'i tshig dang sbyar ro //
translated: The Buddha said to him, O good man, if you wish to listen to this Dharma teaching from me, you should sit like this.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes lta bur gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' la bya'i rjes lta bur gnas par gyis shig ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said, You should sit like the trace of a bird in the sky.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin na ni de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin na ni de lta bus chos bstan pa 'di mnyan par nus kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Because if it is like that, then one can listen to this Dharma teaching in that way, but not otherwise.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: 'di la gnas gyur pa'i don yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la gnas gyur pa'i don yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, the meaning of transformation does not exist.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa spong bar byed pa de ltar yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa spong bar byed pa de ltar yin zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that it is like this in order to abandon any such conception.

original: dper na nam mkha' la bya'i gnas ni rang gi sgro gshog gi nang na yod pa'i rlung las ma gtogs par gnas pa mi ltos par dkyil na gnas so //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bya'i gnas ni rang gi sgro gshog gi nang na yod pa'i rlung las ma gtogs par gnas pa mi ltos par dkyil na gnas so //
translated: For example, the trace of a bird in the sky is in the middle, not relying on a place to stand, except for the wind inside its own wings and feathers.

original: de bzhin du khyod kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam las ma gtogs par gnas pa dang bral ba mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes rab mngon du byos la'ang 'dug cig / bdag dang bdag gis bya ba la yang gnas par ma byed cig /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam las ma gtogs par gnas pa dang bral ba mngon par zhen pa med pa'i shes rab mngon du byos la'ang 'dug cig / bdag dang bdag gis bya ba la yang gnas par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not dwell on the notion of an ‚ÄúI‚Äù or on what ‚ÄúI‚Äù do.

original: gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i ngo bo ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis med pa'i ngo bo ni gdon mi za bar dmigs par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: The nature of both duality and nonduality is certainly to be observed.

original: de la mi brten na ni gzhan gang la brten te bdag gi 'du shes bshig par bya /
analyzed: de la mi brten na ni gzhan gang la brten te bdag gi 'du shes bshig par bya /
translated: If you do not rely on that, then what else can you rely on to destroy the notion of an ‚ÄúI‚Äù?

original: lta ba'i rnam pa rtog pa dang chad pa la sogs pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya /
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa rtog pa dang chad pa la sogs pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya /
translated: You should transcend the views of conceptualization, nihilism, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang lhag par dmigs par bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang lhag par dmigs par bya /
translated: You should also observe the qualities of the Buddha.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang bskyod pa yin /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang bskyod pa yin /
translated: You should also transcend the qualities of ordinary beings.

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, all of these are as follows:

original: mig dang gzugs nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nas /
translated: The eye and form,üîΩup to

original: yid dang chos zhes bya ba'i bar de dag yul dang yul can gnyis tsam du nyan thos rnams kyis bzung ba'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / de las gzhan du lta bar gyur pa rnams shin tu ring du spong bar byed do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i de @173a * //
analyzed: yid dang chos zhes bya ba'i bar de dag yul dang yul can gnyis tsam du nyan thos rnams kyis bzung ba'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / de las gzhan du lta bar gyur pa rnams shin tu ring du spong bar byed do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i de @173a * //
translated: Because the ≈õrƒÅvakas grasp the so-called mind and mental objects as merely subject and object, they have the notion of self and they are very far from the abandonment of the other views.

original: bzhin nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan dag spong bar byed do //
analyzed: bzhin nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan dag spong bar byed do //
translated: But the bodhisattvas, because they focus on the mere nondual suchness, abandon the others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang rten par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la yang rten par byed do //
translated: And they also support the buddhadharmas.

original: gtan tshigs de dag gis na de gnyi gas kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las bskyod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de dag gis na de gnyi gas kyang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las bskyod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: For these reasons, both of them are said to be ‚Äúdetached from the dharmas of ordinary people.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir / kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di nyan par 'dod na de'i phyir gnyis la ma dmigs shig mi gnyis pa la yang ma dmigs shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / kye skyes bu gal te khyod kyis chos bstan pa 'di nyan par 'dod na de'i phyir gnyis la ma dmigs shig mi gnyis pa la yang ma dmigs shig ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúO man, if you wish to listen to this teaching of the Dharma, then do not focus on duality, and do not focus on nonduality.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dris te /
translated: Here, why is that?

original: 'dir ji ltar dgos pa de'i lan ni ma lon no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩlan du 'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar dgos pa de'i lan ni ma lon no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // lan du 'di la gnyis su brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod par bya ba 'am /
translated: Here, the answer to that purpose is not obtained, that is the meaning.üîΩIn response, it is said that there is no expression of duality or non-duality to be expressed here.

original: gnyis med par brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis med par brjod par bya ba yongs su brjod pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because there is nothing to be expressed.

original: gzhan dag las gnyis dang gnyis su med par ston pa bstan du zin kyang gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag las gnyis dang gnyis su med par ston pa bstan du zin kyang gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Although it is taught elsewhere that there is duality and non-duality, that is from the perspective of those to be trained.

original: 'dir ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gcig kho nar nges pa'i don yin pa'i phyir gnyis gang yang mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gcig kho nar nges pa'i don yin pa'i phyir gnyis gang yang mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But here, since this Dharma discourse is exclusively definitive in meaning, it does not teach any duality.

original: 'dir yang gnyis med pa tsam bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang gnyis med pa tsam bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Here, isn't non-duality alone taught?

original: ma yin te de la yang gnyis su med pa nyid du dmigs na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma yin te de la yang gnyis su med pa nyid du dmigs na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro//
translated: No, because even in that, if non-duality is observed, it does not transcend the nature of duality.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis bstan /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir rab tu grags pa'i dbye bas gnyis bstan /
translated: Why then are two kinds of persons taught by way of the well-known division?

original: de lta na yang de ltar dogs pa ma bsal ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ltar dogs pa ma bsal ba kho na ma yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Even so, is not the doubt just stated not removed?

original: gal te chos bstan pa 'di nyan par 'dod na bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma bshig cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te chos bstan pa 'di nyan par 'dod na bdag tu 'du shes rnams kyang ma bshig cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If you wish to listen to this teaching of the Dharma, do not destroy the notion of self, etc.

original: lta bar gyur pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The view is the aspect of the view.

original: bdag tu 'du shes logs shig tu smos pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir te /üîΩdper na bram ze rnams 'ongs so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes logs shig tu smos pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis na gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir te / dper na bram ze rnams 'ongs so //
translated: The notion of self is mentioned separately because it is the chief cause of all the afflictions,üîΩjust as, for example, it is said, ‚ÄúThe Brahmins have come,

original: ba sita yang 'ongs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ba sita yang 'ongs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: and the cows have come.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: bdag tu 'du shes 'jig pa la sogs par byed pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes 'jig pa la sogs par byed pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The destruction of the notion of self, etc. is not at all the case.

original: de dag ni de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yod pa'i tshe de yod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid shes pa yod pa'i tshe de yod pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when there is knowledge of reality by those who know reality, it is impossible for them to exist.

original: 'du shes la sogs pa ni 'du shes la sogs pa'i don mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes la sogs pa ni 'du shes la sogs pa'i don mi 'thad pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because the meaning of perception, etc. is not tenable.

original: bcom ldan @173b 'das gang zhig bdag la nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i tshig re re dang sbyar ba'i phyir dang / mjug sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan @173b 'das gang zhig bdag la nyan par 'tshal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa'i tshig re re dang sbyar ba'i phyir dang / mjug sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One, whoever wishes to listen to me, etc. is because of the connection with each of the words just mentioned, and because of the summary.

original: de skad brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de skad smra bar bgyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skad brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de skad smra bar bgyi zhes bya'o //
translated: One should say thus means one should speak thus.

original: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pas de skad ces bya bas 'dul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: de skad rjes su bstan par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pas de skad ces bya bas 'dul bar bgyi'o //
translated: One should instruct thus means one should discipline by saying thus in a way that is not erroneous.

original: de ltar 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs sbyar bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di la gzhag par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar mnyan pa dang sems pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i thabs sbyar bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should establish thus in this way means one should apply the method that is in accordance with listening, reflection, etc.

original: yang na 'di dag ni tshig snga ma rnam par 'byed pa yin no //üîΩde ltar rjes su gdams pa bstan pa 'di la gal te 'dri ba'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
analyzed: yang na 'di dag ni tshig snga ma rnam par 'byed pa yin no // de ltar rjes su gdams pa bstan pa 'di la gal te 'dri ba'i rigs kyi bu 'am /
translated: Or else, these are the analyses of the previous words.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni de ltar zhugs na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de ltar gnas shing 'di nyid rnam par 'byed pa ni de ltar zhugs na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in this teaching of the instructions, if that son or daughter of good lineage who is abiding in this way and analyzing this very thing, if he or she engages in this way,

original: yang na dang por gnas shing rgyun gyis zhugs na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dang por gnas shing rgyun gyis zhugs na zhes bya ste /
translated: or else, if he or she first abides and engages in this continuously,üîΩthen, having come to abide in this very seal of eloquence, subsequently,

original: de spobs pa'i phyag rgya 'di la gnas par gyur na slad kyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni rjes la zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de spobs pa'i phyag rgya 'di la gnas par gyur na slad kyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni rjes la zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: this very meaning of ‚Äúlater‚Äù is ‚Äúafterwards,‚Äù

original: dus phyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus phyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning ‚Äúat a later time.‚Äù

original: rjes su gdams pa 'di dag nyid la spobs pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su gdams pa 'di dag nyid la spobs pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ste /
translated: These very instructions are called the seal of eloquence,

original: spobs pa so so'i yang dag par rig pa ston par byed pa dang / 'brel par spobs pa'i phyag rgya dang / rtags yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spobs pa so so'i yang dag par rig pa ston par byed pa dang / 'brel par spobs pa'i phyag rgya dang / rtags yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they reveal the individual correct knowledges of eloquence, and because they are the related seal and sign of eloquence.

original: 'di ltar rjes su gdams pa ston par byed pa dang / lam la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir ma log pa'i shes pa yod do zhes 'dis mngon par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su gdams pa ston par byed pa dang / lam la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir ma log pa'i shes pa yod do zhes 'dis mngon par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because he is the teacher of this instruction and because he has mastery over the path, he has nonerroneous knowledge.

original: thabs mngon sum du byas pa ni thabs 'di la sbyor ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs mngon sum du byas pa ni thabs 'di la sbyor ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is his declaration, because the method is manifest and it is not proper to apply this method.

original: de dag thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis rang dgar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis rang dgar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: All of this is the self-expression of the noble Manjusri.

original: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba ma yin no zhes kha cig dogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba ma yin no zhes kha cig dogs pa la /
translated: Some may doubt that this is not the permission of the Lord.

original: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: To them he says, Excellent, Manjusri, excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad kyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang khyod kyis thabs gzhan gyis man ngag dbog par bya'o zhes slob pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de la yang phyis 'di skad kyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa yang khyod kyis thabs gzhan gyis man ngag dbog par bya'o zhes slob pa yin no //
translated: And he teaches, You should also give this advice to those sons or daughters of good family by means of another method.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te 'bras bu nye bar ma bstan na de'i tshe chos nyan pa 'di don med pa yin no zhes rtogs nas nur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te 'bras bu nye bar ma bstan na de'i tshe chos nyan pa 'di don med pa yin no zhes rtogs nas nur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the result were not taught, the listener would think that the Dharma is useless and would turn away.

original: de bas na 'bras bu 'di yang bstan par bya @174a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu 'di yang bstan par bya @174a * //
translated: Therefore, this result must also be taught.

original: dgos so // de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal la bstan /
analyzed: dgos so // de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ci'i phyir 'phags pa 'jam dpal la bstan /
translated: Why is it said that ‚Äúif one wishes to see the TathƒÅgata‚Äù and so on, and why is this taught to the noble Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´?

original: blo gros yangs pa'i shes pa med pas de dag brjod par mi nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: blo gros yangs pa'i shes pa med pas de dag brjod par mi nus sam zhe na /
translated: Is it because he does not have the knowledge of vast intelligence and so cannot express it?

original: de la ni brgal du med de /
analyzed: de la ni brgal du med de /
translated: There is no objection to that.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs pa yin no //
translated: It is like this: this is the various miracles of the Buddha and bodhisattvas.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba ni de la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba ni de la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Among them, seeing the TathƒÅgata is the cause of serving him.

original: yang ston par khas len pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yang ston par khas len pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the cause of accepting the teaching.

original: de yang rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: And that is the cause of perfect enlightenment.

original: ci de bzhin bshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes khas blangs pa tsam kho nas byang chub pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de bzhin bshegs pa ni bdag gi ston pa'o zhes khas blangs pa tsam kho nas byang chub pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it that one becomes enlightened merely by the mere acceptance, ‚ÄúThe Tathagata is my teacher?‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not like that.

original: 'o na de ji ltar de'i rgyu nyid du bstan ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar de'i rgyu nyid du bstan ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it taught to be the cause of that?

original: de khas len pa ni byang chub 'grub par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad las mkhas par 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khas len pa ni byang chub 'grub par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad las mkhas par 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that acceptance is not the reason for achieving expertise in all the samadhis that accomplish the realization of enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa'i tshig gis de dang lhan cig tu spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyang nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa'i tshig gis de dang lhan cig tu spyod pa sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams kyang nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúexpertise in samadhi‚Äù also indicate the accumulations of the levels, the perfections, and so on that are practiced together with that acceptance.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs gang la ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa yod pas dngos su de nyid bzung ngo //
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs gang la ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa yod pas dngos su de nyid bzung ngo //
translated: Or else, since expertise in samadhi exists in the accumulation of the perfections, it is directly referred to.

original: ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa ni khong gzo ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa ni khong gzo ba'o //
translated: Expertise in samadhi is the patience of accepting the unborn.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should train in just this perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending anything.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba mi dmigs pa yin par bstan pa de'i phyir 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba mi dmigs pa yin par bstan pa de'i phyir 'di la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that just as it has been shown that the perfection of wisdom is not the object of engagement, one should train in it.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa la sogs pa dang 'brel par byang chub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la mkhas pa la sogs pa dang 'brel par byang chub pa yin gyi /
translated: Because in this way, one is enlightened in connection with the skill in the perfections, meditative stabilizations, and so forth,

original: ston par khas blangs pa tsam gyis 'grub pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: ston par khas blangs pa tsam gyis 'grub pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: and not by merely accepting the Teacher.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du bsgrub par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya'o
translated: Therefore, a son of the lineage or daughter of the lineage who wishes to accomplish the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, the supreme of all aspects, should train in just this perfection of wisdom by way of the non-existence of things.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: This is the summary.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mchog gtso bo ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mchog gtso bo ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog ste /
translated: The highest of all aspects is the highest of all qualities.

original: yon tan yongs su @174b dag pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su @174b dag pa yin no //
translated: It is the complete purity of the virtues.

original: de dag dang ldan zhing mnga' ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te de nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan zhing mnga' ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te de nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: The knowledge of the Omniscient One is endowed with and possesses that. It is the unexcelled enlightenment.

original: 'di zlos ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di zlos ba yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not a repetition,

original: 'di mjug sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di mjug sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a summary.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pas ye shes de skyed pa yin na ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pas ye shes de skyed pa yin na ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Why is that? The opponent's meaning is: If that knowledge is produced by skill in all concentrations, then what is the use of training in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa kho na la bslab pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad la mkhas pa kho na la bslab pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to train only in skill in all concentrations.

original: lan ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du byas pa ma yin pa dang ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med par 'dir bstan to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar du byas pa ma yin pa dang ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med par 'dir bstan to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The answer is: it is taught here that all the way up to the knowledge of a TathƒÅgata is not made, is not born, and is not a real existent.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Thus, all dharmas are equal to enlightenment. This is the answer.

original: gnyis su med pa nyid kyis byang chub dang mnyam pa ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid kyis byang chub dang mnyam pa ni byang chub dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: Because of non-duality, equal to enlightenment is equal to enlightenment.

original: de bas na chos gzhan dag la spyod pa yang byang chub kyi ched du spyod do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na chos gzhan dag la spyod pa yang byang chub kyi ched du spyod do zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, even when one practices other dharmas, it is said that one practices for the sake of enlightenment.

original: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs nas zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs nas zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: With the intention of equality, this is the intention.

original: de nyid ston pa ni ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa de ltar byang chub kyang chos thams cad dang mnyam pa'o zhes khong nas dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni ji ltar chos thams cad byang chub dang mnyam pa de ltar byang chub kyang chos thams cad dang mnyam pa'o zhes khong nas dbyung ba'o //
translated: The teaching of just that is: just as all dharmas are equal to enlightenment, so also enlightenment is equal to all dharmas. This is the implication.

original: mnyam pa nyid gnyi ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gnyi ga la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because equality exists in both.

original: phan tshun mnyam par ston pa de dag gis ni mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun mnyam par ston pa de dag gis ni mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: By these mutual equalities, the intention of equality is made clear.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang mnyam pa nyid la dgongs par ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang mnyam pa nyid la dgongs par ston pa ni /
translated: Others also teach the intention of equality:

original: byang chub ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bar sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as is enlightenment, so also are all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúso‚Äù is left out.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: Why is that so? He says, ‚Äúbecause of non-existence.‚Äù

original: rnam par brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-existence in the nature of conceptualization.

original: des ni mnyam pa nyid kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mnyam pa nyid kho nar bstan to //
translated: By that, he teaches equality itself.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is it non-existent?

original: gang gi phyir yod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa ste ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa thams cad ni spyod pa med pa ste ;
translated: Because all existence is without activity.

original: spyod pa ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni sgrub pa ste /
translated: Activity is accomplishment.

original: de dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the opposite of that.

original: spyod pa de yang byang chub ste mnyam pa nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa de yang byang chub ste mnyam pa nyid kho na yin no //
translated: That activity is also enlightenment, which is equality itself.

original: de bas na byang chub gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na skye ba med pa yang de yin /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub gang yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na skye ba med pa yang de yin /
translated: Therefore, since that is the reason for enlightenment, non-arising is that,üîΩnon-occurrence is that. All those s≈´tras

original: 'byung ba med pa yang de yin te mdo sde de dang de dag thams cad @175a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa yang de yin te mdo sde de dang de dag thams cad @175a * //
translated: should be understood in this way.

original: las brtan pa zhes bya ba ni tshig ltag ma'o //
analyzed: las brtan pa zhes bya ba ni tshig ltag ma'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthus‚Äù is a conclusion.

original: de ni mtshon par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mtshon par byed pa yin te /
translated: That is the demonstrative.

original: dngos po med pa yang de yin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang de yin /
translated: Non-existence is that,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yang de yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yang de yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: non-conditioning is that, and so on should be understood.

original: chos thams cad de lta bu 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad de lta bu 'di la zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, all dharmas‚Äù refers to desire and so on.

original: byang chub dang 'dod chags de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med so so ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid la dgongs par ston pa la zhes bya ba ni don de zhum pa med pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub dang 'dod chags de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med so so ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas mnyam pa nyid la dgongs par ston pa la zhes bya ba ni don de zhum pa med pas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEnlightenment and desire are non-dual, indivisible, and not separate‚Äù and so on teaches the intention of equality. ‚ÄúThus‚Äù connects to ‚Äúwithout discouragement.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i chos 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba med pa de byang chub yin na bdag ci'i phyir de skyed pa'i phyir brtson par byed ces dngang bar mi 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos 'di la zhum pa med par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba ni gal te skye ba med pa de byang chub yin na bdag ci'i phyir de skyed pa'i phyir brtson par byed ces dngang bar mi 'gro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In this way, without being discouraged with regard to this Dharma, one should desire it means that one should not be afraid, thinking, If that non-arising is enlightenment, why should I strive to generate it?

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyi rgyu dang bcas ba'i 'bras bu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das rang nyid kyi rgyu dang bcas ba'i 'bras bu yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir /

original: 'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa ni byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: The miraculous manifestations of the TathƒÅgata are the activities of the bodhisattvas while in the state of a bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang sprul pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par rol pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang sprul pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The play of the Tathagata is the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, the great miracles, the display of emanations, and so on, in the state of Buddhahood.

original: bar gyi tshig gis bdud dang gang po las rgyal ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa brjid rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig gis bdud dang gang po las rgyal ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa brjid rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The intervening words are to be understood as the majesty of the Tathagata, such as his victory over Mara and P≈´ra·πáa.

original: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang ngo ;
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang ngo ;
translated: And other such kinds.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yang der yan lag nyid yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yang der yan lag nyid yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag pa ci yod ce na /
translated: Why is that? If generosity, morality, and so on are also branches there, what is the superiority of the perfection of wisdom?

original: lan du de ni bstan du med pa yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lan du de ni bstan du med pa yin te zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The answer is: It is not demonstrated.

original: 'di la dpe bstan du yod pa ma yin pas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dpe bstan du yod pa ma yin pas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is not demonstrated because there is no example for it.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The idea is this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpe med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpe med pa ste /

original: de yongs su smos pa nyid kyis ni gzhan stobs can dag kyang dpe med pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su smos pa nyid kyis ni gzhan stobs can dag kyang dpe med pa yin par 'gyur ro //

original: de bas na 'di gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las bstan to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gtso bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las bstan to zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, since this is the most important, it is taught in this Perfection of Wisdom.

original: ci don dam @175b pa kho nar de las bstan nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci don dam @175b pa kho nar de las bstan nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it taught only in the ultimate sense? No, it is not.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin te /

original: rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is because it is not connected with conceptualization.

original: de'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin pas de bas na bstan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa rnams la de ltar snang ba yin pas de bas na bstan zhes gsungs so //
translated: Since the world appears like that by its power, therefore it is taught.

original: 'di man chad 'jam dpal dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdo sde 'chang ba la sogs pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad 'jam dpal dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mdo sde 'chang ba la sogs pa'i phan yon ston to //

original: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang zhes bya ba ni gang dag la tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' tsam yang med kyi tshig lhug par 'dug pa la yang de tsam mo //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang zhes bya ba ni gang dag la tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' tsam yang med kyi tshig lhug par 'dug pa la yang de tsam mo //

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //

original: ngag gi sdom pa legs pa yin //
analyzed: ngag gi sdom pa legs pa yin //

original: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //

original: kun tu sdom pa'ang legs pa yin //
analyzed: kun tu sdom pa'ang legs pa yin //

original: kun tu sdom pa'i dge slong ni //
analyzed: kun tu sdom pa'i dge slong ni //

original: sdug bsngal kun las grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las grol bar 'gyur //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang yod pas tshig bzhi pa zhes smos so //

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa bon yod pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa'o //

original: gang dag de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang dag de bzhin nyid kyi phyir sgrub pa lta ci smos zhes bya ba la /

original: de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po de lta bu'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni shin tu yang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po de lta bu'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam pa'i phyir sgrub pa ni shin tu yang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /

original: shin tu nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlta ci smos zhes bya ba ni de la brjod par bya ba yang ci yod /
analyzed: shin tu nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro // lta ci smos zhes bya ba ni de la brjod par bya ba yang ci yod /
translated: Because of that reality, this perfection of wisdom is the ultimate, and its practice is irreversible, because it is so close.üîΩWhat need is there to speak of those who, having written it out,

original: ma gsungs kyang mngon mod ces bya ba'i bar du yin no //üîΩrigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu nges par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de byang chub 'thob pa la rgyud nges pa blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyan thos dang rang byang chub kyi ched du sangs rgyas kyi yul na gnas pa yin par de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen /
analyzed: ma gsungs kyang mngon mod ces bya ba'i bar du yin no // rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni byang chub tu nges par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de byang chub 'thob pa la rgyud nges pa blangs pa'i phyir ro // nyan thos dang rang byang chub kyi ched du sangs rgyas kyi yul na gnas pa yin par de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen /
translated: would study it, etc. to: demonstrate it?üîΩThe Lord: So it is, Subhuti.üîΩThose sons and daughters of good family should be known as irreversible from full enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Tathagata knows, the Tathagata sees, those sons and daughters of good family who, in the last time, in the last age, in the last 500 years, will take up this perfection of wisdom, etc. to: demonstrate it.üîΩThey will not be reborn in the states of woe, nor will they be born in the lower rebirths.

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur bar du byed pa dang / gong du yang mos par byed pa ni tshig tu brjod pa thos nas mi skrag pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo ma skyes pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa'i bar 'di thos nas dngang bar mi 'gyur bar du byed pa dang / gong du yang mos par byed pa ni tshig tu brjod pa thos nas mi skrag pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: Those who, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, up to non-production, non-entityness, and non-arising, are not frightened, but are inspired, should be understood as not frightened by hearing the verbal expression, etc.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @176a * //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @176a * //

original: ni stobs la sogs pa la ste shin tu nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni stobs la sogs pa la ste shin tu nye bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This refers to the powers, etc., because they are very close.

original: 'ga' zhig rtog pa ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rtog pa ci'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why did the Buddha BhagavƒÅn say this?

original: mtha' med pa dag nas de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bshad pa dag gi yon tan rgyas par ston ce na /
analyzed: mtha' med pa dag nas de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bshad pa dag gi yon tan rgyas par ston ce na /
translated: From the limitless, he thus teaches the qualities of the bodhisattvas in detail.

original: 'dir 'jam dpal ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'jam dpal ngas sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mkhyen pa /
translated: Here, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, I, the Buddha, the TathƒÅgata, who knows

analyzed: dgra bcom pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mnos pa'i phyag rgya 'di gzhag par bya ste zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: tha ma'i tshig 'di dbus la sbyar ba'i phyir ro //

original: phyag rgya ni ston pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni ston pa'i rang bzhin yin te /

analyzed: chos kyi de kho na nyid kyi rtags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the sign of the reality of the Dharma.

original: 'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag rdo rje'i snying po 'chad pa bzhin du da ltar gyi tshe shod cig ces sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba yin no //

analyzed: 'chad par gyur pa la yang de'i zhal gzigs nas snyan gyis gtong ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par mkhyen pa yin no //

analyzed: bshad zin pa yod pa yang dgra bcom pa thams cad kyis khas blangs pa yin no //

analyzed: dgra bcom pa smos pa ni so so'i skye bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa yang mtshon par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: 'di gzhag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten du'o //

analyzed: chags pa med pa ni stong pa nyid de /

original: de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de yongs su bstan to //

analyzed: gang zhe na chos thams cad kyi bar du bstan to //

analyzed: phyag rgyas btab pa ni rtags btab pa ste /

original: de klog pa dang bsgom pa la brtson pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su 'gro ba'i skal ba can ma yin pa ni thog mar de'i @176b bsam pas gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot having the fortune to go to the state of a ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha‚Äù means ‚Äúnot having the fortune to go to the state of a ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i skal ba can ma yin pa ni bsam pa gnas su zin kyang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i skal ba can ma yin pa ni bsam pa gnas su zin kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúNot having the fortune to enter‚Äù means that even though one has the fortune to go to the state of a bodhisattva,

analyzed: phyis der 'jug pa'i brtson pa dang / sbyor bar mi byed pa'o //

analyzed: de dag gi rna lam du grag par 'gyur ba ni rna ba'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: de dag la lha de dag gis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that those gods have taught them.

original: 'di ltar de ltar lha de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub par blta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar lha de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'grub par blta ste /
translated: It should be seen that all the qualities of a Buddha are accomplished in those who are thus blessed by those gods.

original: nye bar gyur pa'i phyir de ltar lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa'i phyir de ltar lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Because they are close, they are thus accepted by the gods.

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang nges par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang nges par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: It should be seen that they will also attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. The meaning is that it should be known.

original: 'di byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
analyzed: 'di byin gyis brlab tu gsol /
translated: Please bless this!

original: bde bar gshegs pa byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni 'di legs par bshad pa yin no zhes de bzhin du khas len pa ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes bya ba ni 'di legs par bshad pa yin no zhes de bzhin du khas len pa ste /
translated: Please, Sugata, bless this! means that it is accepted as well-spoken.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas shin tu ji ltar yang skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir lan gnyis su gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pas shin tu ji ltar yang skabs rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir lan gnyis su gsungs so //
translated: In order to show that in the future, the demons, the tƒ´rthikas, and so on will never find an opportunity, he speaks twice.

original: yang na ji ltar de dag gis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ba de ltar byin gyis brlab tu gsol /üîΩji ltar gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar de dag gis rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ring po mi thogs par 'grub par 'gyur ba de ltar byin gyis brlab tu gsol / ji ltar gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: Or else, he says, ‚ÄúBless me so that I may accomplish my own aim, the perfection of the qualities of abandonment and realization, without delay.‚ÄùüîΩAnd he says, ‚ÄúBless me so that I may accomplish the aim of others,

original: de dag myur du 'grub par 'gyur ba de ltar yang byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag myur du 'grub par 'gyur ba de ltar yang byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: so that I may quickly accomplish the perfection of the aim of others.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni cung zad bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni cung zad bzhad pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat‚Äôs smile is a slight smile.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang ba 'od chen pos rgyas par khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di snang ba 'od chen pos rgyas par khyab par gyur to //
translated: This world-realms is filled with a great light.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas lags so zhes bya ba ni tshig zur du klag pa'am /üîΩci lags zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas lags so zhes bya ba ni tshig zur du klag pa'am / ci lags zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Blessed One, this is a sign of the empowerment of this teaching of the perfection of wisdom by the Tathagata.üîΩ This is to be read as a separate sentence, or as an interrogative from within.üîΩ Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, these are the signs of the empowerment of this teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas rnams te zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di byin gyis brlabs pa'i snga ltas rnams te zhes bya ba ni de de bzhin no zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
translated: This is the acceptance of that is so.

original: phyag rgya 'dis btab pa zhes gsungs na de la ji ltar btab pa mi shes pas de'i phyir /üîΩ'jam dpal gang dag chos gang yang med pa yin no zhes mi spang zhing mi zlog la @177a * //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'dis btab pa zhes gsungs na de la ji ltar btab pa mi shes pas de'i phyir / 'jam dpal gang dag chos gang yang med pa yin no zhes mi spang zhing mi zlog la @177a * //
translated: If it is said sealed with this seal, one may not know how it is sealed, so it is said:

original: bsngags par yang mi byed pa de dang de dag ni phyag rgya 'dis btab par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bsngags par yang mi byed pa de dang de dag ni phyag rgya 'dis btab par shes par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, those who do not abandon, do not negate, and do not praise the non-existence of any dharma, they should be known as sealed with this seal.

original: de dang de dag ces lan gnyis smos pa ni nges par gzung ba 'am rab tu dgyes pa yin no /
analyzed: de dang de dag ces lan gnyis smos pa ni nges par gzung ba 'am rab tu dgyes pa yin no /
translated: The repetition of ‚Äúthat and that‚Äù indicates a definite or strong preference.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid yul de la 'gag ba dang / khas blangs pa med par ji ltar 'jug ces sems pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid yul de la 'gag ba dang / khas blangs pa med par ji ltar 'jug ces sems pa'o //
translated: Why is that? He is thinking, ‚ÄúHow can the imagined nature and the relative nature be engaged without an object and without acceptance?‚Äù

original: lan ni 'jam dpal dmigs pa yod na spong bar byed pa dang bsngags par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lan ni 'jam dpal dmigs pa yod na spong bar byed pa dang bsngags par byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, if there is an object, one would abandon it and praise its abandonment.‚Äù

original: bsam pa ni 'di lta ste sgrub pa dang 'gog pa thams cad ni dmigs pa sngon du song ba can yin par de dag ji ltar sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di lta ste sgrub pa dang 'gog pa thams cad ni dmigs pa sngon du song ba can yin par de dag ji ltar sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: The idea is this: all proofs and refutations are preceded by an object. How is that? As previously explained,

original: gcig la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object of one and no non-object.

original: 'di mi dmigs pa yin no zhes blos mi dmigs pa ni rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di mi dmigs pa yin no zhes blos mi dmigs pa ni rtog pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú This is not an object‚Äù is a non-apprehension by the mind that arises from conceptualization.

original: de yang kun rdzob kho na yin par tha snyad gdags par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kho na yin par tha snyad gdags par rigs kyi /
translated: And that is only conventional, so it is reasonable to designate it as

original: yang dag pa ni ma yin te dmigs par bya ba rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgtan tshigs de bas na spong bar yang mi byed la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ni ma yin te dmigs par bya ba rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro // gtan tshigs de bas na spong bar yang mi byed la /
translated: It is not real, because the object of perception has been extensively refuted.

original: bsngags par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: bsngags par yang mi byed do //
translated: For this reason, one should neither reject nor praise.üîΩThis is the conclusion.

original: 'jam dpal de lta bas na gang dag phyag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi ched du ngas phyag rgya 'di bzhag ste zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de lta bas na gang dag phyag rgya 'dis btab pa de dag gi ched du ngas phyag rgya 'di bzhag ste zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: For their sake,

original: de dag gi ched du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi ched du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means for the sake of those,

original: de'i don dang de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: de'i don dang de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: and for that purpose, up to for that reason.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad la ste'u dang tsan dan la thugs mnyam pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad la ste'u dang tsan dan la thugs mnyam pa lta bu yin na /
translated: The Blessed One is like one who has the same attitude toward a thorn and sandalwood, toward all sentient beings.

original: ci'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i chos 'chad par brtson pa mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyi tshe ba'i chos 'chad par brtson pa mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he strive to teach the Dharma only to some?

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid chen po de dag ni chos gang la yang ston pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid chen po de dag ni chos gang la yang ston pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because those great beings do not teach any Dharma at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is said that they are nonconceptual.

original: chos gang la yang zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwith regard to any phenomenon‚Äù is continued here.

original: tshig ni rnam par rtog pa sngon du song ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig ni rnam par rtog pa sngon du song ba yin no //
translated: Words are preceded by conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par 'byung bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par 'byung bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not possible for them to occur without conceptualization. This is the meaning.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog cing mi 'chad pa yin nam /üîΩ'on te gtan tshigs gzhan zhig yod //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog cing mi 'chad pa yin nam / 'on te gtan tshigs gzhan zhig yod //
translated: This asks whether they are nonconceptual and inexpressible because they are devoid of the capacity to do so, or whether there is some other reason?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe de dag gzhan las bye brag cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas ci'i phyir de dag gi ched du gzhag go zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar yin na ni de'i tshe de dag gzhan las bye brag cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas ci'i phyir de dag gi ched du gzhag go zhes bya /
translated: If the first alternative is true, then since they are not in the least different from the others, why say ‚Äúthey are posited for the sake of those others‚Äù?

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni gtan tshigs gzhan @177b bstan pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na ni gtan tshigs gzhan @177b bstan pa med do zhe na /
translated: If the second alternative is true, then you have not presented any other reason.

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la dgongs pa yin no zhes dgongs nas gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i ched du /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la dgongs pa yin no zhes dgongs nas gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa'i ched du /
translated: With this in mind, in order to teach another reason,

original: 'jam dpal chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, all phenomena are ultimately unborn.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo 'chad pa thams cad ma skyes pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //üîΩde bas na de sgom pa la dga' ba rnams 'chad par mi byed /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang dmigs par bya ba rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo 'chad pa thams cad ma skyes pa yin no zhes bstan zin to // de bas na de sgom pa la dga' ba rnams 'chad par mi byed /
translated: It has been shown that all explanations, which are the imagined nature of the expressible and the apprehensible, are unborn.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, those who delight in meditating on that do not explain or conceive of it.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu chen po bdag shes pa de dag ni sman gyi ljon shing lta bu'i chos 'chad pa thun mong ma yin pa'i dgongs pas bsgrub pa dag gis kyang de dag la phan pa 'byung ba kho na yin pas de dag gi ched du gzhag go
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu chen po bdag shes pa de dag ni sman gyi ljon shing lta bu'i chos 'chad pa thun mong ma yin pa'i dgongs pas bsgrub pa dag gis kyang de dag la phan pa 'byung ba kho na yin pas de dag gi ched du gzhag go
translated: However, those who know the self as a great being, by means of the uncommon intention to establish the teaching that is like a medicinal tree, benefit from it. Therefore, it is taught for their sake.

original: zhes bya'o // stong pa nyid mchog gi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // stong pa nyid mchog gi dbang du byas te /
translated: With reference to supreme emptiness,

original: de dag ni chos gang yang spong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni chos gang yang spong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag thams cad brjod pa yin no //
translated: All of this is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThey do not reject any dharma‚Äù and so on.

original: klog pa la sogs pa tsam 'jug pa yang phyag rgya nyid yin no //
analyzed: klog pa la sogs pa tsam 'jug pa yang phyag rgya nyid yin no //
translated: The mere engagement in reading and so on is also a seal.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i mdo sde rin po che mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid bcom ldan 'das thugs dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i mdo sde rin po che mtha' dag gi de kho na nyid bcom ldan 'das thugs dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One was pleased and spoke thus with regard to the entire precious s≈´tra that was just taught, the thatness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji lta bu zhe na dgyes shing thugs dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na dgyes shing thugs dgyes pa'o //
translated: How so? He was pleased and delighted.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang 'dir bshad pa cung zad yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang 'dir bshad pa cung zad yod mod kyi /
translated: Although there are some explanations by others here,

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is due to the power of the Blessed One.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: With the youthful Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,

original: dang gi sgra ni phyi ma dag la yang ltos nas de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang gi sgra ni phyi ma dag la yang ltos nas de bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù is also seen in the following, in order to include him.

original: yang na snga ma la ltos pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na snga ma la ltos pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or it is only seen in the previous [line].

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs dgyes shing de skad ces bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One was pleased and spoke thus.

original: de bzhin du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang thugs dgyes shing de skad ces gsungs so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang thugs dgyes shing de skad ces gsungs so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Likewise, the youthful Manjushri was pleased and spoke thus.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma pham pa la sogs pa yang thugs dgyes pa'i tshig spros te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma pham pa la sogs pa yang thugs dgyes pa'i tshig spros te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those bodhisattva-mahasattvas, such as the noble Ajita, were also pleased and spoke thus.
